Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Orlith se dedica a la agricultura, ella tiene un pequeño cultivo de yuca, el cual con ayuda de su esposo dedican diversas labores de campo, adicionalmente tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su experiencia  y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Orlith se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos del mantenimiento, abono y cosecha de su cultivo, de esta manera Orlith podrá lograr que su cultivo se desarrolle adecuadamente y logre una buena venta, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ampliar sus cosechas y la variedad de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Orlith is 62 years old and she lives in Pucallpa with her husband and 4 older children. She is a friendly person, and hard working, as well as enthusiastic. Alongside her husband she has dedicated her efforts to giving her family a better tomorrow. Unfortunately, Orlith could not finish her secondary studies, but thanks to her hard work she was able to study for a career in sewing and in her free time she likes to cook a delicious meal called Sudado de Pescado to share with her family.
On her own initiative, and through hard work and determination, Orlith began working in agriculture. She has a small yuca field and with the help of her husband, they take care of the many different jobs required in the fields. Additionally, she has a small grocery business where she works everyday for around 10 hours and she believes that things are going well for her due to her experience and for the friendly service she provides.
Orlith is very thankful for the lenders at Kiva because it is thanks to their help she will be able to cover the maintenance costs, the purchase of fertilizer and also help to cover expenses of the harvest. In this way, Orlith will be able to see her crop grow and will be able to have better sales. And so, she will continue to work hard in order to achieve her dream of expanding her harvests and having a variety of crops.

loans.use: to cover maintenance costs and purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Elizabeth Violeta

texts.es:
Elizabeth es una mujer de 20 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y su pequeño hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeño, ya que ella es madre y padre para él; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Elizabeth pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Cosmetología, en sus ratos libres le gusta bailar y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos deliciosos postres para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Elizabeth trabaja en un salón de belleza brindando servicios de corte de cabello, maquillaje, manicura y otros, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su  buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Elizabeth se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de accesorios para desarrollar sus labores, como tijeras, tintes, guantes, mandiles, ganchos y otro, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propio salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 20-year-old woman. She lives in the city of Ica with her parents and her small son, who she loves and is her main reason for living. She is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic woman who focuses all of her efforts on raising her child since she is mother and father to him. Thanks to her efforts and the support of her parents, Elizabeth was able to study cosmetology. In her free time she likes to dance and sometimes she cooks some delicious desserts to share with her family.

Through her own initiative, with much determination and dedication, Elizabeth works in a beauty salon providing haircuts, makeup, manicures, and other services. She works every day for approximately 8 hours, and believes that it is going well for her because of her good performance and because of the kind treatment she provides to her customers.

Elizabeth is very appreciative to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help provided, she will be able to purchase accessories to expand her work, like scissors, dyes, gloves, aprons, hooks, and others.  She will therefore continue working and striving to achieve her great dream of having her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy accessories like scissors, dyes, gloves, aprons, hooks, etc.

loans.name: Los Trabajadores De Los Olivos De Pro Group

texts.es:
Este es el grupo "Los Trabajadores de Los Olivos de Pro", un grupo solidario y muy trabajador. La Sra. Socorro de 44 años es separada; pero fruto de su relación tiene 3 hijos que gracias a su arduo trabajo ha logrado sacar adelante. Su principal negocio es un pequeño restaurante donde sus principales clientes son amas de casa, gracias a este negocio ella puede mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Asimismo, por la noches ella se dedica a la venta de comida rápida a unos metros de su casa y es precisamente en esta actividad donde ella invirtió el préstamo para comprar mas insumos con los cuales prepara sus productos (Hamburguesas, pollos broaster, etc), además compró más platos descartables porque la demanda de este tipo de comidas esta creciendo por su zona. Ella agradece al equipo de Edaprospo y a todos los inversionistas de Kiva que la ayudan a que cada día pueda estar más cerca de su sueño que es tener un restaurante más grande.
*la Sra.Socorro es la que viste polo blanco,Y aparece al centro de la foto.
texts.en:
“Los Travajadores de Los Olivos de Pro” is a close-knit and hardworking group.

Sra. Socorro is 44 years old and separated from her spouse. Thanks to her hard work, she has been able to help her three children get ahead. Her main business is a small restaurant where most of her customers are homemakers. Thanks to this business, she has been able to improve her family’s quality of life. In the evenings, she sells fast food a few meters away from her house. Socorro plans to invest the loan into her second business by purchasing more supplies for preparing hamburgers, roasted chicken, and other fast food items. She will also buy more disposable plates because the demand for this type of food is growing in her area. Socorro is grateful to the EDAPROSPO team and all of the Kiva lenders who have helped her come closer to her dream of having a larger restaurant.

Sra. Socorro appears in the middle of the photo, wearing a white shirt.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and disposable plates.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raisins and boxes

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La cliente vive en Guayaquil, Tiene 27 años de edad. Ella empezó hace años vendiendo los cosméticos y ropa interior, pero más le gusto vender cosméticos ya que la gente le piden bastante y con eso a podido sacar adelante a su familia.

Ella se dedica actualmente a la venta de cosméticos, trabaja sola de 8:00 de la mañana, a las 18:00 de la tarde. Las dificultades que se le presentan en su negocio son su enfermedad lo cual en ocasiones  no le permite trabajar, y también la delincuencia.

Ella no tiene esposo, es madre soltera de 2 hijos y estudian en escuelas fiscales. 

Con el préstamo ella va a comprar materiales para poder tener más ingresos como perfumes, cremas, cadenas. Sus sueños son de seguir con su vida con la ayuda de Dios, completar los triunfos de sus hijos, poder tener un local comercial y suplir todas las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en:
This client is 27 years old and lives in Guayaquil. She began selling cosmetics and undergarments years ago. She enjoys selling cosmetics more because customers tend to order more of those products, which has allowed her to move her family forward.

The borrower currently sells cosmetics by herself from 8:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M. The difficulties she must face in her business include dealing with her illness, which prevents her from working on a few occasions. She is also concerned about crime. The borrower does not have a husband. She is a single mother of two children who are attending state schools.

With this loan, the borrower will buy more merchandise such as perfumes, crèmes, and chains so that she can generate more income. Her dreams include continuing her life with the help of God, helping her children become successful, owning a retail location, and providing for all of the household needs.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, crèmes, and chains.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene, a 43-year-old married mother of five children, three of whom are currently going to school, has been fattening pigs for sale in the Philippines for 19 years now. Having borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business, she has requested a new loan for PHP 10000 to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.es: Gumercinda, de 63 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora vive en compañía de su esposo Geremias, en la casa que heredaron desde hace 30 años. A pesar de su avanzada edad, ella junto a su esposo continúan trabajando en la agricultura, “me gusta mucho trabajar en el campo, me siento fuerte y con ganas de salir adelante ,además siembro de manera natural como nos enseñaron nuestros padres”, afirma. Sus principales sembríos constan de diversas hortalizas como: lechuga, espinaca, alverja y demás. En tiempos de cosecha los comercializa en su mismo terreno, “anteriormente viajaba a la ciudad de Lima a ofrecer mis productos , pero las fuerzas no son las mismas”, comenta. Ahora desea seguir trabajando para mejorar sus sembríos.Gumercinda, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos , a su vez se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual .
texts.en: Gumercinda is a hard-working 63-year-old woman. She lives in the company of her husband Geremias in the house that they inherited 30 years ago. In spite of her advanced age, she and her husband continue working in agriculture. "I really like working in the fields, I feel strong and want to get ahead, and also I plant in the natural way like our parents taught us to do," she says. Her main crops consist of various vegetables like: lettuce, spinach, peas and other things. At harvest times she sells them on her own land. "Previously I traveled to Lima to offer my products, but the forces aren't the same," she comments. At this time she wants to keep working in order to improve her crops. Gumercinda will invest the 1000 Peruvian nuevos soles in buying organic fertilizer in order to nurture her crops. In turn she commits to making payments in a punctual manner.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es:
Adolfo, es soltero y tiene un hijo, vive en casa de sus padres, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Alto Lima 2da Sección  de la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudió hasta el nivel secundario y actualmente se dedica Al servicio de transporte urbano.
El crédito lo requiere para compra de motor para una de sus movilidades, para que de esta manera brinde un mejor servicio a la población.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Adolfo is single and has one child. He lives at his parents’ house, which is located in the second section of the District of Alto Lima in the city of El Alto.

Adolfo has a secondary school education and currently works in the urban transportation sector. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy an engine for one of his vehicles. This will allow him to provide better service to the public.

This is the second time he has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy an engine for one of his vehicles.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos, está casado, tiene la edad de 62 años y vive con su esposa e hijas que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito pretende comprar los insumos como abonos y herbicidas para mejorar su plantación de tiquizque. El cuenta con el terreno ya sembrado y la plantación está en crecimiento. El tiene pensado asistirla para así poder aumentar la producción de tiquizque. El tiene como meta aumentar sus ganancias y poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y prosperidad. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Carlos is married, 62 years old, and lives with his wife and his daughters who are his top priority. With the loan, he plans to buy inputs such as fertilizer and herbicides to improve his Xanthosoma sagittifolium  (elephant ear) plantation. His land has already been sown and the plantation is growing. He plans to help it in order to be able to increase his production of elephant ear. He has as a goal to increase his profit and be able to provide his family with a better quality of life and prosperity. This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He had not had other loans before with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him a loan with better terms and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to improve his crop of Xanthosoma sagittifolium  (elephant ear).

loans.name: Jocelinda

texts.es: Jocelinda, de 26 años de edad, es una mujer ambiciosa y luchadora, vive con sus padres y su hermana Lisbet de 22 años, en su casa propia. Jocelinda se dedica a la agricultura ayudando a sus padres en la siembra de alverja, papa y hortalizas; ella va a supervisar los cultivos y negocia los precios en el mercado central de su ciudad; enviando hortalizas a la capital. Lo que más le gusta a Jocelinda es ayudar a su familia, pues su mayor deseo es ver a su hermana realizada y a sus padres tranquilos, ya que son ancianos y no tienen las mismas fuerzas de antes. Ahora quiere comprar su propio terreno y de esa manera poder cultivar mayor cantidad de hortalizas y abastecer la demanda que genera , además desea contratar trabajadores del lugar para que le apoyen constantemente dando un buen cuidado y mejoramiento a sus cultivos. Este es el cuarto crédito con KIVA y se siente agradecido por al apoyo financiero que recibe ,además se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas .Jocelinda, invertirá los S/. 1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: 26-year-old Jocelinda is an ambitious and determined woman. She lives with her parents and her 22-year-old sister Lisbet in their own home. Jocelinda works in agriculture, helping her parents cultivate peas, potatoes and vegetables. She supervises the crops and negotiates the prices in the central market of their city, sending vegetables to the capital. What Jocelinda most likes is helping her family, since her biggest desire is to see her sister fulfilled and her parents peaceful, seeing as they are older and do not have the same strength as before. Now she wants to buy her own land, and in this way be able to grow larger quantities of vegetables and meet the demand for them. In addition, she would like to hire local workers in order for them to provide her a constant support, taking good care and improving her crops. This is her fourth loan with Kiva, and she feels grateful for the financial support that she receives. In addition, she promises to be punctual in making her loan payments. Jocelinda will invest the 1000 new Peruvian soles in the purchase of organic fertilizer to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 54 años, vive con su esposo Benjamín y dos de sus hijos, en una casa propia que construyeron con adobe en un anexo rural.María es una mujer trabajadora y se dedica a la agricultura. Todos los días empieza el día rodeada de su familia para atenderlos y luego se dirige hacia sus cultivos donde siembra :arvejas, habas, maíz, papas, alfalfa ,entre otros. Está contenta con su trabajo porque sabe que todo lo que obtiene es fruto de su esfuerzo. Ahora tiene pendiente la cosecha de arvejas, las que después de cosecharlas, trasladará al mercado mayorista de su localidad. Lleva más de 30 años en esta actividad y menciona que es demasiado sacrificado pero tiene su recompensa, pues de esa manera logra educar a sus hijos. Ahora requiere de su apoyo, ya que tiene en mente sembrar 2 terrenos de arvejas.En esta oportunidas solicita S/.1000 soles para la compra de 2 bolsas de semillas de arvejas y asi continuar con su producción  ,de la misma forma se compromete en pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en: María is 54 years old, lives with her husband Benjamín and two of their children in a house they own that they constructed with adobe in a rural annex. María is a hard-working woman and she makes a living from agriculture. Every day she starts the day surrounded by her family in order to care for them and then she directs herself to her crops. She plants peas, lima beans, corn, potatoes, alfalfa, and other things. She is content with her work because she knows that everything she obtains in the fruit of her efforts. Now the harvest of peas is impending; after harvesting them, she will take them to the wholesale market in her area. She has been doing this for more than 30 years and she mentions that it is too much of a sacrifice but that it has its reward, as in this way she manages to educate her children. Now she requires your support, as she has in mind to plant 2 fields of peas. At this time she asks for 1000 Peruvian nuevos soles to buy 2 bags of pea seeds and thus continue with her production. She likewise commits to making payments in a punctual manner.

loans.use: to buy pea seeds

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village in the Moung Russey district of Cambodia, Ny is a 34-year-old married mother of three children, two of whom are in school. She and her husband are hard-working farmers who make a living growing rice. In business for 10 years, their daily income is about 28,000KHR, of which they can manage to save about 10,000KHR.

Ny has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one loan, since repaid, that helped the business. Now she is leading a group of three to request a new one. Ny will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and piglets for raising. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: María Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora maría Lourdes vive en un barrio  de la capital  muy conocida en su barrio por ser una persona amable, servicial tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa  para niño damas y caballeros, en su casa para ayudar en  los gastos de la familia.

La mayoría de sus clientes viven en los alrededores de su vivienda les oferta al crédito y al contado 
Está solicitando un crédito a kiva y ceprodel para invertirlo en compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio con ropa de verano.

Doña maría se siente agradecido  porque gracias a los créditos anteriore con ceprodel ha podido ir creciendo en su pequeño negocio y por ende su ganancia van mejorando cambiando así las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
María Lourdes lives in a neighborhood in the capital city. She is very well-known in her neighborhood for being a kind and helpful person. She has a small clothing store for children, ladies, and gentlemen, which she runs in her home to help with the family expenses.

The majority of her customers live near her home and she allows them to pay by credit or cash.

She is requesting a loan from Kiva and CEPRODEL in order to invest it in merchandise to stock her business with summer clothing.

Maria feels grateful because thanks to her previous loans with CEPRODEL she has been able to continue expanding her small business and as a result her profits will improve, thereby changing her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, and slippers.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo, de 24 años de edad,es soltero y vive en la casa de sus padres junto a sus hermanos. Trabaja a diario con mucho esfuerzo para forjar su futuro y conseguir sus metas.Wilfredo se dedica a la venta de comidas regionales por está razón tiene un pequeño local alquilado en donde atiende a sus clientes de manera gustosa. Trabaja con ayuda de su hermana y lleva en este negocio 03 años y afortunadamente las cosas están yendo por buen camino motivo por el cual se siente contento y tranquilo.Para el futuro espera tener un restaurante más amplio y consolidado en donde pueda vender todo el día sus platos de comida. Aunque ya ha ganado experiencia en éste trabajo siente que todavía le falta aprenderes por eso que desea seguir progresando para su bien personal y el de su familia. Este es el préstamo número 03 con Kiva, se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo para poder alcanzar sus objetivos.Con el monto solicitado de S/.1200 soles comprará ingredientes e insumos como pastas, arroz, pollo, etc. y un par de mesas más con sus respectivas sillas para continuar atendiendo a sus clientes .
texts.en:
Wilfredo, 24, is single and lives with his parents and siblings. He works hard every day to build a better future and reach his goals. Wilfredo sells traditional food and he rents a small establishment where he offers his customers a kind service, helped by his sister. He has had this business for three years, and he is doing well, fortunately, so he feels happy and has no worries. He hopes to have a larger and well-known restaurant in the future, where he can sell his food all day long.

Although he has gained some experience with this job, he feels that he still has more left to learn, and this is why he wants to get ahead, for his own and his family’s good. This is his third loan with Kiva and he appreciates the financial help he has received to reach his goals. With the requested amount, 1200 soles [PEN], he will buy ingredients and supplies like pasta, rice and chicken, and a couple of tables with their chairs to serve his customers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies for his restaurant.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es: Nelson, 42 años es un hombre trabajador. Vive en compañía de su esposa María y sus 2 hijos: Cristian y Luis a los que cuida en la casa que heredó hace 19 años. Desde hace 10 años empezó en el oficio de cerrajero, comenta que le fue muy difícil comenzar en este rubro pues en su pueblo no tenían la necesidad de remodelar sus puertas y ventanas. Pero poco a poco comenzó a tener clientes y actualmente lo contratan en cada construcción o remodelación para que fabrique y coloque los accesorios de metal. Su taller se ubica en su hogar , donde trabaja sin descanso hasta que termine sus pedidos. Ahora desea mejorar comprando más máquinas para así poder tener más pedidos. Este es el primer préstamo con KIVA, agradece el apoyo además promete ser puntual con sus cuotas.Nelson, invertirá los S/. 1500 soles en la compra de diversos materiales tales como acero , fierros , entre otros , para la elaboración de puertas y ventanas.
texts.en:
Nelson, 42, is a hard worker. He lives in the house he inherited 19 years ago with his wife María and two sons, Cristian and Luis, whom they care for. Ten years ago, he began working as a locksmith, a difficult profession to undertake in his town because there was little need to remodel doors and windows. Slowly, he built a client base, and now he is contracted to make and place the metal accessories in every building or remodeling project. His workshop is in his house, where he works without a break until he has finished his orders. 

He wants to improve his business and be able to fill more orders by buying better equipment. This is his first loan cycle with KIVA. He is grateful for the support and promises to make his payments on time. Nelson will use the S/. 1500 soles to buy a variety of materials such as steel and iron to make doors and windows.

loans.use: to buy materials to make doors and windows.

loans.name: Leang's Group

texts.en: Leang, 35 and married, is the mother of seven children. To deal with the daily cost of living, she grows rice and raises pigs as the main source of family income. For her involvement in the current business, she is able to earn up to 28,300 KHR per day.  Leang is the eight time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has completely repaid back her past loans, which have better supported her living properly. Now, she has formed a group of three to apply for a new loan. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to pay for plowing fees. She greatly hopes that she can improve her lifestyle in the near future.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Soy's Group

texts.en:
Soy, 28, lives in a rural area of the Sangke district of Battambang province and he is married with one daughter. The main family source of income is from farming rice on three-hectare farmland. He has been in this business for three years. He is able to earn about 57,000 KHR per day.

Soy has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the loans, which have helped him relieve his family's burden and improve their lives. Now he is leading his group of three to apply for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, he will use his portion to buy fertilizer for his farmland and use another portion of it to spend on gasoline for water pumping. With this loan, he hopes to make more income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farmland.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en: Catalina is 48 years old, and widowed with four children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a shoe repair business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for more than six years and earns 3,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2008 and now she has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional materials for shoe repair. She hopes and dreams to have a better future and to improve her family's living situation.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her shoe repair business.

loans.name: Maximina

texts.es: Maximina, de 45 años de edad , es madre soltera y vive en compañia de su unico hijo al que cuida con mucho amor y cariño en la casa de madera que construyó hace algunos años. Desde muy joven aprendió a trabajar en el campo pero su actividad principal es la tienda de comestibles que abrió en su localidad, actualmente tiene mucha venta ya que existe mucho comercio por su casa, “soy la única que se dedica a esta actividad, por ello tengo muchos clientes”, afirma. Ahora desea surtir con más alimentos su tienda y de esa manera poder aprovechar el movimiento comercial con más ingresos económicos. Este es el tercer crédito con KIVA, donde espera una vez más, el apoyo de todos ustedes. Está agradecida por el apoyo que recibe, por eso está segura que debe pagar puntualmente si quiere seguir progresando.Maximina, invertirá los S/. 1500 soles en la compra de comestibles de primera necesidad como arroz y azúcar, huevos y demás alimentos no perecibles; para su tienda.
texts.en:
Maximina, 45, is a single mother who lives with her only son, whom she lovingly cares for, in a wood house she built several years ago. She learned to work in the fields at a young age, but now she has a small grocery store in her neighborhood. Sales are very good because there is a lot of trade near her house. "I am the only doing this, so I have a lot of customers," she says. 

She wants to stock more grocery items in her store and take advantage of the traffic to increase her income. This is her third loan cycle with Kiva, and she is hoping for everyone's support once again. She appreciates the help she receives and knows she must make her payments on time if she wants to succeed. Maximina will use the S/. 1500 soles to buy food products like rice, sugar, eggs, and non-perishables to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy food products like rice, sugar, and eggs.

loans.name: Ynocente

texts.es:
Ynocente, de 48 años de edad, es casado y se caracteriza por ser un hombre sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Mila de 45 años y su único hijo Renzo de 16 años.Ynocente se dedica a la siembra de papa, espinaca y alverja ,todas las mañanas trabaja sus tierras para poderlas hacer más fértiles y productivas. Junto a su esposa trabajan muy duro, pues saben que cuidando con mucho esmero sus sembríos obtendrán mayores ingresos y así pagarán la educación de su hijo, ya que les demanda muchos gastos.
Lo que más le gusta de su labor es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas , lleva 32 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado de Tarma, que es donde vende sus cultivos. Dentro de unos días, espera cosechar espinaca y venderlo a buen precio en el mercado. Uno de los objetivos de Ynocente, es poder tener un negocio propio para que su esposa se quede en casa cuidando a sus hijos.Ynocente, invertirá los S/. 1500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos , además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Ynocente, 48, is married and lives with his wife Mila, 45, and their only son Renzo, 16, in their own house. He is known as a simple and hardworking man. Ynocente grows potato, spinach and green peas. He works his land every morning to make it fertile and productive. He and his wife work hard because they know that by taking good care of their crops, they will receive better income and will be able to pay for their son’s education, something that is expensive.

What Ynocente likes most about his job is to protect his crops from plagues. He has been working with this activity for 32 years and believes that the most difficult thing is to transport his produce to Tarma’s marketplace, where he sells them. In a few days, he is planning to sow spinach and sell it at a good price at the marketplace. One of his goals is to have his own business so his wife can stay home and take care of his son. Ynocente will invest the 1500 soles [PEN] in buying compost to nurture his crops. He promises to pay the installments on time.

loans.use: to buy compost for his crops.

loans.name: Las Fresas Del Algodonal Group

texts.es:
SANTIAGO TIENE 30 AÑOS ES SOLTERO Y VIVE CON SU MADRE,EL ESTUDIA ELECTRONICA Y REPARA ELECTRODOMESTICOS, TAMBIEN TOMA UN CURSO DE MANTENIMIENTO DE CELULARES. GRACIAS AL PRESTAMO QUE EDAPROSPO Y KIVA LE OTORGO AL GRUPO "LAS FRESAS DEL ALGODONAL" PUDO PONER SU PEQUEÑO LOCAL EN LAS MALVINAS DONDE TRABAJA DE LUNES A SABADO,SUS PRINCIPALES CLIENTES SON PERSONAS QUE BUSCAN ARREGLAR SUS CELULARES Y COMPRAR SUS ACCESORIOS.
Y SU DESEO ES SEGUIR EN EL GRUPO DONDE TODOS SE LLEVAN BIEN,Y ASI PODER HACER CRECER SU NEGOCIO Y SEGUIR APOYANDO A SU MADRE.
SANTIAGO DICE:"GRACIAS POR EL APOYO A MIS VECINOS Y A MI, POR QUE NOS AYUDAN A CRECER CADA DIA" 
SANTIAGO VISTE DE POLO VERDE Y JEANS CELESTE.
texts.en:
Santiago is 30 years old, single, and lives with his mother. He studies electronics and he repairs electric housewares. He also is taking a course on cell phone maintenance. Thanks to the loan with Edaprospo and Kiva, the group "Las fresas del algodon" (Cotton strawberries) was able to set up their little store in the Malvinas, where they work from Monday to Saturday. Their primary clients are people who are looking to fix their cell phones and to purchase accessories. 
Santiago wants to continue working with this group because they all get along and also wants to be able to grow their business and to continue supporting his mother. Santiago says "Thank you for the support for my neighbors, and for me, because you help us to grow every day." Santiago is in a green polo and blue jeans.

loans.use: expand their cell phone business.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is 55 years old and married with six children.

Cristita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items, like sardines, biscuits and other groceries needed for her business.

Cristita has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns income from selling vegetables.

Cristita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items, like sardines, biscuits and other groceries needed for her business.

loans.name: Leap's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of the Ek Phnom district, Leap is a 39-year-old single woman. The main sources of her family’s income are from rice farming, growing beans and raising cows, which Leap has been doing for ten years. With her current business, she can earn about KHR 80,000 per day, and she can save about KHR 17,000 each day after daily expenses.

This is the fourth loan for Leap with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Leap successfully paid back the loans with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group of three to apply for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy pig feeds for nourishing them. She hopes to fatten her pigs so as to sell them for a good price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pig feeds for nourishing them.

loans.name: Sherali

texts.ru: Шерали молодой, активный человек. Несмотря на свои годы, он знает все тонкости скотоводства. Он занимается откормом и разведением  скота. Шерали имеет 3 коровы и 6 баранов. Его жена доит корову и получает парное и вкусное молоко.  Продавая молоко, она получает доход, которое тратит на ежедневные расходы своего маленького ребёнка. Так как от скота Шерали получает сезонный доход, он также ремонтирует автомобили  и покрывает ежедневные расходы семьи.  На данный момент у него закончился корм для скота. Также хочет отремонтировать скотник к весне и подготовить летнее место для скота. Для этого ему необходима дополнительная сумма денег. Узнав об услугах МДО «Арванд» решил воспользоваться кредитом и воплотить свои планы в реальность. Очень надеется на поддержку со стороны «Кива» и заранее благодарит за содействие.
texts.en: Sherali is a young, active man.  Despite his age, he knows everything about raising livestock.  He fattens and breeds cattle.  Sherali has three cows and six sheep.  His wife milks the cows which provide fresh and delicious milk.  She sells this milk and uses the income to pay for the everyday expenses of their young child.  Livestock is one source of income for Sherali, but he also repairs automobiles to cover his family's expenses.  Presently, he has run out of feed for his livestock.  He also wants to make repairs to his barn in the spring and summer to prepare a place for his animals.  For this, he needs additional funds.  After finding out about Arvand's services, he decided to take out a loan in order to move forward with his plans.  He hopes for support from Kiva and is grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: to repair his barn and to purchase livestock feed

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa, de 49 años es una mujer alegre, es casada y vive en compañía de su esposo Gerardo y 3 de sus 8 hijos, a los que educa y cuida en la casa que compró hace 8 años. Luisa se dedica  a la venta de ropa aunque comenzó vendiendo como ambulante logro obtener el capital necesario para tener un espacio en la feria que se realiza el día domingo en su localidad, ahí aprovecha en vender todo lo necesario pues es él único día en donde todos los pobladores de los lugares mas cercanos van a realizar sus compras. Ahora desea comprar uniformes para poder aprovechar la campaña escolar y vender todos la ropa que pueda.Este es el primer préstamo con Kiva por esta razón agradece la oportunidad financiera que le ayudará a mejorar su negocio.
Luisa, invertirá los S/. 2000 soles en la compra de uniformes escolares para así poder vender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luisa, 49, is happy and married. She lives with her husband Gerardo and 3 of their 8 children, whom they educate and care for, in the house they bought eight years ago. Luisa sells clothing. Though she started out as a street vendor, she managed to raise the capital she needed to set up a space at the local Sunday fair. There she sells everything, as it is the only day the residents of nearby areas can shop. 

She wants to buy school uniforms to take advantage of the season and sell all the clothing she can. This is her first loan cycle with Kiva, and she is thankful to have funding that will help her grow her business. Luisa will use the S/. 2000 soles to buy school uniforms to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy school uniforms.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angélica, de 31 años es una mujer trabajadora, vive en compañía de su esposo Cesar y sus 2 hijos: Magaly y Fredy a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace 7 años. El trabajo que desarrolla Angelica es intenso, pues tiene que dedicar tiempo completo a la crianza de sus animales. Comenta que desde muy joven su esposo se dedicó a la comercialización de ganado, y cuando formaron su familia este fue su principal ingreso económico. Gracias al negocio de su esposo ella, puede obtener vacas a buen precio, posee 4 vacas lecheras y chivos de calidad. Comenta que una de ellas se encuentra preñada por lo que bajará la producción de leche que posee en la actualidad y como ella es muy inteligente, pensó en reemplazar a la vaca con una nueva, de esa manera no reducirá la producción y podrá mantener a la otra vaca en buenas condiciones para el parto.  Este es el primer crédito con KIVA, agradece el apoyo financiero pues necesita mejorar su ganadería ,además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas .Angélica, invertirá los S/.3800 soles en la compra de una nueva vaca, pues necesita mantener su producción de leche.
texts.en: Angélica is 31 years old, a hard working woman and lives with her husband, Cesar, and their 2 children: Magaly and Fredy. They care for their children in their home they bought 7 years ago.  Angélica has an intense job because she has to dedicate all her time to raising her animals. She says that ever since he was young her husband worked with cattle and when they formed their family together, this was their principal source of income. Thanks to her husband's business, she can get cows at a good price. She has 4 dairy cows and quality goats. She says that one of the cows is pregnant and so her milk production will decrease and she needs to supplement the reduction in milk production. Because she is intelligent, she thought that she could replace the pregnant cow with another one so she wouldn't have to worry about the reduction in milk production. She also promises to be punctual in her repayments. Angélica needs $1475 dollars to buy a new cow that she needs to maintain her milk production.

loans.use: purchase a cow.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: Hugo, de 49 años de edad , está casado u juntos tienen 3 hijos a los que cuida en la casa que heredó hace 3 años. Su trabajo es variado se dedica mayormente a la agricultura y ganadería como actividad secundaría. Afirma que gracias a sus padres hoy posee extensas hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas donde siembra diversos productos como: maíz, alverja y alfalfa, los cuales comercializa en la ciudad de Tarma, donde obtiene buenos ingresos económicos. Espera muy pronto poder aumentar el capital de trabajo que posee, pues desea sembrar en mayor cantidad de hectáreas y poder aprovechar las temporadas de mayor venta del maíz. Este es el tercer crédito con Kiva y se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas .Hugo, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Hugo, 49, is married and has three children that live in the house he inherited three years ago. He has different activities, but mainly agriculture and livestock farming. Hugo says that thanks to his parents, he has today large areas where he grows different crops, like corn, green peas and alfalfa, which he sells in the city of Tarma, making good profits.

Hugo hopes to soon be able to increase the working capital he has, now that he wants to sow more hectares and take advantage of the high seasons for corn. This is his third loan with Kiva and he promises to pay the installments on time. Hugo will invest the 1000 soles [PEN] in buying compost to nurture his crops.

loans.use: to buy compost for his crops.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 42 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school. Edna works very hard to provide for them.

Edna buys and sells nipa (woven palm mats used for house repair and construction) in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional palm mats to sell.

Edna has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Edna would like to save enough money so she can complete the education of her children and send them to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional palm mats for resale.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela works hard to support her family. Estela is a widow and has a business buying and selling nipa (woven palm mats used for house repair and construction) in the Philippines.

Estela requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional nipa to sell.

Estela has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Estela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional nipa (palm mats) for resale.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 29 years old, and married with two children who are in school. Analyn works very hard to provide for them.

Analyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell. She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items, such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Analyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase materials like wood, wood glue, nails, paint, etc. for her furniture making business.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials like wood, wood glue, nails, paint, etc.

loans.name: Glena

texts.en: Glena is 36 years old, married with four children. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates an agriculture business, which is making mats for sale to earn a living. She has been in her business for more than five years and earns 4,000 PHP every month. She has been with GDMPC since the 2009, and now she has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase raw materials for her business. She hopes and dreams to have a better future and improve her family's living situation.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for making mats.

loans.name: Asatillo

texts.ru: Асатилло мужчина проживающий в сельской местности. Женат  и воспитывает детей.  Супруга его в свое время не получила высшего образования, по той причине, что были трудности в финансовом плане. А потом когда была возможность выучиться, ей было не удобно, т.к.она была старше по возрасту среди студентов. Зато она сейчас воспитывает замечательных детей, параллельно помогает своему мужу. Асатилло на протяжении многих лет занимается животноводством. Закупает скот, откармливает, затем закалывает его и продает на местном рынке. Свой скот он кормит достаточно хорошо, не жалея ни сил, ни корма. С того момента как он начал заниматься этим делом и по сегодняшний день у него много покупателей на мясо.  По мимо мяса, он продаёт молочные продукты (молоко, кефир,сметана). У него хороший доход от крупнорогатого скота. Асатилло, обратился в МДО « Арванд» за кредитом. На полученный кредит он планирует закупить скот, чтобы увеличить свой доход. Он выражает благодарность Арванд за содействие и огромную роль в его жизни.
texts.en: Asatillo is married, a father, and lives in a rural area.  When his wife was meant to start her higher education, she was not able to due to financial limitations.  When the opportunity finally materialized, she felt uncomfortable returning to school since she was older than the other students.  So now she raises their wonderful children and helps her husband.  Asatillo has worked with livestock for many years.  He buys the animals, fattens and slaughters them, and sells at a local market.  He treats his livestock well and isn't stingy with his efforts or his feed.  From the time he started his business, and continuing on to the present day, he has had many customers for his meat.  Besides the meat, he also sells dairy products (milk, yogurt, sour cream).  He receives a good income from his livestock.  Asatillo has turned to Arvand for a loan.  With these funds, he plans to buy livestock that will increase his income.  He is grateful to Arvand for the assistance and the big role Arvand plays in his life.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento NUEVO AMANECER está compuesto por nueve integrantes, siete mujeres y dos varones, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Jean tiene 25 años, tiene tres hijos que son de las edades de 5, 3 y 7años,  ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, ella es   panadera desde hace 5 años, su panadería se encuentra en la zona de Nuevo Amanecer de ahí el nombre del grupo,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Jean utilizara este préstamo para la compra de insumos como harina, levadura y manteca para la elaboración de pan su razón para solicitar este préstamo es compra de insumos por mayor ya que es más barato comprar por cantidad, la Sra. Jean enfrenta retos en su negocio que son tener más clientela y así de esta manera generar más ingresos y  va a utilizar los beneficios en brindar  una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, la Sra. Jean se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado a ella y a todas sus compañeras de grupo ya que son personas que trabajan duro para sacar adelante a sus familias.
texts.en:
The communal bank NUEVO AMANECER (New Dawn) comprises nine members, seven women and two men. Jean, 25, is president of the bank and has three children, ages 5, 3, and 7. She makes bread and has been a baker for five years. Her bakery is in Nuevo Amanecer, for which the group named itself. This will be the group's first loan cycle with the institution, and Jean will use the money to buy supplies like flour, yeast, and shortening to make bread. She needs the loan to buy wholesale supplies, since it is cheaper to buy in large quantities.

The challenges Jean faces in her business are attracting more customers and earning more income. She will use her earnings to offer her family a better life. Jean is happy and grateful to the institution for its support of her and all the members, as they work hard to provide for their families.

loans.use: to buy supplies like flour, yeast, and shortening.

loans.name: Flavio

texts.en:
This loan will help Flavio purchase needed equipment in time to expand his menu and offer smoothies by the summer.

After moving from Colombia to Miami, Flavio opened the Yellow Submarine, a food truck specializing in homemade burgers and hot dogs. However, when his truck began having maintenance issues, Flavio decided it was time for a change of pace. He sold his food truck and invested all the sales into his current restaurant, Rock that Burger. Today his location is a popular spot for all ages and Flavio is excited to continue to grow his menu to attract more clients. He hopes to put a veggie burger on the menu soon.

Flavio now needs a loan to purchase necessary equipment for the restaurant including a smoothie machine, a new refrigerator compressor, and an oven. Flavio hopes to purchase all of these pieces in time to add smoothies to his menu by summer.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment for his restaurant

loans.name: Palmira

texts.es: Palmira, de 45 años, está divorciada y tiene 02 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia.El trabajo de Palmira consiste en la venta diaria de gaseosas, agua mineral y jugos envasados de distintas marcas y sabores. Tiene un pequeño puesto de ventas instalado en su casa y desde alli atiende a sus clientes , quienes en su mayoría son sus vecinos . Lleva más de 02 años en está actividad y le va bien. En ocasiones a compartido esta actividad con la venta de algunos productos regionales como plátano, yuca o limones, las ganancias que este trabajo le ha brindado han sido muy buenas es por eso que quiere retomarlo y dedicarse permanentemente a ambas actividades , el cual requiere de cierto capital para poder emprender esta nueva etapa.Le esta yendo muy bien en este negocio porque sus ganancias han aumentado gracias a la clientela que ha logrado consolidar con el paso de los años, anhela que su economía mejore aún más ya que desea vender nuevamente productos regionales .Este es el préstamo número 03 con Kiva, agradece a aquellas personas que le brindan el apoyo financiero que requiere para aumentar su capital de trabajo, a su vez se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas .Con el monto solicitado de S/.1200 soles comprará bebidas gaseficadas al por mayor, jugos envasados y agua mineral además comprará diversos productos regionales como plátano y yuca.
texts.en:
Palmira is 45 years old, divorced, and has 2 children she lives with in their own home. Palmira's work consists of daily sales of sodas, mineral water, and bottled juices of different brands and flavors. She has a small sales post installed in her home and she attends to her clients from there, the majority of whom are her neighbors. She has had this business for more than 2 years and it is going well.

At times she has complemented this business with the sale of some regional products like plantain, cassava or limes. The earnings provided by this work have been very good. Because of this she wants to do it again and permanently dedicate herself to both activities, which requires a certain amount of capital to be able to undertake this new phase. She is doing well in this business because her earnings have increased thanks to the clientele she has managed to amass with the passing years. She longs for her finances to improve even more as she wants to sell regional products again.

This is her third loan with Kiva. She thanks those people who have provided her with the financial support she requires to increase her working capital. In turn she commits to making her payments in a punctual manner. With the requested amount of 1200 Peruvian nuevos soles she will buy soft drinks wholesale, bottled juices and mineral water, in addition to various regional products like plantain and cassava.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and regional products

loans.name: Nueva Vida Group

texts.es:
Alejandra es soltera y vive con sus padres ella tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de pan dice que hace diferentes tipos de pan pero lo que más se le vende son las conchas, cuernitos y las teleras, desde muy temprana hora se levanta junto con sus padres a elaborar el delicioso pan como a las 4 de la mañana después cuando ya se encuentra  hecho el pan sale con sus canastos a vender el pan a la población de Zitacuaro en frente de la central de autobuses y la central de abastos de esa población. Dice que desde muy chica sus padres le enseñaron a elaborar el pan y como ya no siguió estudiando se dedico ayudarles a sus padres a elaborar y vender el pan, dice que desde hace 7 años se independizo y hace su propio pan y ella lo sale a vender aunque su papa le presta el horno pero ella compra aparte su leña y sus insumos para elaborarlo. Ella está pidiendo a Visión Fund un crédito para mejorar su negocio y para comprar los insumos que ocupa para hacer el pan dice que si le dan el crédito comprara harina, mantequilla, huevo, leche, leña, azúcar, colorantes, natas ya que hace huevo en diferentes sabores, levadura etc. Dice que le gustaría recibir rápido su préstamo para asi hacer un poco mas de pan, dice que esta  muy contenta de trabajar con su grupo llamado Nueva Vida porque es un grupo que cumple y que tiene los pagos a tiempo, además que cuando alguien no tiene para el crédito se apoyan entre todos para ayudar a la persona que no puede hacer su crédito, aunque no es seguido que pase eso porque todos son cumplidos. Los demás integrantes del grupo se llaman Marivel, Laura, María del Rocio, Rocío del Carmen, Gerardo Ángel, Alejandro, María Catalina, María Elena, Ofelia y Francisco ellos invertirán sus créditos en la compra de insumos para hacer y vender tortillas a mano, en la compra de colchas y sabanas por catalogo para su venta, en dulces para su venta, en una tienda de abarrotes, en la compra de piezas para dar mantenimiento de una combi de transporte público, en la compra de elotes e insumos para prepararlos para su venta.

*In the picture: at the back of the lady in red, her daughter, who is not a member of the group.
texts.en:
Alejandra is single and lives with her parents. She has a bakery business making bread. She makes all different kinds of bread, but what she sells the most are conchas (a kind of sweet bread), croissants and rolls. She gets up very early in the morning (4am) with her parents in order to make her delicious breads and when the bread is ready, she puts it in baskets to sell to the people of Zitacuaro, at the central bus station and the central area to purchase groceries. She says that every since she was small, her parents taught her how to make bread and since she wasn't able to go to more school, she decided to help her parents make and sell bread. She says that 7 years ago she branched out on her own and now she makes her own bread and she sells it on her own. And even though her father lets her use his oven, she buys her own firewood and supplies to make her bread. 

She is asking for a loan with Visión Fund in order to improve her business and to purchase more supplies she needs in order to make bread. If she gets the loan, she will use it to purchase flour, butter, egg, milk, sugar, colorings and creams since she makes breads with different flavors and different leavening. She says that she would like to get the loan as soon as possible so that she can make more bread. She says she is happy working with the group Nueva Vida (New Life) because it is a group that gets things done and repays their loans on time, also, when one group member can't make their loan payment, the group comes together to find the funds to help that individual. 
 
The other members of the group are Marivel, Laura, María del Rocio, Rocío del Carmen, Gerardo Ángel, Alejandro, María Catalina, María Elena, Ofelia and Francisco, they will invest their loans in purchasing supplies to make and sell hand-made tortillas, purchase mattresses and sheets, candies to resell in a grocery store, to purchase parts to maintain a public transportation vehicle and to purchase sweet corn and supplies to prepare the corn and sell it. 



*In the picture: behind the lady in red is her daughter who is not a member of the group.

loans.use: purchase flour, butter, eggs, milk, firewood, sugar, colorings and creams.

loans.name: Mahmudhuja

texts.ru: Мухмудхуча, проживает в г.Исфара в сельской местности. Женат и имеет троих детей. Ему 30 лет. По семейным обстоятельствам Махмудхуча не смог получить высшее образование, так как с самого детства в его семье были трудности в сфере финансов. После окончания школы, он пошел помогать своему знакомому по выпечки лепешек. Сначала был снабженцем, закупал муку, масло и другие необходимое сырье для лепешек.  Его наставник (учитель) увидел в нем желание работать совместно. Он предложил ему это, Махмудхуча не отказался. Он был очень рад, что хоть как-то сможет приносить свой доход в семью. Спустя время совместной работы Махмудхуча снял помещение в аренду для выпечки лепешек. Было тяжело, так как первоначальный капитал он потратил на аренду помещения. Но он не унывал, старался работать с утра до глубокой ночи. На сегодняшний день его лепешки пользуются большим спросом. Маухмудхуча обратился в МДО «Арванд» за кредитом, на полученный кредит он собирается купить сырье для  лепешек и тем самым увеличить количество выпекаемых лепешек. Он очень благодарен организации Арванд за финансовую поддержку и понимание.
texts.en: Mahmudhuja lives in a rural village called Isfara.  He's thirty years old, married and has three children.  He was not able to receive a higher education since his family has dealt with financial hardship since his childhood.  After he finished school, he began working with an acquaintance who worked baking cakes.  Initially, he worked a supplier, buying flour, oil, and other necessary ingredients for cakes.  His mentor saw that Mahmudhuja had a desire work together so he invited him to do so.  Mahmudhuja didn't refuse the offer.  He was very happy to be able to increase his family's income.  After some time working together, Mahmudhuja rented a building from which to sell their goods.  This was difficult since he was required to use his initial capital on rent.  However, he was not discouraged and tried to work from morning until late into the night.  Today, his cakes are in high demand.  Mahmudhuja has turned to Arvand for a loan in order to buy more of the raw ingredients he needs to increase his production.  He is grateful to Arvand for the financial support and understanding.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for baking

loans.name: Horm's Group

texts.en:
Horm is 42 years old and married. She is a mother of four children, some of whom are still in school. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming, raising cows and supplementing their family’s income by fishing. Her family’s daily income is about 50,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.  

Horm’s group consists of three female members who live in the same village in the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. She is a six-cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Horm, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fishing material for her fishing business. She hopes to catch more fish to sell for a good price to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fishing materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Sambou's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Ek Phnom district in Battambang Province, Sambou is a 33-year-old married woman with three kids, all still in school. She is a rice farmer and her husband is a fisherman. They have had that job for 10 years, and it supports her family as the main source of income. From her current businesses, she is able to earn about KHR 54,000 per day.

Sambou has been with VisionFund for three times and successfully repaid all her loans. The past loans have helped her to improve her standard of living. In a confident manner, she is leading a group of three to request a new loan. Sambou will use her loan to buy a fish trap to support her fishing business. She hopes to earn more income from her current business to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy a fish trap

loans.name: Oerm's Group

texts.en:
Oerm is 58 and married. She lives in a rural area located in the Sangke district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has four children. Oerm and her husband have been involved in growing chilies and rice to earn a living for 30 years. She also raises cows to earn additional income for her family.
This is the fourth micro loan for Oerm’s group of two with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The past loans have helped her earn a better living. She is now leading her group to request a loan that she will use to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her cultivated land. Oerm hopes this loan will enable her to make more income from her current business to achieve a standard lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is 65 years old and married with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Lucita has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like rice grains, snack foods, soft drinks and other groceries.

Lucita has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more items like rice grains, snack foods, soft drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 41 years old and married with four children.

Gloria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy stocks of goods to sell like soap, canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, eggs, etc..

Gloria has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns income from fattening pigs.

Gloria aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy stocks of goods for resale, like soap, canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Subhon

texts.ru: Субхон живёт в г.Исфара, женат и имеет одного ребенка. Ему 40 лет . В связи с семейными обстоятельствами  Субхон не смог получить высшее  образование так как с детства в его семье были финансовые проблемы. Он пошел по стопам своего отца. С ранних лет помогал своему отцу по выпечки и  продаже лепешек на рынке. С 1991 г. самостоятельно занимается этим производством. Поначалу ему было очень трудно так как он  нуждался в денежных средствах по совету знакомых  он решил  получить   кредит Арванд. У него  большие планы на будущее, он очень хочет, чтобы его ребенок учился в высшом учебном заведении и поэтому старается  делать все, чтобы добиться своей цели.  Субхон очень благодарен организации  Арванд, так как с помощью таких организаций люди, имеющие финансовые проблемы могут осуществить свои планы.
texts.en: Subhon lives in Isfara, he's married, forty years old, and has one child.  He was not able to receive a higher education since his family has faced financial hardship since he was young.  He followed in the footsteps of his father.  As a boy, he helped his dad with baking and selling cakes at market.  In 1991, he began baking independently.  Initially, it was very difficult since he needed capital.  He was advised by friends to take a loan out with Arvand.  He has big plans for the future.  Because he wants his child to have a higher education he tries to do everything he needs to to make this goal happen.  Subhon is very grateful for Arvand since the organization helps those with financial difficulties carry out their plans.

loans.use: to increase turnover

loans.name: Gardenias Group

texts.es: Lucina tiene 38 años de edad, está casada con el señor Eduardo, ella tiene dos niños, el mayor está patrocinado por World Vision Mexico. Desde hace dos años, Lucina está a cargo de la cooperativa escolar de la primaria de su comunidad. El pueblo es un lugar indígena, localizado en los limites de Michoacán con el Estado de México, un lugar pintoresco y con unos hermosos paisajes que se pueden ver alrededor de la comunidad. Platica que  ella en la cooperativa se dedica a realizar almuerzos y comidas, también antojitos mexicanos como tacos, quesadillas, enchiladas, pambazos y aguas de sabor las cuales vende a los alumnos y maestros de la escuela primaria. Dice que ella va a surtir los insumos que ocupa en la ciudad de Zitacuaro ya que en la central de abastos encuentra mejores precios y así ella le puede ganar algo, también dice que vende dulces y refrescos de diferentes sabores y que está pidiendo un crédito para la compra de insumos para hacer las comidas y los antojitos que  les vende a sus niños de la escuela, platica que desde un día antes ella se pone a cocer la carne y hacer las salsas y a rebanar el jitomate, cebolla y lechuga y desinfectarlos para que al otro día a muy temprana hora se pone hacer los guisados y los antojitos para que a las 9.30 a la hora del receso ella esté lista con lo que vende, también les vende a la hora de la comida como a las 2 de la tarde y a las 4 pm que es el receso de los niños del turno vespertino. Dice que tiene dos muchachas que le ayudan a atender porque ella sola no se da abasto. Agradece que le hagan el crédito porque así tendrá surtido su tienda y tendrá insumos para hacer lo de la comida. las demas integrantes del grupo se llaman Domitila, Gabriela, Eriqueta, Martha, Laura, Sebastiana, Ivon e Hilda ellas invertiran sus creditos en la compra de insumos para elaborar antojitos mexicanos, para la compra de material para bordar manteles, servilletas y venderlas, para la compra de borregos y alimento de estos para criarlos y despues venderlos, para la compra de articulos para surtir tienda de abarrotes y para la compra de alimento para gallinas y guajolotes para criarlos y depues venderlos.
texts.en:
Lucina, 38, is married to Eduardo and has two children. Her oldest child is sponsored by World Vision Mexico. For two years, Lucina has been working for the cooperative primary school in her community. Her town is located in an indigenous area within the limits of the state of Michoacán, Mexico, a beautiful place with pretty landscapes that can be seen surrounding the community. 

She says that in the cooperative, she makes lunches as well as Mexican "antojitos" (corn-based snacks) such as tacos, quesadillas, enchiladas, pambazos, and flavored water, which she sells to students and teachers at the primary school. She says that she is going to stock up with the ingredients she buys in the city of Zitacuaro, because in the central supply store she can find better prices and then earn a profit. She also says that she sells sweets and soft drinks in different flavors, and that she is applying for this loan to buy ingredients to make the food and "antojitos" which she will sell to the schoolchildren. 

She says that she cooks the meat, makes sauces and slices and disinfects tomatoes, onions, and lettuce one day early. Very early the next day, she makes the stews and antojitos so that she can be ready to sell her food during the recess at 9:30. She also sells food during the lunch hour, at 2pm, and during the recess for students in the evening shift at 4pm. She says that she has two girls who help her to serve the food because she can't keep up by herself. She is grateful for this loan because she can stock her business and she will have the ingredients to make her food. 

The other members of the group are Domitila, Gabriela, Eriqueta, Martha, Laura, Sebastiana, Ivon and Hilda. They will use this loan to buy ingredients for Mexican antojitos, to buy materials to embroider tablecloths and napkins to sell, to buy sheep and the feed to raise and sell them, to buy goods to stock a grocery store, and to buy feed for chickens and turkeys to raise and sell them.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make Mexican food and snacks.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 65 años, esta divorciada y tiene un hijo,actualmente vive sola en su domicilio propio, construido hace muchos años por su ex esposo. Juana se dedica al cultivo de maíz, papa y arveja, en los terrenos que le heredaron sus padres. Ella trabaja sola, lo que más le gusta es sembrar alfalfa porque después de cortarlos, vuelve a crecer mucho más y puede durar 3 años con buena producción, “tienes que regarlos cada 8 días”, comenta. A la vez cría 150 cuyes en su vivienda, que vende al por mayor para consumo humano. Según cuenta está vez vendió un buena cantidad de ellos por lo que pudo pagar sus cuentas. Como sus actividades son bastante rentables, está pensando vivir con su nieto Marco de 15 años, por ello piensa dedicarse al negocio de la venta de alfalfa y de cuy pues quiere apoyarlo con los gastos de sus estudios. Éste mes es importante para la siembra de arvejas, por ello requiere de su ayuda.Destinará los 2000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para sus cultivos de maíz, y para iniciar una siembra de arvejas.
texts.en:
Juana, 65, is divorced and has one son. She currently lives alone in her own home, constructed many years ago by her ex-husband. Juana makes a living cultivating corn, potatoes, and peas on the land which she inherited from her parents. She works alone. She likes planting alfalfa the most because after cutting the plants, they grow much more and they can last 3 years with good production. "You have to water them every 8 days," she says. At the same time she is raising 150 guinea pigs in her home, which she sells wholesale for human consumption. She says that this time she sold a good quantity of them, so she could pay her bills. 

As her business is fairly profitable, she is thinking about living with her 15-year-old grandson, Marco. Therefore, she is thinking about dedicating herself to the business of selling alfalfa and guinea pigs, because she wants to support him with the expenses of his studies. This month is the most important for planting peas, so she needs your help. She will use these 2000 Peruvian soles to buy organic fertilizer for her corn crops and to start planting peas.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Genelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business making nipa (woven palm mats used for house repair and construction) in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Genelyn is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business, like nipa leaves and bamboo.

Genelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business like nipa leaves and bamboo.

loans.name: Sunnary's Group

texts.en:
Sunnary is a 61-year-old resident from the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. She is widowed and has four children. She earns an income for her family's sake. She has farmed rice for 40 years. She is able to earn about 70,000 KHR per day. 

Sunnary has had one previous loan with VisionFund and has completely repaid the loan. The past loan has helped her to manage her business well and maintain a good standard of living for her family. She has now formed a group of three to request a new loan. As the group leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan to buy rice seeds for her farm. She hopes to get a high yield from her rice paddy farm so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds for her farm.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is 28 years old and married with two children. He lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. He owns and operates a fish vending business in the local community to earn a living. He has been in his business for over five years and earn 8,000 PHP every month. He has been with GDMPC since 2010. And now he he has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. He hopes and dreams to have a better future and improve his living situation.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Nonima

texts.en:
Nonima is 60 years old, married and has nine children. 

Nonima is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nonima has been raising pigs for 30 years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Nonima would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es: Magdalena de 36 años de edad , esta casada con Marcelino , con quien tiene 3 hijos y juntos residen en una vivienda construida a base de Material noble .Magdalena tiene una tienda de comestibles desde hace 3 años en un ambiente de su domicilio recién culminado. Teniendo como apoyo principal a sus tres menores hijos, viene desempeñándose con bastante motivación ya que ha notado que su negocio tiene tendencia a crecer de tal manera que planea ampliarlo lo mas pronto posible. Considera que uno de los factores que ayudan al culminar el día con buenas ganancias es el trato y confianza que ella brinda a sus clientes, pues gracias a ello a logrado hacerse muy conocida y a la vez querida en su localidad.Dentro de los productos mas consumidos en su negocio están las conservas y menestras, adicionando a ello los productos de uso diario como el arroz, azúcar, huevos, etc. Este es su Primer préstamo  con Kiva motivo por el cual se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero brindado,razón por la cual se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual .Con los S/.4,000  soles comprará más productos comestibles tales como arroz , azucar , conservas enlatadas , entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Magdalena, 36, is married to Marcelino, with whom she has three children. They live together in a home made of good-quality materials. 

For three years, Magdalena has had a grocery store in a recently finished part of her home. With the support of her three young children, she has been working with plenty of motivation, because she has noticed that her business has been growing and she plans to expand it as soon as possible. 

She believes that one of the factors which helps her to finish the day with a good profit is the friendly treatment and confidence that she extends to her clients. Thanks to this, she has managed to make herself very well-known and beloved in her town. Among the most popular products in her business are canned goods and vegetable stew, as well as daily goods such as rice, sugar, eggs, etc. 

This is her first loan with Kiva, so she is very happy to have been offered this financial support and she is committed to paying her fees on time. With the amount of 4,000 Peruvian soles, she will buy more goods such as rice, sugar, and canned goods, among other products.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, sugar, and milk, among others.

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
17 son las mujeres que integran el grupo llamado san jose, quienes se encuentran en su ciclo número 11 gracias al trabajo que vienen haciendo y han demostrado gran unión y ganas de salir adelante. Esta haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, que muestra que 3 de las miembros están por debajo de la línea de la pobreza.
Una de las miembros es Venancia, quien esta en el nivel dos de eliminación de pobreza, ella cuenta que se dedica a las ventas, ya que tiene una despensa, mercería, también se debe destacar el trabajo esfuerzo que ella hace por salir adelante y ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de Productos para su negocio, como ser arroz, azúcar, productos a granel, ya que son los que más venta tiene, ya que quiere poder seguir con sus ventas y crecer con su negocio.
texts.en:
Seventeen women make up the group called "San Jose," which is in its 11th loan cycle, thanks to the work they continue to do, and to the fact that they have demonstrated great unity and a great desire to get ahead. The poverty elimination survey is being carried out, and it shows that three of the members are below the poverty line. 

One of the members is Venancia, who is at level two on the poverty elimination scale. She reports that she works as a merchant, since she has a neighborhood grocery store and a shop selling sewing supplies. The work and effort she makes to get ahead and help her family through her work are noteworthy. 

She is requesting this loan to buy products for her business, such as rice, sugar and bulk goods, which are her best-selling products. She wants to be able to continue with her sales and grow with her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, bulk goods, etc.

loans.name: Lester Jeovani

texts.es:
Lester es originario de la Ciudad de Somotillo, Soltero, responsable, trabajador, de buenas costumbres, social.

 Se desempeña como taxista en la Ciudad de Somotillo donde se lleva muy bien con sus clientes. 

Actualmente se presento a Ceprodel a solicitar un préstamo, para completar la compra de otro vehículo y de esta manera brindar un mejor su servicio a sus clientes de igual manera incrementar su capital económico.
texts.en:
Lester is originally from the city of Somotillo. He is single, responsible, hardworking, well-mannered, and social. Lester works as a taxi driver in the city of Somotillo and is doing very well with his customers.

He approached CEPRODEL to request a loan so that he could complete the purchase of another vehicle. This would allow him to provide better service to his customers and increase his financial capital at the same time.

loans.use: to complete the purchase of another taxi.

loans.name: Carolina Gabriela

texts.es:
Carolina es una joven de 19 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar para ayudar a sus padres, Carolina no ha podido culminar sus estudios como Diseñadora Grafica, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Causa Rellena para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Carolina trabaja como mesera en una pollería de su ciudad, ella brinda atención al público y puede trabajar por un aproximado de 10 horas, Carolina cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y honradez.
Carolina se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una cama y un colchón, los cuales le servirán de mucho, ya que actualmente ella y su pequeño hermano comparten la misma cama, de esta manera ella desea brindar mejorar en algo las condiciones de vida de ella y su familia, así pues Carolina seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder culminar sus estudios profesionales y así junto a su familia desea salir adelante.
texts.en:
Carolina is a 19 year old young woman.  She lives with her parents and her siblings in the city of Nazca.  She is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic person.  She has a great desire to improve herself.  Sadly, due to the lack of financial resources and the need to work to help her parents, Carolina has not been able to complete her studies as a graphic designer.

In her free time she likes to watch television.  Sometimes she makes the delicious ‘Causa Rellena’ [layered potato dish that's made with yellow potatoes and either chicken or tuna salad] to share with her family.
