Dora is very happy and grateful to this institution for the help it has provided her, and is also very grateful for the other members of her group, all of whom are working very hard to get their families ahead.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk

loans.name: Existosas Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento EXISTOSAS  está compuesto por nueve integrantes, todas mujeres, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Hortensia tiene tres hijos de las edades de, 7, 5 y tres años, ella se dedica  a la venta de comida, ella no tiene un puesto fijo, ya que entrega sus almuerzos a distintos puestos del mercado donde ella vende, la Sra. Hortensia es una persona muy trabajadora  que con dedicación poco a poco va adquiriendo estabilidad y solvencia y también popularidad por que es muy conocida por sus clientes ya que la Sra. Hortensia les atiende muy amablemente,  con el dinero del crédito comprara insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas como abarrotes y aceite por mayor, la cliente cuenta que con mucho esfuerzo se puede crecer más y así seguir haciéndose de patrimonio para el bienestar de su familia y también personal, el deseo de la Sra. Hortensia es poder tener un puesto fijo ya que esto le haría crecer más en su negocio y por ende mejorar sus ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
The communal bank group "EXITOSAS" is composed of 9 members, all women. The President of this group is Hortensia, who has three children ages 7, 5 and 3 years of age. Hortensia works selling food, but does not have a fixed stand from which she sells. She delivers her food to different posts in the market, where others help her sell directly to consumers. 

Hortensia is a very hardworking person, who through much dedication has been improving her stability and solvency. Additionally, the popularity of her food has been growing and she is now very well known and liked by her clients. With the money that she makes she will continue to grow her business, always investing in order to improve the well-being of her family. Hortensia's dream is to have her own fixed market stand one day, which would enable her to grow her business and improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy goods for food preparation

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Salvacion is 43 years old and has one child who is in school.

Salvacion has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a 16000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Salvacion has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Salvacion would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. Teresita is married and has a crab vending business in the Philippines.

Teresita requested a 9000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more crabs to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for 9 years now.

In the future, Teresita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more crabs to sell.

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es: Olinda tiene 38 años de edad,está casada con Walter con quien tiene dos hijos; de 15 y 2 años de edad respectivamente.  Olinda y su familia viven en la casa de su tía, ubicada en un caserío rural.Olinda se dedica a la agricultura y cuenta con terrenos propios donde siembra arvejas, papas y maíz. Olinda cuenta que a veces en la siembra de maíz sólo recupera lo invertido, “eso se debe a las heladas y enfermedades”, agrega; pero con las arvejas no tiene quejas. Adicionalmente, obtiene más ingresos por la venta de cuyes, pues hace 5 años se dedica a la crianza de estos animalitos. Ahora Olinda llevará a su hijo mayor hacia la ciudad de Lima para que empiece a estudiar allá, por eso trabaja con mucho esfuerzo para lograr sus metas. Éste mes iniciará una siembra de arvejas, por ello requiere de su ayuda.Éste es su crédito número 6 con Kiva y se siente muy comprometida de pagar las cuotas mensuales a tiempo. Olinda invertirá los S/. 2,000 soles en la compra de semillas de arvejas.
texts.en: Olinda is 38 years old, and together with her husband Walter has two children - 15 and 2 years of age. Olinda and her family live in her Aunt's house, located on a rural farm. Olinda works in agriculture, and has some of her own land where she plants peas, potatoes and corn. Olinda tells us that sometimes with her corn harvest she is only able to recover what she has invested, due to the frosts and pests that affect this crop. However, she also tells us that she does not have the same problem with peas. Additionally, she receives further income from selling guinea pigs, which started raising  5 years ago. Now, Olinda is planning to bring her eldest son to Lima so he can begin to study there. This is one of the reasons why she is working so hard to get ahead and improve her income. This month she will begin planting more peas, and as a result is requesting this loan to purchase the seeds. This is Olinda's 6th loan with Kiva, and she is very dedicated to paying all monthly loan quotas on time.

loans.use: to buy pea seeds

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 55 years old and married with five children.

Elizabeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like dozens of eggs, biscuits, milk, oil, energy drinks, salt, sugar, noodles, and other grocery items.

Elizabeth has borrowed and repaid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from fishing and farming rice.

Elizabeth aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like dozens of eggs, biscuits, milk, oil, energy drinks, salt, sugar, noodles, and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy leather and laces for shoe making business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 49 years old and married with five children.

Francisca works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Francisca has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for 15 years and also earns an income from fish vending and farming rice.

Francisca aspires to save enough money to be able to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Isnaida

texts.en:
Isnaida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional items like soap, canned goods, eggs, sugar, milk, bread, and other items for her general store business.

Isnaida has been in this business for three years. Isnaida earns additional income from farming rice.

Isnaida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items like soap, canned goods, eggs, sugar, milk, bread, and other items.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 37 years old, married, and has three children.

Zenaida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell, such as soap, noodles, eggs, coffee, spices, toothpaste, etc.

Before this loan, Zenaida borrowed and paid back two loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for one year, and also earns additional income from farming rice.

Zenaida aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell like soap, noodles, eggs, coffee, spices, toothpaste, etc.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.en:
Guillermo is a 42-year-old father who is raising his family in a rural community. He aimed to improve their living conditions in order to educate his two children and give them a better life. He and his wife help each other in cultivating their farm land by planting rice and some vegetables. In addition to their agricultural work, he runs a small variety store in their community to generate additional income. 

Guillermo planned to acquire more commodities to sell but he does not have enough capital. For this reason, he is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy more stock of snack foods, canned goods, beverages, seasonings, soaps, eggs, noodles and soft drinks to sell. He is hoping that this financial assistance will enable them to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of snack foods, canned goods, beverages, seasonings, soaps, eggs, noodles and soft drinks to sell

location.town: Brgy. Kongkong, Kasibu, Nueva Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda, 32 years of age, is married with two children. They are currently residing at the village of Villa Luna. She has managed a retail store in their village for almost one year. With this business, she's earning a net income of 3,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month. She would like a loan amounting to 15,000 PHP to purchase canned goods, noodles, biscuits, coffee and beverages to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can expand her store.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods, noodles, biscuits, coffee and beverages.

loans.name: Jerson

texts.en:
Jerson is 35 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is in school.

Jerson is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Jerson requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase livestock to raise.

Jerson has been raising livestock for nine years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jerson would like to save enough money to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to raise.

loans.name: Jedida

texts.en:
Jedida is a married woman. She has two children with ages ranging from 11 years to 18 years. She describes herself to be a God-fearing woman. She operates a retail shop where she sells soft drinks such as water, juice and sodas. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located at a viable business area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be frequent power blackouts. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more soft drinks to sell. Her business goal is to start a new business of real estate within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have had started a new business of a retail clothing store.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a used clothing business in the Philippines.

Violeta requested a 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more used clothes to sell to customers.

She has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Violeta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes to sell to customers.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
This is Criselda. She previously accessed a 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a new 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Criselda dreams that her business will continue to be successful. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 37 years old and is married with four children.

She earns a living by raising ducks in the Philippines. Joy is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional pairs of ducks to raise and feed.

Joy has been raising ducks for six years, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional pairs of ducks to raise and feed.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn works hard to support her family. She is single and has a food market in the Philippines.

Ailyn requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of spices to sell in her food stall.

She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Ailyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of spices to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 45-year-old married man. He has a child who is 18 years old. He describes himself to be an honest man. He operates a grocery store where he sells vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, peas, etc. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a viable business area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high transportation costs. 

Joseph will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy vegetables to sell. His business goal is to buy a pick-up, which will assist in cutting down on transportation costs within five years.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 41 years old and was gifted with five children. Unfortunately, due to problems and unavoidable circumstances, she is separated from her husband. Despite this, she has the determination to uplift their status of living to support and educate her children. She wants them to earn a degree so that they will find a good job someday. In this regard, she has planned to improve her variety store in order to generate sufficient income. 

She is asking for additional capital of P20,000 to buy more soft drinks, snack foods, canned goods, noodles, soaps, beverages and seasonings to sell. She believes that someday, she will be able to improve the business through her patience and hard work.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of soft drinks, snack foods, canned goods, noodles, soaps, beverages and seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia, aged 48, is a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Quirino, an employee, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nelia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns income by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling items piece by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

Nelia is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to help her to continue operating her business. She will use the loan to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Nelia dreams of expanding her business: she hopes that they will have their own house and lot.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and from there she also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God that she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 48 years old and is married with seven children, four of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. 

Rosie runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, soap, noodles, spices, etc. She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Rosie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, soap, noodles, spices, etc.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from selling fruits and vegetables. Maricel is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of clothing to sell.

Maricel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida, aged 50, is married to a farmer and they have been blessed with three children. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost 10 years. From this business, Nida earns a net income of PHP 4,000 a month. 

She would like to request a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase canned goods, biscuits, noodles, cooking oil, coffee, sugar and beverages to sell. Nida is hoping that her loan will be granted so that she will be able to improve and expand her business to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, biscuits, noodles, cooking oil, coffee, sugar and beverages to sell

loans.name: Ana Marita

texts.en:
Ana Marita is 56 years old, is married and has five children.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ana Marita has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Ana Marita has been raising pigs for 13 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Ana Marita would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Junior

texts.es:
Junior, es soltero y no tiene hijos , viven en casa de sus padres, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad de Chijipina Grande en la localidad de Achacachi.
El ya termino el nivel secundario y ahora trabaja como productor lechero en su comunidad.
El crédito lo requiere para compra de una vaca lechera y de esta manera incrementar su producción de leche y mejorar sus ingresos.
El sueño de Junior es tener su casa propia.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Junior is single and does not have kids. He lives in his parents’ home, which is located in the community of Chijipina Grande in the locality of Achacachi. He already finished secondary school and now works as a dairy producer in his community. He needs the loan to buy a milk cow, and in this way increase his production of milk and improve his income. Junior’s dream is to have a house of his own. This is the first time that he is requesting a loan with IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow to increase his production of milk.

loans.name: Farhodjon

texts.ru: Фарходчон является мужчиной в возрасте 45 , женат имеет 5 детей. Двое сыновей находятся в России на заработке со своими семьями. Остальные его дети находятся с ним и помогают ему в бизнесе. Также они выращивают абрикос в сезонное время и отправляют на продажу. Фарходчон  хочет увеличить поголовье скота, но для этого у него нет места где содержать скот. Он планирует построить еще один коровник, что бы зимой скот мог находиться в коровнике. Для этого он просит кредит что бы начать стройку и докончить к зиме.
texts.en: Farhodjon is 45 years old, married, and has 5 children. Two of his sons have gone to Russia as migrant workers with their families. His other children are still at home and help him with his business. They also grow apricots and ship them to be sold. Farhodjon wants to increase his herd of cattle, but he does not have the facilities to house them. He plans to build another cattle shed for the cattle to be kept in during the winter. He is now seeking a loan so that he can start construction and finish it before winter.

loans.use: to build a cattle shed

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
El Señor Orlando tiene 47 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos y reside en San Juan Pueblo, Municipio de Esparta.
Don Orlando motivado por la situación económica difícil y las ganas de superarse, decidió establecer su propio negocio el cual consiste en una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar, productos de limpieza, carnes, lácteos etc.
Don Orlando ha solicitado un crédito por la cantidad de 15000 lempiras los que piensa invertir en la compra de productos para abastecer su negocio y brindar mejor servicio a  su clientes, supliendo las demanda de productos alimenticios.
Su meta es hacer crecer su negocio y tener los ingresos necesarios para darle siempre a sus hijos una mejor vida y la educación necesaria.
texts.en: Orlando is 47 years old, married and has three children. He lives in San Juan Pueblo, in the municipality of Esparta. Motivated by his difficult financial situation and desire to overcome, Orlando decided to set-up his own business, which consists of a general store where he sells goods from the basic food basket, cleaning products, meats, dairy products etc. Orlando has requested a loan of 15000 lempiras, which he plans to invest in the purchase of goods to stock his business and provide a better service to his customers, supplying the demand for food stuffs. His goal is to grow his business and have the necessary income to always give his children a better quality of life and the education necessary.

loans.use: to purchase goods to stock his business, such as staple grains, dairy products and meats.

loans.name: Mayela

texts.es: Mayela, de 59 años de edad ,es una mujer luchadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo, con quien cuida de sus 3 hijos en la casa que compró hace 10 años.Tiene 9 años de experiencia en la venta de comestibles en un puesto ubicado en el mercado central de su zona, atiende todo el día a su exigente clientela , quienes conocen de la calidad de sus productos. En algunas ocasiones le ayudan su esposo y su hija mayor pero generalmente ella es la única responsable del negocio, afirma que le agrada atender su negocio  ya que le agrada conversar con otras personas. Además que esta actividad  le ha resultado  beneficiosa por los ingresos económicos que  genera , por ello desea continuar en este negocio, con miras a crecer y tener una tienda mayorista de productos de primera necesidad en su hogar .Mayela, invertirá los S/.3500 soles en la compra de arroz, azúcar, menestras y fideos los cuales servirán para  aumentar la mercadería disponible en su negocio , a su vez ella esta muy contenta de  tener un apoyo financiero, ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable con sus pagos.
texts.en: 59-year-old Mayela is a determined woman. She lives in the company of her husband, with whom she is raising 3 children in their house bought 10 years ago. She has 9 years of experience selling food in a spot located in the central market of their zone. All day, she looks after her demanding customers who know the quality of her products. On occasion her husband or her eldest daughter help her, but generally she is the sole responsible for the business. She affirms that it pleases her to look after her business since she likes to talk with other people. In addition, this business has been beneficial due to the financial resources that it generates. This is why she desires to continue in this business and is looking to grow and have a wholesale store with basic home products. Mayela will invest the 3500 new Peruvian soles in the purchase of rice, sugar, vegetable soups and beans, which will serve to increase the available merchandise in her business. She is also very happy to have some financial support, since she has demonstrated that she is responsible with her payments.

loans.use: to buy goods such as rice, sugar, vegetable soups etc.

loans.name: Abdukosim

texts.ru: Абдукосим 1969 года рождения, женат имеет 5 детей. Старшие  сыновья, находятся в России , 2 дочерей он выдал замуж, теперь с женой планируют  построить дом для младшего сына. Он сейчас находиться в России и по приезду его женят. В настоящее время Абдукосим занимается разведением скота, его жена продает молоко и молочные продукты, его старшая дочь также помогает она развозит молоко в разные магазины и на рынок. Абдукосим хочет на полученный кредит приобрести еще пару коров, так как от них он получает доход. Накопив определенную сумму он хочет начать строительство дома. Он благодарен за финансовую поддержку и надеется на дальнейшее сотрудничество.
texts.en: Abdukosim was born in 1969. He is married and has 5 children. His eldest sons are currently in Russia, his 2 daughters are married, and he and his wife now want to build a house for their youngest son. He is in Russia at present, and when he next comes home, he will be married. Abdukosim earns a living by raising cattle, his wife sells milk and dairy products, and his eldest daughter helps by distributing the milk to shops and the market. Abdukosim wants to a loan so he can purchase a couple more cows, as he will make money from them. Once he saves a certain portion of these earnings, he wants to begin building a house. He is grateful for your financial support and hopes for further collaboration.

loans.use: to purchase of livestock

loans.name: Carla Vanessa

texts.es: La Sra. Carla sigue con la actividad de la venta de cosméticos y joyas, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de cosméticos por mayor que se encuentra en promoción, cuenta que le fue bien  creció en su actividad e incremento su clientela, y por ende sus ingresos económicos, en esta ocasión solicito el crédito para la compra de cosméticos y joyas por mayor para seguir incrementando su capital de trabajo, se siente feliz y agradecida por esta nueva oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Carla continues to work selling cosmetics and jewellery. She tells us that her last loan went well for her as she used it to buy make-up, that was on sale, in bulk. Carla says that her business grew and she increased her customer base and, consequently, her income. On this occasion she is applying for a loan to buy cosmetics and jewellery in bulk so as to continue increasing her working capital. She feels happy and grateful for this new opportunity that she is being given.

loans.use: to buy make-up and jewellery in bulk.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca, de 42 años de edad esta casada con Edilberto y tiene un hijo de 10 años , juntos viven e la casa de sus suegros .Es docente de profesión  y desempeña su trabajo como profesora de personas adultas, enseñándoles a leer y escribir pero también se dedica a la crianza de gallinas, actividad que realiza desde hace 7 años , ella cuida muy bien a las gallinas y le pone mucho empeño para después vender  todos los fines de semana, selecciona a los que ha de vender y después los entrega a  los comerciantes de carne de su localidad. Ha visto que esta actividad es de gran ayuda para su económia familiar y le permite disponer de su propio tiempo es por esta razón que desea seguir trabajando con ese mismo empeño para  crecer económicamente.Rebeca invertirá los S/. 2000 soles en la compra de gallinas pues desea comercializar en mayor cantidad , además está muy contenta de  tener un apoyo financiero, ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos,
texts.en: Rebeca is 42 years. She is married to Edilberto and she has a 10 year old son. They all live together with Rebeca's in-laws. Rebeca is a teacher. She works with adults, teaching them to read and write but she also makes some money raising hens. This she has been doing for seven years. She takes good care of the hens and is very determined to raise them and later sell them at the weekend. She chooses which ones she will sell and takes them to the local businesses. Rebeca has seen that this work has been a huge financial help for her family and it allows her to organise her own schedule. As a result she would like to continue this work so that she can grow financially. Rebeca will invest the 2000 Nuevo Soles in buying hens so that she can sell in bulk. Rebeca is very happy to have financial support as she has always shown herself to be responsible when it comes to repayments.

loans.use: to buy hens.

loans.name: Wuidmer Antonio

texts.es:
Don Wuidmer tiene 40 años, vive en unión libre con su esposa con la cual procrearon 1 hijo y reside en San Juan Pueblo, municipio Esparta, Atlántida.
Don Wuidmer su negocio es una pulpería donde ofrece a los clientes productos como granos básicos, carnes, lácteos, refrescos, embutidos, productos de abarrotería etc. En el negocio también es ayudado por su esposa a atender los clientes. Don Wuidmer también como otro ingreso extra tiene un taller donde elabora balcones, portones y todo lo relacionado con hierro. Manifiesta que esta muy contento porque en los dos negocios le va bien y con todo el trabajo que hace ha podido darle a su familia las comodidades necesarias.
Para surtir la pulpería con los productos que demandan el ha solicitado un préstamo de 20,000 lempiras, y comprara carnes, granos, refrescos  y productos de abarrotería.
Su meta es mantener sus dos negocios a flote y estables para ofrecer siempre bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Wuidmer is 40 years old. He lives with his wife, with whom he has one son. They live in San Juan Pueblo, in the municipality of Esparta, Atlántida.
Wuidmer's business is a small grocery store where he sells products such as basic grains, meat, dairy products, soft drinks, cold meat and groceries, among other things. Wuidmer's wife helps out with the business by serving customers. As an extra source of income, Wuidmer also has a workshop where he produces balconies, gates and anything else made of iron. Wuidmer says he is very happy because both his businesses are going well and with all this work he has been able to provide his family with the essentials.
In order to stock up his business with products that customers need, Wuidmer is applying for a loan of 20,000 Lempira, which he will use to buy meats, grains,soft drinks and groceries.
Wuidmer's goal is to keep his two businesses afloat and stable so that he can always look after his family.

loans.use: to buy meat, basic grains, soft drinks and groceries to stock up the business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria, de 47 años es una mujer valiente. Vive en una casa alquilada desde hace 2 años en compañía de sus 3 hijas, a las que quiere mucho.Victoria se dedica al cultivo de alfalfa para poder venderla al por mayor  pero tambien se dedica al bordado artesanal, es por ello que no tiene un horario fijo de trabajo, pues tiene que dividirse entre su costura y la agricultura. Afirma que gusta mucho de vivir en el campo, tanto así que dentro de poco cosechará varias hectáreas de maíz, espera poder concretar la venta a un buen precio, pues desea aumentar la producción de este año. Victoria; invertirá los 3,000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para mejorar la producción de alfalfa, pues dentro de los próximos meses subirá el precio de venta y no desea desaprovechar la oportunidad , además está muy contenta de  tener un apoyo financiero, ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en: 47-year-old Victoria is a courageous woman. For the last two years, she has lived in a rented house with her three daughters, whom she loves very much. Victoria grows alfalfa in order to be able to sell it wholesale, but she also does artisanal embroidery. This is why she does not have a fixed work schedule. She has to divide her time between sewing and agriculture. She affirms that she likes living in the countryside a lot, so much so that she hopes soon to harvest various hectares of corn. She hopes that she will be able to close the sale at a good price, since she hopes to increase production this year. Victoria will invest the 3000 new Peruvian soles in the purchase of organic fertilizer to improve her production of alfalfa, since in the next few months the sales price will go up, and she does not want to miss the opportunity.  In addition, she is very happy to have the financial support, since she has always demonstrated that she is responsible with her payments.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Oysara

texts.ru: Ойсара предприниматель, занимается купля-продажей детской одежды с 2002 года. Она начала свой бизнес с очень маленького товарооборота, но со временем год за годом у нее бизнес расширился. Она начало кредитоваться в "Арванд" с 2003 года. На данный момент у нее бизнес стабильный, ассортимент товаров расширился. Ойсаре 38 лет, к сожалению она вдова, имеет двоих детей, сын и дочь. В семье доход приносящий человек она единственная. Поэтому она работает 30 дней в месяц без выходных, чтобы её дети не нуждались в денежных средствах. На данный момент Ойсара берет кредит для расширение своего бизнеса, чтобы получить больше прибыли. Она очень благодарн Арванду.
texts.en: Oysara is a businesswoman who has been selling children's clothing since 2002. She started her business with a very small turnover, but over time she has expanded it. She got her first loan from Arvand in 2003. At present, her business is stable and her range of goods is larger. She is 38 years old, and unfortunately, she is a widow, so she supports her family on her own. She has 2 children, a son and a daughter. She works 30 days a month without any days off so that her children never want for money. Oysara is now seeking a loan to expand her business which will allow her to earn a larger profit. She is very grateful to Arvand.

loans.use: to increase turnover

loans.name: Abdunasib

texts.ru: Абдунасиб мужчина в возрасти 47 лет, имеет большой опыт в области выращивание сельхоз  продукции. Он живет в сельской местности. Женат, имеет двоих детей, сын и дочка. Дети учатся в школе. Абдунасиб имеет земелный участок в объеме 2,3 га на 2 га выращивает лук а на 0,3 га  ячмень. Кроме выращивание сельхоз продукции Абдунасиб занимается откармливанием крупно рогатого скота. Данное время у него имеется  2 голов откормленных быков и  несколько баранов. Жена работает в дехканском хозяйстве, а в свободное время помогает мужу. Абдунасиб и его жена стараются получить больше доходов, чтобы их семейное, жилищное условия улучшились. Абдунасиб берет кредит для покупки минеральных удобрений для выращивание лука и ячменя и заранее благодарен за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Abdunasib is 47 years old and has a lot of experience growing crops. He lives in a rural area. He is married and has 2 children, a son and a daughter, who are both in school. Abdunasib has a 2.3 hectare plot of land, and he uses 2 hectares for growing onions and 0.3 hectares for barley. In addition to growing crops, he also fattens cattle. At present, he has 2 fattened bulls and several sheep. His wife works in the local farming sector, and in her free time, she helps her husband. The couple are trying to earn a good income so that they can improve their family's living standard and housing conditions. Abdunasib is seeking a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers for his onions and barley, and he extends his thanks in advance for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corrugated iron roofing for the workshop.

loans.name: Damith Lissett

texts.es: Damith de 28 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de Cartagena con su cónyuge y su pequeña hija de 5 años. Allí tiene un negocio donve vende productos de joyería en plata y en oro golfi,  y también tiene otro negocio de venta de  leche en polvo. A Damith la impulsó su madre en la actividad comercial, pues tradicionalmente es comerciante, así fue como en el año2009,   inició su actividad independiente, vendiendo cadenas, pulseras, aretes, reloj y  la leche en polvo que inició posteriormente a la estructuración de su propia clientela. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y a crédito y sus principales clientes son sus amigos y referidos,  con los que ha logrado una clientela fija. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará accesorios de oro y plata y leche en polvo, en un mayor volumen, pues su clientela ha crecido y requiere responder a sus pedidos y ser  mucho mas competitiva en los precios, y esto lo conseguirá por comprar de contado y en una mayor cantidad, lo que se traduce en el éxito de su inversión.
texts.en: Damith is 28 years old and lives with her partner and five year old daughter in the city of Cartagena.  Damith has a business selling imitiation gold and silver jewellery and another one selling powedered milk.  It was Damith's mother, also a businesswoman, that encouraged her to go into business in 2009.  Damith started her work independently, selling chains, bracelets, earrings, watches and, later on, powdered milk.  Damith's customers either pay in cash or in installments and most of her customers are friends and people who come to her by word of mouth.  She now has a solid customer base.  Damith is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first with the "Fundación Mario Santo Domingo".  With it she will buy gold and silver accessories and powdered milk in large quantities.  Her customer base has grown and she needs to respond to demand and offer more competitive prices, which she can do by buying in bulk and paying in full - this will allow Damith to get the most out of her investment.

loans.use: to buy gold and silver accessories and powder milk.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Doña Justina tiene 68 años de edad, casada, vive con su esposo y un hijo mayor en el municipio de Morazan, Yoro. Tiene 12 años de tener su propio negocio y que es su fuente de ingresos, vende azúcar,harina, arroz, frijoles, maseca,huevos, refrescos, churros, etc. este negocio lo ha mantenido mediante la inversión de varios préstamos. El que esta solicitando es el catorceavo de 10,000 lempiras, en el cual invertira en comprar produtos de las canasta basica para satisfacer la demanda de los clientes y seguir manteniendo surtido el negocio.
su meta es seguir creciendo y mantener su negocio siempre con los productos de mayor demanda.
texts.en:
Justina is 68 years old, she is married and lives with her husband and her eldest son in the municipality of Morazan, Yoro. She has had her own business for 12 years and this is her source of income. She sells sugar, flour, rice, beans, instant corn masa mix, eggs, drinks, churros and so on. She has remained in business by investing several loans.

This loan that Justina is seeking is her 14th loan of 10,000 Honduran Lempiras with which she will invest in the purchase of staple items to satisfy demand from her customers and to keep the store well stocked. Her aim is to continue growing and always have the most-sought after products in stock.

loans.use: to buy staple items to stock her business.

loans.name: Alexis

texts.es: Alexis, tiene la edad  de 58 años, está casado, vive con sus hijos y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de otra en trabajos de asistencia para el café. Además de poder comprar unas plantas de almácigo para realizar resiembras y así aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Alexis is 58 years old, married and lives with his children and wife, who are his priority in life. With the loan, Alexis wants to buy fertilizers and fungicides, and pay for the labor he needs for his coffee plantations. He also wants to buy “almáciga” plants [a species of the pistachio tree] to replant, increase the density of plants in his land and take advantage of the good soil properties, the weather and other conditions that are beneficial for his coffee plants. With these improvements to his plantation, he hopes to receive more profits and improve his family’s life, be able to invest more in his plants and reach some of his goals.

This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He had not had other loans before with state-run banks, but FUDECOSUR has granted him a loan more easily and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for his coffee plantation and pay for labor.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda, de 53 años de edad , es viuda y vive desde hace 26 años en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la localidad de Pampas, junto a sus 2 hijos. Para poder mantener la economía de su hogar y ser independiente, comenzó hace 6 años en la venta de ropa variada para todo tipo de personas, su éxito se encuentra en traer ropa de ocasión, es decir por temporada invierno, verano y otoño. Constantemente viaja a la ciudad de Lima, para comprar ropa importada, pues existen meses en los que ya tiene el pedido de sus prendas, es decir ya las tiene compradas. Considera su negocio muy rentable, pues en su localidad, hay pocas tiendas que ofrecen prendas de calidad y sobre todo a la moda, es así que no tiene competencia, Ella espera más adelante poder abrir su propia tienda, donde puede mostrar su ropa, ya que en la actualidad tiene que ofrecer de casa en casa. Este es el crédito número 2 con KIVA, y está muy agradecida por este apoyo financiero que recibe para continuar con su trabajo.
Hilda, invertirá los S/2000 soles en la compra de ropa surtida, para niños, varones y mujeres, sobre todo comprará casacas por el frió ya que tiene pedidos.
texts.en:
Hilda, 53, is a widow who has two children and has lived in a rented house, located in Pampas, for 26 years. In order to support her home and be independent, she started selling all kinds of clothes six years ago. She is successful because she offers season clothing, i.e. winter, summer or autumn clothes. Hilda travels constantly to Lima to buy imported clothes, and some times, her customers order them in advance.

Hilda believes this is a profitable business, because there are few stores offering good quality and stylish garments in her locality, so she has no competition. She hopes to be able to open her own store in the future, a place where she can display her clothes since now she has to sell from home.

This is Hilda’s second loan with Kiva and she feels grateful for this financial help she is receiving to continue with her work. Hilda will invest the 2000 soles [PEN] in assorted clothes for children, men and women. In particular, she will buy sweaters, since it is cold now and her customers have already ordered some.

loans.use: to buy clothes for children and adults.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.es: Jennifer, tiene la edad  de 20 años, está soltera, vive con sus padres y hermanos  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer  la preparación del terreno a tiempo antes de las primeras lluvias y también la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas, plantas de almácigo y pagar mano de otra en trabajos de siembra para el café. Además de poder comprar unas plantas de almácigo para realizar siembras y así aumentar el área de plantas, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir con la meta de seguir estudiando.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Jennifer, 20, is single and she lives with her parents and her siblings who are her main priority. With this loan, she plans to prepare the land in time before the first rains, in addition to purchasing fertilizers, fungicides, nursery plants and to pay for help to sow the coffee. The loan will also enable her to buy a few nursery plants to sow and to increase the plantation area, in addition to benefiting from the land's good fertility, climatic conditions and other conditions which are favorable to the cultivation of coffee. 

It is through these improvements that Jennifer hopes to gain some profits and thereby improve her family's living conditions and also invest a bit more in the crop to achieve her aim of continue her studies. This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR. She has never had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR gave her the loan with more ease and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to sow coffee.

loans.name: Peris

texts.en: Peris is a 28-year-old single woman. She has one child. She describes herself as an honest woman. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been in this business for one year. Her business is located in a viable business area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of transporting vegetables and fruits. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy fruits and vegetables for resale. Her business goal is to boost her business within five years.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Vano

texts.en: Vano, 48, is from a small village in Kvareli district. He is married and lives with his wife and two children (8 and 10 years old). Vano and his wife are involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have milking cows, whose milk is used in cheese production. Vano’s wife milks the cows and produces dairy products to sell. Along with the dairy business, the family has a vineyard and two hectares of agricultural land. Vano is a very hard-working man and has a rich experience in his business. Vano applied for a loan to pay for cultivating the land and to buy feed for the cattle. After he buys the feed, the cattle will fatten properly and the family will produce more dairy products. This will increase the family’s income. With increased income, they will be able to improve their living conditions. Vano awaits your support.

loans.use: to cultivate his land and buy feed for his cattle.

loans.name: Libia Lorena

texts.es:
Libia es un mujer de 22 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con sus padres y su pequeña hija, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeña, ya que Libia es padre y madre para ella; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Libia  no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Libia trabaja como en su pequeño negocio de crianza y venta de patos, adicionalmente los fines de semana trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, Libia trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Libia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de patos, los cuales le ayudaran de mucho para poder mejorar la raza de esta aves y podrá venderlos a un mejor precio, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Libia is 22 years old and lives with her parents and daughter in the city of Cañete in the district of Imperial. Libia says she loves her daughter and that her daughter is the most important thing in her life. Libia is very kind, hardworking and enthusiastic. She dedicates all of her efforts to helping her daughter get ahead, as Libia is both father and mother to her. Sadly, Libia has not been able to study a professional career – because of a lack of resources and needing to work – but she would have liked to.

On her own initiative and with a lot of effort and dedication, Libia works her own small business of raising and selling ducks. She also works on the weekends as a field laborer for an agricultural holding in her city. She works every day for approximately 10 hours. She believes that things are going well for her because she is responsible and treats others with kindness.

Libia is very grateful to Kiva lenders because it is thanks to their help that she will be able to buy a larger quantity and variety of ducks. These will help her improve the breed of her ducks and she will be able to sell them at a better price. Libia plans to continue working hard and striving for her greatest dream, which is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity and variety of ducks.

loans.name: 03.08.05 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en: Mrs. Huyền has a business sewing clothes. She is applying for a loan to buy machines to make tailor-made clothing and do clothing repairs. Huyền has been involved in this business for five years. Huyền is 28 years old, married, and has one child. Huyền is the group leader of the 03.08.05-Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of four members. Huyền lives with one dependent in Thanh Hoa City, a town in Thanh Hoa Province. This is Huyền’s first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. The main hardship that Huyền faces in her business is a lack of capital. With her business profits, Huyền hopes that her family will be healthy and happy, that her business will do well, and that they can travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to buy machines to make tailor-made clothing and do clothing repairs.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en: As a married parent of six children, Cirila works hard to support her family. She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from a general store. Cirila is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Cirila has been sustaining her business activities with her past 19 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production and vending business.

loans.name: 03.08.04 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en: Mrs. Phương operates a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables. She is applying for a loan to buy vegetables to resell. Phương is 52 years old, and she is married and has two children. Phương is the group leader of the 03.08.04-Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of four members. Her children are grown up, so Phương lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa City, a town in Thanh Hoa Province. This is Phương’s first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Phương has been in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that Phương faces in her business is a lack of capital. With her business profits, Phương hopes that her children will find good jobs, that her business will do well, and that her family will be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Ana Cecilia es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como profesora de primaria en una escuela de una comarca aledaña a dicho municipio desde hace 24 años, labor que le ha permitido sacar adelante sola a sus dos hijos los cuales están en edad escolar.

Es una mujer muy sencilla, trabajadora que ha salido sola adelante sin la ayuda del padre de sus hijos.
Por medio de sus compañeros de trabajo se dio cuenta que en Ceprodel le financian créditos a las personas de bajo recursos que necesitan para mejorar su vivienda y que son unos inversionistas del extranjero quienes envían la plata.

Por tal motivo se presentó por primera vez a dicha oficina a solicitar un crédito porque en este momento tiene la necesidad de construir una pila de concreto para almacenar agua potable, ya que en dicho pueblo hay mucha escasés de la misma, con el cual comprará ladrillos, cemento, zinc, arena y pago de mano de obra.

Confía en que estos inversionistas de buen corazón financien su solicitud para poder llevar a cabo su inversión.
texts.en:
Ana Cecilia is from the municipality of El Sauce. She has worked as an elementary school teacher in a school in a district outside of this municipality for 24 years. This work has allowed her to support her two school-aged children by herself. 

She is a very straightforward and hard-working woman, who has been able to get ahead without the help of the father of her children. 

Through her colleagues at work, she heard that Ceprodel finances loans for low-income people who need them to improve their homes, and that there are some investors in other countries who provide the funds. 

For this reason, she presented herself for the first time at that office to apply for a loan, because she currently needs to construct a concrete tank to store water, since in her village there are many water outages. She will use the loan to buy bricks, cement, galvanized metal, and sand, and to pay for labor. 

She is confident that these good-hearted investors will finance her request so that she can carry out her investment.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, galvanized metal, and sand, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Xinia

texts.es: Xinia, tiene la edad  de 48 años, está casada, vive con sus hijos y esposo  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de algunos fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra  en trabajos culturales  de asistencia para el café. Además de poder comprar unas plantas de almácigo de una buena calidad y de  la variedad requerida para esta zona y para realizar resiembras y así aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Xinia is 48 years old, married and lives with her husband and children who are her top priority. With this loan she intends to buy fertilizer, fungicide and to pay for the labor to prepare her land for cultivating coffee. In addition, she will buy high-quality seedlings of the variety of coffee that grows well in this region in order to replant and increase the density of her crop. She wants to take advantage of the fertile soil, weather, and other conditions that favor coffee planting.  

With these improvements to her coffee crop, Xinia hopes to achieve a small profit and improve her family’s living conditions. She also plans to invest a little more in her coffee fields to achieve her goals. This is the first loan Xinia has received through FUDECOSUR. She has not had any loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided her the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, fungicide and high-quality seedlings and to pay for the labor to prepare her land for cultivating coffee.

loans.name: Maa Biranchi Narayani Self Help Group

texts.en:
Saraswati is 42 years old and married. She lives in house made of mud, with her husband and two children, in a rural village of the Jajpur district in Odisha, India. She and her husband earn a living by farming rice and vegetables that they sell in the market. Having been in this business for ten years, she manages to earn about 5,000 INR per month and can save about 2,000 INR each month for future needs.

This is a group loan for Maa Biranchi Narayani Self Help Group of ten women. The members of this group are engaged in different kinds of activities. Some of them are managing grocery shops and others are doing farming. 

Saraswati is leading her group to apply for a loan. She wants to use her loan portion to buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides for her farmland. The lady standing fourth from the left side wearing a yellow saree is Saraswati. She hopes to increase her rice yield and earn more income to better her living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing fertilizers, seeds and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel, tiene la edad  de 47 años, está casado,  vive con sus hijos y esposa, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. El con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de madera y materiales para hacerle una reparación a la vivienda, y de esta manera poderle ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Con esta compra pretende hacer una mejora de buena calidad a su casa y que sus hijos y esposa mejoré su calidad de vida. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Miguel is 47 years old, married and lives with his wife and children, who are his top priority. With this loan he intends to buy wood and other materials to repair his home. Miguel plans to do a high-quality improvement to his home that will improve his wife and children’s quality of life. 

This is the first loan Miguel has received through FUDECOSUR. He has not had any loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy wood and other materials to repair his home.

loans.name: Santiago Patricio

texts.es: En medio del clima cálido y en movidas actividades comerciales, se encuentra la capital de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, es un lugar donde se unen los habitantes de la Región Costa y Sierra del país ecuatoriano por lo que es un puerto terrestre de intercambio comercial entre las regiones. Esta provincia ha tenido un alto crecimiento sostenido. Su capital  es una ciudad en donde lo más atractivo y llamativo son sus deliciosas frutas, y la gastronomía que ofrecen en el lugar. Sus atractivos turísticos que acompañados de su clima cálido son muy concurridos por turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Es por esto que la mayoría de sus habitantes han emprendido con alguna actividad comercial o de servicios para habitantes y turistas. En el caso de Patricio decidió apostar por el negocio del comercio de banano, tiene 27 años y es soltero, tiene un hijo a quien espera verlo convertido en un profesional. Santiago se educó algunos años en la universidad sin alcanzar a terminar sus estudios por falta de recursos económicos, emprendió en su negocio hace 5 años después de que algunos familiares le enseñaron la actividad y ahora invierte varias horas en la mañana y en la tarde para recibir el producto, almacenarlo y distribuirlo a sus clientes. Santiago ha visto la necesidad de ampliar el galpón en donde ejerce su trabajo, sin embargo esto no ha sido posible por la dificultad de encontrar financiamiento, pero ahora que hace su primer crédito en Fundación Alternativa, se siente muy respaldado por la agilidad, confianza y asesoría oportuna que le han brindado, pues el hecho de trabajar con Kiva, ha facilitado la financiación de varios negocios de emprendedores del sector rural. Santiago espera que con este cambio en su negocio el podrá ofrecer sus productos con una mejor presentación y además incrementar las ventas porque podrá almacenar mayor cantidad de banano para de esta forma crecer y ofrecerle a su hijo un mejor estilo de vida. Además en el futuro sueña con construir s vivienda propia en un terreno que posee en un Recinto de la zona. Este hombre valeroso agradece a todos quienes alrededor del mundo aportan la financiación de sus sueños.
texts.en:
The Province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas is the site of a warm climate and busy commercial activities. It is a place where the residents of the coastal and mountainous regions of Ecuador meet, and so it serves as a land port for trade among the regions. This province has had high and sustained growth. Its capital is a city where the most attractive and appealing elements are its delicious fruits and cuisine. Given its tourist attractions and warm climate, it is a popular destination for both foreign and national tourists. It is for this reason that the majority of its residents offer services or commercial activities for residents and tourists.

In Santiago Patricio's case, he decided to start a business in the banana trade. He is 27 years old and single, and he has a son that he would like to see grow up to be a professional. Santiago studied at university for a few years but did not manage to finish his studies because he lacked the economic resources. He launched his business five years ago after some relatives taught him the activity. Now he invests several hours in the morning and in the afternoon to receive products, store them and distribute them to customers. Santiago has seen the necessity of expanding the stall where he works, however this has not been easy given the difficulty of getting financing. Now that he has his first loan with Fundación Alternativa, he feels very supported by the flexibility, confidence, and timely advice that they have offered him. In addition, working with Kiva has provided funding for several entrepreneurial businesses in the rural sector.

Santiago hopes that with this change in his business he will be able to present his products in a more attractive way and increase his sales, because he will be able to store more bananas. In this way, he will be able to grow and offer his son a better standard of living. On top of that, in the future he hopes to build his own home on land that he owns in a rural settlement in the area. This valiant man is thankful to all those around the world who are helping to fund his dreams.

loans.use: to improve his work stall.

loans.name: Maa Hingula Self Help Group

texts.en:
In 1999, nine women from Jajpur district stepped out and decided to build a secure future for their families. They formed a group named Maa Hingula Self Help Group. The members of Maa Hingula Self Help Group are all women from a district of Jajpur in Odisha, India. 

One of them is Basanti, who was selected as their president. The lady sitting third from the left in the first row in the photo is Basanti. Basanti is 53 years old and is staying with her husband and her three children. Her husband is a farmer and has been involved in the activity of cultivation for a long time. 

She got the idea of doing paddy and vegetable cultivation from her husband, so she gathered some other women from her neighbourhood and told them about her plan. They liked her idea and appreciated her. She took the leadership of the group and started to cultivate vegetables and sell them in her village.

Initially, she started with growing only few vegetables like potatoes, tomatoes, and onions but later on she grew bitter gourds, snake gourds, cucumbers, lady fingers and brinjals (eggplants). She has very good relationships with her customers as she sells fresh vegetables to her customers. 

Now she has a new idea to purchase some more land for cultivation so that she can grow more vegetables at a large scale and do paddy cultivation also. For this she has requested a loan to purchase seeds, pesticides and fertilizers and to get a water-pumping facility.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, pesticides and fertilizers and to get a water-pumping facility for her farmland.

loans.name: Sonoeun's Group

texts.en:
Sonoeun is 43 years old and married. She has two children, one of whom is a 10th grader at the local state school in the area. She struggles in earning a living through rice cropping and grocery selling. She also earns extra income from their chicken raising business which is handled by her husband. Over 10 years engagement in the current business, she has been able to earn up to 18,300 KHR per day and saves about 12,000 KHR per day.

This is the first microloan for Sonoeun's group consisting of four female members. All of her co-borrowers are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. She will use her loan potion to buy chicken feed and vaccinations for her chickens. She hopes to raise her chickens in healthy conditions and sell them at a high price to better her living standard.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed and vaccinations for her chickens

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en:
Chea, 52 and married, is a local villager residing in Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. Currently, only three out of five children still rely on her as they are still in school. To tackle the daily food consumption in her household, she grows cassava on three hectares, the business that she has been involved with for 32 years, earning about 11,700 KHR per day. Including this loan, she is a fifth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has completely repaid back her past loans which have helped her to sustain her living standard and keep her children in school. 

For this new loan cycle, she has formed a group of two to apply for a new loan. She is the group leader and will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and cassava seedlings. She hopes that she can grow her rice in a  timely manner and fruitfully so she can triple her income for her children’s sake.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, and cassava seedlings

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
This is Araceli, 55, a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Luciano, a worker, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Araceli operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php 10,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Araceli hopes that her business will continue to grow.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and  draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Yisel Isabel

texts.es: Desde al año 2010 Yisel decidió emprender una actividad con la cual generar ingresos para respaldar los gastos de su hogar, conformado por su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 2 años y 6 meses de nacido. Así fue como ahorró un poco de su presupuesto famliar y apoyada por su cónyuge compró los primeros articulos como collares, calzado  y perfumería, que vendió por su propia cuenta y le fue muy bien. Posteriormente compró su primera vitrina y paso a paso se fue involucrando en el mercado, hasta que accedió a afiliarse a una empresa que ofrece, mediante guias especializadas de productos, diversidad de mercancias. Su negocio hoy  ha crecido porque maneja ventas a credito y de contado, pero muchas veces y en especial en temporadas donde las ventas se incrmentan, su capital no es suficiente para respodner a la demanda y esto es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financimaineto que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará productos de bisuteríaque venderá entre su clientela mas rentable, porque su sueño es finamente tener un local comecial bien surtido donde su clientela encuentre todo lo que necesita y desea.
texts.en:
Since 2010, Yisel decided to undertake an activity in which she could generate an income to help support her household's spending, her family is made up of her partner and their two children aged 2 years and 6 months respectively. As such, she saved a little of the family budget and, supported by her partner, she bought her first items such as necklaces, shoes and perfume which she sells by herself, and it is going very well.

She then bought her first glass cabinet and little by little she made her mark in the market, to the point of partnering with a business which offers a wide range of products via specialized product guides. Her business today has grown because she sells by credit and on a cash basis, however, on several occasions, particularly in seasons where sales rise, her working capital is insufficient to meet demand and this is precisely why she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first type of financing from the Mario Santo Domingo foundation. With this loan, she will buy jewelry products and will sell to her more well-off customers, all of this because her dream is to finally have a well-stocked commercial store where her customers find all they need.

loans.use: to buy jewelry.

loans.name: Jairo

texts.es:
Jairo es un hombre de 22 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar para ayudar a sus padres, Jairo no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Medicina Humana, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar un riquísimo Seco de Res para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Jairo se dedica a la agricultura, el tiene un pequeño cultivo de cacao, en donde realiza diversas labores de campo, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad  y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Jairo se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos del mantenimiento, abono y cosecha de su cultivo, de esta manera Jairo podrá lograr que su cultivo se desarrolle adecuadamente y logre una buena venta, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder convertirse en un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Jairo is 22 years old and lives in the city of Pucallpa.  He is very friendly, hard-working, enthusiastic and has a strong desire to move ahead in life.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of money and because he needed to find work to support his parents, Jairo was not able to study medicine as he had wanted.  In his spare time he likes to prepare a delicious "Seco de Res" (a traditional, Peruvian beef stew) to share with his family.

Under his own initiative and with a lot of dedication and determination, Jairo makes a living in agriculture and has a small cocoa plantation where he carries out various jobs.  He works every day for around ten hours and he thinks it is going well because he is responsible and because he treats others well.

Jairo is very grateful to Kiva lenders as, thanks to the support provided, he will be able to cover the costs of maintaining, fertilising and harvesting his crop.  As a result Jairo's crops will grow properly and he will have good sales.  This will then allow him to continue working and putting in the effort to achieve his dream of becoming a successful professional.

loans.use: to cover the costs of maintaining, fertilising and harvesting his crops.

loans.name: 03.08.06- Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Chung is 41 years old and she is married and has two children. Chung lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Chung operates a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables. Chung has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Chung faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In 2011, Chung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Chung has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Chung is the group leader of the 03.08.06-Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of four members. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables to resell.

Chung hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Kaycee

texts.en:
Kaycee is 25 and single. She's currently residing at the village of Villa Luna together with her parents. 

She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost five years. In this business she's earning an income of PHP 3,000 a month. 

She would like a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase coffee, sugar, cooking oil, noodles, canned goods and beverages. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that her business will become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase coffee, sugar, cooking oil, noodles, canned goods, and beverages.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Age 30 and a mother of one son, Pov is a local citizen from Kampong Cham province. She struggles against her family’s hardships via rice farming and her husband helps to supplement the family’s income via working at rubber plantation, tapping rubber trees for latex. The current business which she has been with for 10 years, generates about 18,300 KHR per day.

 Pov is a four-cycle client with VisionFund (Cambodia) and has repaid her past loans successfully. This has enabled her to increase her income and keep her children in school. Now, she is in a group of two to apply for a new loan. She and her joint borrower are seeking 1,400,000 KHR each. She is the group leader and she will use her loan to pay for plowing fees and to buy fertilizer and cassava seedlings. She hopes to grow her crops in a timely manner and earn more income.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fees and to buy fertilizer and cassava seedlings

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Don Pedro tiene 56 años de edad, es casado, tiene un hijo y vive en Morazan, Yoro.
Don Pedro hace 10 años su fuente ingresos es un negocio de venta de ropa y calzado. Inicio este negocio con fondos propios y con la necesidad de generar sus propios ingreso. El hace de manera ambulante su venta y ademas trabaja por pedidos, mantiene ya sus propios cliente y dice que le ha ido bien, ya que ha podido tener los ingresos para mantener a su familia. Tambien esta muy contento con la ayuda que ha recibido con los financiamientos que le han permitido mantener su negocio estable.
El esta solicitando actualmente su catorceavo prestamo de 6,000 lempiras para comprar ropa de verano y aprovechar la temporada veraniega.
la meta que el tiene es seguir atendiendo sus clientes con los pedidos.
texts.en:
Pedro is 56 years old, he is married, has one child and lives in Morazan, Yoro. For the last ten years, Pedro's source of income comes from selling clothes and footwear. He is a travelling salesman, and also works by orders. He already has his own customers and says that it is going well as he has been able to secure an income to support his family. He is also very happy with the help he has received with the loans that have enabled him to keep his business going steady.

He is currently seeking his 14th loan of 6,000 Honduran Lempiras to buy summer clothing and make the most of the summer season. Pedro's goal is to continue meeting customer orders.

loans.use: to buy summer clothes to sell.

loans.name: Herald Andres

texts.es: Herald Andres, tiene la edad  de 25 años, está casado, vive con su hija y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de una vaca con una cría al destete y también se encuentra preñada. La idea es aprovechar el espacio que tiene de pasto y las buenas condiciones de terreno y clima para poder tener estos animales y a la vez obtener algo de leche y desarrollar terneros para en el futuro venderlos para carne. Con esta compra podrá desarrollar una actividad más, y a la vez tener un ahorro que le permitirá ir teniendo más animales e invertir más en la propiedad.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Herald Andres is 25 years old and married. He lives with his daughter and spouse, who are his first priority. With this loan he will buy a cow that is already pregnant and weaning a calf. The idea is to take advantage of the space that he has for grazing and the good conditions of the earth and climate for keeping these animals. At the same time, he will get some milk and raise cattle to sell them for meat in the future.

With this purchase, he will be able to engage in one more activity and also build some savings, which will allow him to gradually have more animals and invest more in his property. This is his first loan with Fudecosur. He hasn't had any loans with state-owned banks before, but Fudecosur offered him the loan with  a better payment plan and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Geiter

texts.es:
Geiter, de 56 años de edad, esta divorciado de la madre de sus hijos y actualmente vive solo en un cuarto alquilado, pero mensualmente pasa la pensión para sus hijos menores.
