Geiter se dedica a transportar pasajeros en la ciudad, para eso cuenta con un vehículo conocido como mototaxi, siendo su herramienta de trabajo y fuente de sustento.  Le gusta su trabajo  y decidió iniciarse hace más de 8  años, porque perdió su empleo en una compañía, necesitando una fuente de ingreso económico, se decidió por éste oficio. Le gusta  su actividad pues le permite tener ingresos económicos sustanciales para pagar los gastos propios de su hogar y darse una mejor calidad de vida..
Geiter espera seguir creciendo, ya que esta actividad  siempre tiene demanda, por eso tiene planes de hacer crecer su negocio.Este es el préstamo número 03 con Kiva y se siente contento de contar con el apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio, por eso asegura será puntual en el pago de sus cuotas.Con el monto solicitado de S/.800 nuevo soles comprará repuestos para su mototaxi, y así mantener en buen estado a su vehículo.
texts.en:
Geiter is 56 years old, is divorced from the mother of his children, and currently lives alone in a rented room. He pays for his younger children's board on a monthly basis.

Geiter makes a living transporting passengers around the city. To do this, he uses a vehicle known as a motorcycle-taxi, his work tool and source of livelihood. He enjoys his job, and chose this profession over eight years ago after losing his job with a company and needing a source of income. He likes his work because it allows him to earn enough to pay his living expenses and give himself a better quality of life.

Geiter hopes to continue growing, since there is always a demand for this activity, which is why he plans to expand his business. This is his third loan with Kiva, and he is grateful for the financial support given to help him succeed with his business. For this reason, he promises to make his loan repayments on time. He will use the loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle-taxi, in order to keep it in good working order.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for a motorcycle-taxi.

loans.name: 03.03.41-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Nghìn is 58 years old, married and has one child, who is grown. She lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Nghìn works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. Nghìn has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Nghìn faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In 2006, Nghìn joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Nghìn has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

Nghìn is the group leader of the 03.03.41-Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of three members. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future. Nghìn hopes for her children to find a good job, to travel for vacation within the country, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Maa Mangala Self Help Group

texts.en:
In 2009, 11 women from a village stepped out and formed a group having name Maa Mangala Self Help Group in Odisha. They help each other and share their problems and solve them among themselves. They celebrate their festivals together in their village.
  
Sanjukta, leader of the group, has six goats. She purchases the goat kids from the market and takes care of them. 

She provides vaccines and fodder to them when it is required. She goes out in the morning to leave the goats for grazing in the fields and returns by noon. Then she cooks for her family. She resumes taking care of her goats by feeding them at home. She sells them for meat to the local butcher shops when they grow. Her husband assists her in selling and maintaining these goats. It takes eight to nine months for her to raise and sell them. In this way she is learning to control her cash flow, which is not sufficient to manage her daily activities.
	
She wants to enlarge her business, so she wants to purchase 10 more goats. In this way she can earn a good amount after all expenditure in her business. 

She has requested a loan of 1,65,000 INR for her group. So that they can earn more and can control their family's cash flow.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing ten goat kids for her goat selling business.

loans.name: Jorge Henry

texts.es:
Jorge es un hombre de 49 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con su esposa y sus dos hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo desde muy joven de trabar, Jorge no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Mecánica, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Chicharrones para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Jorge trabaja brindando servicios de seguridad en una empresa de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Jorge se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos universitarios de sus hijos, como pago de matrícula, compra de útiles de escritorio, libros y otros, de esta manera sus hijos contaran con las herramientas necesarias para cursar adecuadamente sus estudios, así pues Jorge seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Jorge is a 49 year old man. He lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Santiago, with his wife and two children. He loves them and they are his main reason for living. He is a friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person. He and his wife put all of their effort into getting their family ahead. Unfortunately, sue to a lack of resources and out of a need to work when he was very young, Jorge was unable to study Mechanics. In his free time, he likes to watch television and sometimes he cooks delicious chicharrones to share with his family.

On his own initiative, with mush hard work and dedication, Jorge works offering security services at a business in his city. He works every day for around 10 hours and he thinks it is going well for him because of his responsibility and the friendly way he treats others.

Jorge is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they have given he will be able to cover his children's college expenses, such as registration costs, buying school supplies, books and more. This way, her children will have the tools they need for their studies. Jorge will continue to work and strive to achieve his dream of seeing his children have good careers.

loans.use: to cover his children's college costs.

loans.name: Rosa Mercedes

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 38 años de edad estado civil casada tiene 5 hijos vive con sus  hijos vive en el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

La V.R.C Mushuc Pakari está conformada por 10 socios se dedica a la agricultura a 40 minutos de la oficina.

Rosa se dedica a vender legumbres a la agricultura a la siembra de papas, Además se dedica a la crianza de animales como son vacas borregos. Utilizara el dinero del crédito para comprar, fertilizantes, vacuna para las vacas.

 Con la ayuda del credito podrá dedicarce a la gricultura y a la crianza de animales. Las compras las realiza en Guaranda. El sueño es tener un terreno propio y una casa propia.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrentan es la competencia y el mal clima. En el tiempo libre se dedica a pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 38 years old, married, and has five children with whom she lives in the Canton of Guaranda in the Province of Bolívar.

The Mushuc Pakari community bank is made up of 10 members who make a living farming around 40 minutes away from their office.

Rosa works selling vegetables and farming potatoes. She also raises animals such as cattle and sheep. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and vaccines for her cattle. The loan will help her to make a living in agriculture and animal husbandry. She makes her purchases in Guaranda. 

Her dream is to have hr own land and house. The challenges she faces are competition and bad weather. In her free time, she likes spending time with her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and vaccines.

loans.name: Et's Group

texts.en:
A mother of four children who are still in school, Et is 33 years old and a cassava grower on a two hectares area. This primary source of income, which she has been with for 13 years, returns her about 30,700 KHR per day. 

Et has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. This is the first microloan for Et. She has formed a group of two, requesting the same loan amount of 1,000,000 KHR each, and she is the group leader. 

Et will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for plowing fees. She hopes that she can grow her rice timely and gain more yield and a high income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Rotess

texts.en:
Rotess is 23 years old, married but has no children yet. She and her husband are currently residing in a rural community. 

Due to lack of job opportunities, she runs a small variety store to support her husband in generating income. She aims to make the business viable and profitable to earn a higher income. 

To improve the business, she is asking for additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, fruits, candies, breads, beverages, seasonings and mineral water to sell. She hopes that her loan will help her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, fruits, candies, breads, beverages, seasonings and mineral water to sell.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Гулчехре 40 лет, она замужем имеет 3 детей. Несколько лет назад Гулчехра работала на птицеферме, а муж электриком, но  сложилась так что они оба остались без работы. Муж решил  заняться откормом скота, так как это приносит хоть и небольшой доход. Тогда дети были малы и денег хватало, теперь когда дети выросли и в семейном бюджете всегда мало денег. Также они мечтают построить свой дом, так как они живут с родителями мужа Гулчехры и  в будущем там будет мало места для их подрастающих детей. Гулчехра  не хочет продавать скот, так как оно приносит доход, на который могут понемногу начать строительство дома. Для этого она планирует еще докупить скот, что бы  муж мог продать по дороже через несколько месяцев. Гулчехра с мужем очень надеются на помощь КИВА, в получении кредита и покупки скота.
texts.en: Gulchehra is 40 years old, married, and has 3 children. A few years ago, she was working on a poultry farm and her husband was an electrician, but circumstances changed and they were both left unemployed. Her husband decided to get into fattening cattle because it could provide an income, albeit a modest one. At that time, their children were small and the family earnings were sufficient, but now the kids are older and finances are tight. Their dream is to build their own house since they are currently living with Gulchehra's parents-in-law, but as their children grow, it will be too crowded for all of them. Gulchehra does not want to sell their cattle as they bring in earnings that will allow  a little work to begin on the house. This is why she is planning to purchase more cattle so that her husband can sell them for a larger profit in a few months' time. Gulchehra and her husband are really hoping for assistance from Kiva in the form of a loan that will help them to buy cattle.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover her children's school expenses.

loans.name: Ricardo Miguel

texts.es:
Ricardo es un hombre de 71 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona, él es una persona muy amble, trabajador y entusiasta, tiene 2 hijos ya mayores, por quienes ha dedicado todo sus esfuerzos por sacarlos adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Ricardo no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre, Ricardo pudo aprender a tocar diversos instrumentos musicales.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación Ricardo trabaja en su pequeño negocio de animación musical, el trabaja con algunas pequeñas bandas musicales y animando algunas fiestas, Ricardo trabaja todos los días y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Ricardo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una computadora y una impresora, los cuales le servirán de mucho ya que tiene una nieta a su cargo que se encuentra en edad escolar y requiere mejorar sus métodos de estudio, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver nieta convertida en una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 71 years old and lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Parcona. He is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person, he has two children who are adults and for whom he has put all of his efforts into getting ahead. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, and due to the need to work from a young age, Ricardo was unable to pursue a professional degree, but thanks to his father's teachings, Ricardo learned how to play several musical instruments.

At his own initiative and with a lot of hard work and dedication, Ricardo works in his small music performance business, working with small music groups and performing at parties. Ricardo works every day and can do so for approximately ten hours and believes that it is going well thanks to his friendly treatment with his customers.

Ricardo is very grateful to the Kiva loan lenders as it is thanks to the help given that he will be able to buy a computer and a printer which will be of a lot of use to his as he looks after a granddaughter who is at school and needs to improve her study methods. In this way, Ricardo will continue working and making efforts to achieve his great dream of seeing his granddaughter become an upstanding professional.

loans.use: to buy a computer and a printer.

loans.name: Edwin David

texts.es:
Edwin tiene 27 años de edad estado civil soltero vive con su madres  vive en el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

La V.R.C Mushuc Pakari está conformada por 10 socios se dedica a la agricultura a 40 minutos de la oficina.

Edwin se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado, además se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de papas habas. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, fertilizantes, vacuna. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta. las compras las realizará en la ciudad de Guaranda. El sueño es tener casa propia. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia y el mal clima. A que se dedica en el tiempo libre le gusta pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Edwin is 27 years old, is single, and lives with his parents in the Canton of Guaranda in Bolívar Province.

The Mushuc Pakari group is made up of 10 members who make a living in farmings around 40 minutes from their office.

Edwin works raising and selling livestock. He also works in agriculture, growing potatoes and beans.

He is requesting the loan to buy insecticides, fertilizers and vaccines. With the help of the loan, he will be able to buy what he needs. He will buy these items in the city of Guaranda. His dream is to have his own home. The challenges he faces are competition and bad weather. In his free time, he likes to spend time with his family.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, fertilizers and vaccines.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 48 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con su esposa y sus tres hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Luis trabaja brindando servicios de limpieza, en el área de logística de una empresa de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Luis se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de los útiles escolares de sus hijos, ya que estos se encuentran en etapa escolar y necesitan contar con los materiales necesarios para cursar adecuadamente sus estudios, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Luis is a 48 year old man. He lives in the city of Chincha with his wife and three children, whom he lives and who are his main reason for living. He is a friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person. With his wife he puts all of his effort into getting his family ahead. In his free time, he likes to play soccer with his friends and at times cook a delicious carapulcra with sopa seca to share with his family. 

On his own initiative and with much hard work and dedication, Luis works offering cleaning services in the logistics department of a business in his city. He works every day for approximately 10 hours a day and he thinks it is going well for him because of the friendly way he treats others.

Luis is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help he will be able to buy school supplies for his children, since they are school aged and the need materials for their studies. He will continue to work and strive to achieve his biggest dream, which is seeing his children have good careers.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for his children.

loans.name: Edson

texts.en:
Eddie is very happy for the opportunity to get a second Kiva loan. He used his first loan to add on to the little working capital that he had, and this enabled him to serve customers much faster and earn more profits from his mobile money transfers business. From the time that he got his Kiva loan, Eddie says that he has had more demand for his business because customers are saying good things about him and his business.

Eddie has recently started selling cell phone credit (airtime) for all networks using Zoona. It is for this reason that he is taking out another loan so that he can be able to serve his new customers. He says the cell phone credit (airtime) business is a fast-moving consumer good that requires larger working capital and will give him more foot traffic.

Eddie is hopeful that once he gets his second loan, he will be able to make more profits and finally move to a more permanent structure.

loans.use: To add on his working capital so that he can sell more cell phone credit (airtime).

loans.name: Jacob's Group

texts.en: Jacob is a twenty-three year old farmer and KOMAZA Facilitator. His agricultural endeavors face challenges of poor transportation to supply the market and drought. Jacob intends to use the profits from his KOMAZA tree farm to build a good home for his future family.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en: Oun is 40 years old and a married mother of three schoolchildren. She is a  villager from Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Her main source of income is from cassava and rice growing. She has been a farmer for 20 years and currently makes 23,600 KHR per day. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she is a third time borrower while her group member is a fifth time borrower. She has utilized her past loans wisely to upgrade her living status as well as to cover her childrens' education. Now, she and her fellow group member are seeking the same loan amount of, 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and to pay for plowing fees. She believes that she will gain a high yield and earn more income for her children's sake.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides, and to pay for plowing fees

loans.name: Maria Laura

texts.es:
María tiene 26 años de edad estado civil soltera vive con su familia tiene 2 hijos vive en el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

La V.R.C Mushuc Pakari está conformada por los socios se dedica a la agricultura a 40 minutos de la oficina.

María se dedica a la agricultura  a la siembra de papas avena, se dedica a la crianza de animales como son vacas cerdos, además se dedica a la venta de papas y queso.

Utilizara el dinero del crédito para comprar fertilizantes, polvillo, vacuna para las vacas. Con el credito que le otorga la cooperativa mejorara la agricultura y la ganadería. 

Las compras  las realizará en el cantón Guaranda. El sueño es tener casa propia. Los desafíos a los que se enfrentan en la vida es poder sembrar y ontener mejores productos. En el tiempo libre le gusta pasar con la familia.

"Está muy agradecida por el crédito anterior".
texts.en:
María is 26 years old, single, and has two children. She lives with her family in Guaranda Canton in the province of Bolívar. She is a member of the Mushuc Pakari Communal Bank, which is made up of members who work in agriculture and is located 40 minutes from the office of Cooperativa San José. María works in agriculture, growing potatoes and oats, as well as raising animals, including cows and pigs. She also works selling potatoes and cheese.

María is requesting this loan to buy fertilizer, animal feed and vaccinations for her cows. She says that with the loan she will be able to improve her crops and animals. She will buy her supplies in Guaranda Canton. She says that her dream is to have her own home, and that the challenges she faces in life are planting her crops and growing better products. She likes to spend her free time with her family. María says that she is very grateful for her previous loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, animal feed and vaccinations for her cows.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.es:
Vivian, de 35 años de edad, esta casada con Anibal quien es empleado y padre  de sus 03 hijos.  Vive en compañía de su familia en una casa alquilada .La actividad que realiza Vivian es la venta de cosméticos que compra por catálogo y los vende entre sus familiares, amistades y vecinos, a quien atiende de manera amable logrando hacerse conocida.  Esta actividad lo realiza en su propia casa, también lleva los pedidos al domicilio de su cliente.  Lleva más de 02 años realizando este trabajo pero antes de iniciar con esta actividad tenia muchos problemas económicos, el dinero que ganaba su esposo no le alcanzaba para los gastos del hogar situación que ahora a cambiado .Por otro lado tiene planes de ampliar su negocio e instalar un local amplio en su propia casa para la venta de productos de belleza.Este es el  préstamo número  03  con Kiva, por tanto espera su apoyo financiero para continuar con sus objetivos , por lo tanto se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de S/.1200 soles, comprará cosméticos por catalogo buscando así aumentar su stock de mercadería disponible para la venta.
texts.en:
Vivian, 35, is married to Anibal who is an office worker and father to her three children. She lives in the company of her family in a rented house. Vivian makes her living selling cosmetics which she buys through catalogs and sells on to relatives, friends and neighbors who she attends to in a friendly manner and therein makes a name for herself. She performs this activity from her own home and also delivers orders to her customers' homes. She has spent more than two years carrying out this work; but beforehand she had financial difficulties: the money her husband earned did not cover the household costs, a situation which has now changed. 

On the other hand, Vivian has plans to expand the business and set up a large business in her own home by selling beauty products. This is the 3rd loan with Kiva, consequently she relies on your financial support to continue with her aims, as such, she pledges to be punctual in her repayments.

With the 1,200 Peruvian Nuevos Soles requested, Vivian will buy cosmetics by catalog,  with the aim of increasing her stock of merchandise available for sale.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics,

loans.name: Marco

texts.es:
Marco, de 46 años de edad, es soltero y sin hijos , actualmente vive solo en su propia casa. Marco se dedica a sacar copia a distintos documentos para eso cuenta con un local alquilado en el interior de un colegio, desde donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes que en su mayoría son los estudiantes.  Iniciándose hace más de 01 año  con un capital propio  y viendo la necesidad de contar con un ingreso económico para vivir decidió empezar con este negocio.
Le gusta su trabajo pues le permite tener un tiempo libre para realizar otras actividades y tambien porque le genera buenos ingresos económico . Tienen planes de implementar más su negocio y seguir creciendo y generar más dinero para tener su propio local.Este es el préstamo número 03 con Kiva. Por ello cuenta con su apoyo financiero para concretar sus planes por lo tanto se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de S/.1000 nuevos soles, comprará una maquina fotocopiadora buscando así aumentar su ingresos.
texts.en:
Marco is 46 years old, single, and has no children. He currently lives alone in his own home. Marco works making photocopies of various documents, and rents a premises for this in a school, where he serves his customers, the majority of whom are students, in a friendly manner. Setting up over a year ago using his own capital and seeing the need for an income to survive, he decided to establish this business. He enjoys his work as it gives him free time to do other activities and also because he earns good money from it. He plans to continue working, growing his business and making more money to buy his own premises. 

This is his third loan with Kiva. He counts on the financial support provided to cement his plans, and so he promises to make his loan repayments on time. With the amount he is requesting he will buy a photocopier in order to increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier.

loans.name: Oscar William

texts.es:
Oscar es un hombre de 42 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con su esposa y sus dos hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Oscar no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Lomo Saltado para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Oscar trabaja como chofer de taxi, brindando servicios de transporte en su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y porque conoce las zonas donde encontrar mayor cantidad de pasajeros.
Oscar se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos escolares de sus pequeños hijos, como pago de matrícula y compra de útiles escolares, de esta manera Oscar podrá brindar los materiales necesarios para que sus hijos cursen adecuadamente sus estudios, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su empresa de transporte.
texts.en:
Oscar is a 42 year old man. He lives in the city of Nazca with his wife and two children. whom he loves and who are his main reason for living. He is a friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person. He and his wife dedicate all of their effort into getting their family ahead. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, and out of a need to work since he was very young, Oscar was unable to go to college, but he really would have liked to. In his free time, he likes to listen to music and sometimes he cooks a delicious lomo saltado to share with his family. 

On his own initiative, with much hard work and dedication, Oscar works as a taxi driver, offering transportation services in his city. He works every day for approximately 10 hours and he thinks it is going well for him because he knows the areas where the most passengers are.

Oscar is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help he will be able to cover the school expenses of his young children, such as registration fees and school supplies. This way, Oscar will be able to give his children the materials they need to do their studies. He will continue to work and strive to achieve his dream of having his own transportation business.

loans.use: to cover his children's school expenses.

loans.name: In's Group

texts.en: Originally from Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, In is 43 years old and married. She has six children, four of whom are students at the local public school. To deal with the daily cost of living, she and her husband are cassava and rice farmers. She has been in the business for 25 years and is able to earn about 24,000 KHR per day. In, a first time borrower, has formed a group with a second time borrower, to apply for a new loan. She and her joint member are seeking 4,000,000 KHR and 2,000,000 KHR respectively. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to purchase potash, pesticides, and rice seed. She hopes to grow her rice on time so that she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase potash, pesticides, and rice seed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Chamnan

texts.en: Chamnan is 30 years old and a rural citizen from Kampong Cham province where cassava and rice are commonly grown. Currently, she needs to cater for her four children as they are still in school. Besides working in cassava and rice, she also helps her husband at a sesame field for extra income. She has engaged in this current business for 10 years. Having been with VisionFund (Kiva’’s partner) for the past three loan cycles, she feels empowered that she can relieve her family’s burden. Now, she is seeking 4,000,000 KHR in order to pay for plowing fees, potash and insecticides. She hopes that she can gain an increased crop output with high profits for her kids' sake.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fees, potash and insecticides

loans.name: Preciosa

texts.en:
Preciosa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Preciosa has been in this business for 6 years now. Preciosa requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional box of fish to sell.

In the future, Preciosa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional box of fish to sell

loans.name: Chanseng

texts.en:
Chanseng, 38, is a widow and mother of five children, three schoolchildren and two paid-workers, residing in Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She manages two hectares for growing cassava as the main income. She also runs a small grocery stall for supplementing the family’s income. This is the only business that she has been with for 10 years.  

This is the first loan for Chanseng with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking 3,000,000 KHR in order to pay for the plowing fee, pesticide purchase, and weeding fee. In addition, she will buy more grocery items for resale. She hopes to make more income and improve her living condition.

loans.use: To pay for the plowing fee, pesticide purchase, and weeding fee

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is 50 years old and married with seven children.

Ma. Luz works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase shampoo, sugar, canned goods, spices, sugar, and other items to sell. 

Ma. Luz has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Ma. Luz aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, sugar, canned goods, spices, sugar, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Usafi Group

texts.en:
Usafi is a group of 15 farmers in Webuye District represented by Beatrice. The group has 13 women and 2 men.  Beatrice is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of millet, sorghum and sweet potatoes will be delivered to her on credit. Beatrice first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2010 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Beatrice joined One Acre Fund in order to access the best input prices and because One Acre Fund helps needy farmers.

Beatrice reports that before One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about 10 bags of maize per 1 3/4 acre, but with her One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, she harvested 27 bags per 1 3/4 acre! She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and assist her with her own daily needs. Beatrice’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total, they will receive inputs for 7.5 acres of millet and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and sweet potatos

loans.name: Tom

texts.en: A 30-year-old mother of three schoolchildren living in Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Tom is a local farmer who farms cassava on two hectares as her primary source of income. To better feed the family, she and her husband also grow rice on half a hectare of farmland. She has been engaged in this business for the past 10 years. This is the fourth time that Tom has taken a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid back her past loans with success and they have supported her farming activities and increased her income. For this cycle, she is seeking a new loan in order to pay for plowing fees, fertilizer, and weeding fees for her farmland. Moreover, she will use a portion of her loan to buy rubber tree seedlings for extra income. She hopes that she can earn more income and build a decent house for her family.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fees, fertilizer, and weeding fees

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery selling business

loans.name: Sinat's Group

texts.en:
Sinat, age 40 and a local farmer from Kampong Cham province, is married and blessed with five children. Out of her five children, only two still count on her as they are in school. To earn a living, Sinat grows cassava on a two and half hectare area and does rice cropping on one and half hectares of farmland. 

This is not the first loan for Sinat with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has wisely managed her past loan to sustain her business as well as her lifestyle. Now, she is in a group of two to apply for a new loan. She and her fellow group member are requesting a loan amount of 4,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, Sinat will use her loan portion to pay for plowing fees for her cassava. She hopes that she can gain high yield and earn more income.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fees for her cassava

loans.name: Tron

texts.en:
Tron, 30, is a resident of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has four children under her dependency as they are still in school. The two hectares of cassava planting and one hectare of rice cropping are the main source of her family income. For additional income, she also planted rubber trees on a half-hectare area for collecting latex. With this 10 year engagement in the current business, she is able to earn up to 33,800 KHR per day. 

With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she is a fourth cycle client. She has completely repaid her past loan with success in better supporting her agricultural activities. Now, her requested loan amount is 4,000,000 KHR. She will use her loan portion to pay for a plowing fee and to buy pesticide and fertilizer for her cash crops. She hopes to double her income so that she can keep all of her children in school.

loans.use: To pay a plowing fee and to buy pesticide and fertilizer.

loans.name: Lutfullo

texts.ru: Лутфулло предприниматель в возрасти 40 лет, имеет большой опыт в области откармливание КРС. Он живет в сельской местности. Женат, имеет двоих детей сын и дочка. Дети учатся в школе. Данное время у Лутфулло имеется 1 корова с теленком и 2 откормленных быков. Жена доит корову и продает молоко. Лутфулло покупает бычков, откармливает их и продает мясникам. Жена работает в дехканском хозяйстве, а в свободное время помогает мужу. Лутфулло и  его жена  стараются получит больше доходов чтобы их жилищные условия улучшились. Данный момент Лутфулло имеет земельный участок  1 га чтобы выращивать сельхозпродукцию. Он берет кредит для покупки КРС для расширение количество голов КРС чтобы получить больше прибыли.
texts.en: Lutfullo is a 40-year-old businessman who has a lot of experience in the area of fattening cattle. He lives in a rural region. He is married and has 2 children, a son and a daughter, who are in school. His wife works in the local farming sector, and in her free time, she helps her husband. Lutfullo currently has 1 cow with a calf and 2 fattened bulls. His wife milks the cow and sells the milk, and he buys cattle, fattens them and sells them to butchers. He and his wife try to earn a good income so they can improve the family's standard of living and housing conditions. He also has a 1 hectare plot of land where he grows agricultural produce. Lutfullo is seeking a loan to buy cattle to increase his herd so he can earn a larger profit.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora, de 48 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive en su casa propia en compañía de su hija y su sobrino de 12 años de edad a quien quiere mucho.La actividad que realiza Dora es la venta de comestibles para eso cuenta con una bodega instalada en su hogar, desde donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes, se inicio hace más de 01 año con un capital propio y viendo la necesidad de contar con un ingreso decidió empezar con esta aventura .Le gusta su negocio pues le permite estar en la comodidad de su casa y atender a su hija. Por otro lado, lo que no le gusta es que algunos clientes le solicitan créditos por sus compras a lo que se niega pues ya tuvo malas experiencias con este tipo de compra, por lo que todas sus ventas son al contando.
Dora tiene como meta a corto plazo implementar más su negocio y así generar más ingresos económicos.Este es el préstamo número 03 con Kiva ,por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por tanto se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
Con el monto solicitado de S/.1200 nuevos soles comprará productos comestibles a precio por mayor tales como arroz, Azúcar, harina, entre otros para asi obtener mayores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Dora, a 48-year-old single mother, lives in her own home with her daughter and 12-year-old niece, whom she loves very much. Dora works selling groceries from a small store located in her home and from which she waits on her customers in a very kind manner. 

Seeing the need for a source of income, Dora started her business more than a year ago, investing her own money. She says she likes her business because it allows her to work from the comfort of her home while taking care of her daughter. On the other hand, Dora says she does not like it when customers ask to make their purchases on credit. She now conducts all her sales in cash because she has had bad experiences selling on credit.

Dora’s short-term goal is to expand her store and earn more income. This is her third Kiva loan, and with it she hopes to be able to carry out her plans. She says she promises to follow the terms of the loan and make payments. 

Dora will use this loan of 1200 PEN to buy groceries such as rice, sugar and flour at wholesale prices in order to increase her profit margin.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as rice, sugar and flour at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Chanthen

texts.en:
Chanthen, a young mother of two little kids, is a farmer who grows cassava on a one-hectare area as her core income generating business. She earns extra income via working for others for a fee. Her five year engagement in the current business has helped her to earn up to 29,400 KHR per day. 

Her original loan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) was two cycles ago and she has completely paid it back. It has supported her business with a good yield in return. For this cycle, she is seeking 1,500,000 KHR in order to buy rubber tree seedlings to grow for additional income and to pay a plowing fee for her cassava-growing area. She hopes that her living condition is getting better day by day.

loans.use: To buy rubber tree seedlings to grow for additional income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new mobile phone for his own use.

loans.name: Roy

texts.en:
Roy is 24 years old, married, and has one infant-age child. He is a farmer who is raising his family in a rural community. He aimed to increase his vegetable production and income in order to satisfy their necessities and save for future emergencies. 

Due to insufficient capital, he is asking for a loan of PHP10,000 to buy fertilizers, fungicides and sulphate needed in vegetable production. He hopes that he will be having a plentiful harvest this coming harvest season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, fungicides and sulphate needed in vegetable production.

location.town: Brgy. Balangubong, Watwat, Kasibu, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Star Group

texts.en:
Hezron, a member of Star Group in Webuye District, is pictured with 14 One Acre Fund farmers, 10 women and 4 men. Hezron is standing on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of millet, sorghum and sweet potato cultivation. He first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains, and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Hezron joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for his family and use increased profits to send his children to school.

Hezron reports that before One Acre Fund, he was able to grow about 7 bags of maize per ½ acre, but with his One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, he harvested 14 bags per 1/2 acre! He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and repair his home. Hezron’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for 7 acres of maize and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and sweet potato.

loans.name: Deyanira

texts.es: En la ciudad de Cartagena Deyanira de 62 años prepara congelados y vende refrescos en su domicilio, desde hace 6 años, cuando inició aprendiendo a hacer deditos de queso y posteriormente feu agregando empanadas y productos congelados  diversos , además de chicha y refrescos . Suis principales clientes son los vecinos del barrio y de otros sectores en otras comunidades que le compran de contado y muchas veces a credito que pagan en plazos cortos. En la actualidad está a plicando a un credikiva, segundo financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con los cuales comprará harina de trigo, maíz, refrescos y queso. Con su anterior crédito mejoró la calidad en su presentación y aumentó su volumen de ventas lo cual repercutió en el incrmento de sus utilidades. Su meta es continuar creciendo y dirigirse al mercado de los comerciantes y de las casas de eventos, así como los hogares para niños. Deyanira habita con su esposo y tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad con los que sueña sean siempre prósperos.
texts.en:
In the city of Cartagena, 62 year old Deyanira prepares frozen foods and sells soda in her home. She began six years ago, when she started learning how to make cheese fingers. Later, she added empanadas and other frozen goods to her repertoire, as well as soda and the traditional drink of chicha. Her main customers are her neighbors and people from other areas who buy items from her in cash and often on short-term credit. 

Today, she is applying for a loan from Kiva, her second from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to buy wheat flour, corn, soda and cheese. She used her previous loan to improve the presentation of her food and increase sales, which in turn, increased her profits. Her goal is to continue growing and target the trader and events venue markets, as well as children's homes. Deyanira lives with her husband and has three grown-up children who she hopes will always be prosperous.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, corn, soda and cheese.

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
A 28-year-old mother of three kids who are still in school, Yan is also a farmer who resides in Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. The two hectares of cassava planting and one hectare of rice cropping, which she has been with for 10 years, return her about 29,700 KHR per day. 

Never having been with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner) before, she is seeking 2,000,000 KHR in order to buy fertilizer, pesticide and to lease additional farmland for growing more crops. She hopes to gain high yields and sell with high prices so she can sustain her living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and to lease additional farmland.

loans.name: Sadriddin

texts.ru: Садриддин молодой парень возрасте 27 лет. Женат пока не имеет детей. Садриддин у себя дома имеет корову и телёнка. Корова каждый день дает по 10-12 литров молока. В основном животноводством занимается жена , а сам Садриддин занимается купля продажей минеральных удобрении . Животноводством они занимаются более 10 лет и так как от этого получают  хорошую прибыль они хотят расширить свой  бизнес. Для этого Садриддин обратился нашу организацию, чтобы получит кредит. Заранее благодарит за поддержку.
texts.en: Sadriddin is a young man of 27. He is married but does not yet have children. He has a cow and calf that he keeps at home. The cow gives about 10-12 litres of milk per day. His wife is the one who mainly takes care of the cattle, while Sadriddin sells mineral fertilizer for a living. They have been involved in animal husbandry for more than 10 years, and because it brings in a good income, they want to expand this business. For this reason, Sadriddin has approached our organisation for a loan. He extends his thanks in advance for the support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Merycel Karolina

texts.es: Marycel es una joven de 21 años, dedicada a educar niños desde hace un poco menos de dos años; ella tiene un centro de refuerzos de niños que están en el jardín infantil hasta finalizar su educación primaria. Su centro de atención, está bien dotado, porque está atenta a su modernización. Hoy requiere comprar nuevos y modernos materiales de estudio, papelería, libros y juegos didácticos. Su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para responder a su meta actual, esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, que invertirá en estos artículos y logrará aumentar la calidad de su enseñanza haciéndola cada vez más lúdica para los niños. Su éxito radica en el reconocimiento que hacen de su labor en la comunidad la que hace que cada vez sean muchos mas los niños que piden estar en su centro de refuerzo, lo cal la hace muy feliz por poder servir a la sociedad.
texts.en:
Marycel is a young woman aged 21, who has worked teaching children for just under two years. She has a day-care centre for children in kindergarten up until the end of primary education. Her center is well equipped, because she pays attention to its modernization. 

Today, she needs to buy new, modern study materials, paper, books and educational games. Her working capital isn't large enough to meet her current goal, which is why she is requesting a loan from Kiva. She will invest the loan in these items to improve the quality of her teaching, making it clearer for the children. Her great success is shown through the acknowledgement of her success in the community, which leads to ever greater numbers of children asking to attend her center. This makes her very happy because she is serving society.

loans.use: to buy new, modern study materials, paper, books and educational games.

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en:
Ketevan is 39 years old. She lives in the Akhmeta district with her retired mother, Mariam. The family owns a small plot of agricultural land where maize is grown. The harvested maize is sold locally at the markets. Ketevan and Mariam are tailors, and they have a small commercial space where they create custom made clothing. They get private orders from their villagers to sew different kinds of clothing. 

Ketevan requested a loan for enlarging their commercial space. She will purchase building materials and also add more sewing machines and develop her business. This will increase the client number and also the family's monthly income. With more income Ketevan will be able to renovate her house and have better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase building materials for enlarging their commercial space.

loans.name: Odisha Self Help Group

texts.en:
Narmada is engaged in the activity of decorating and making tent houses for events like marriages and during other Hindu rituals. She has tents, a few musical instruments and speakers with her which she used to install wherever the events are performed. She has 5 years of experience in this activity.

Narmada lives with her husband and two children. She is a responsible 30-year-old leader of the loan group named Odisha Self Help Group, and lives in a small village of Odisha, India. Odisha Self Help Group has ten members,  all women, living in the same neighborhood but involved in various types of activities.

She, along with her group membersk has requested a loan amount of 250,000 Indian Rupees (INR) for purchasing new upgraded music instruments and bamboo for installing her tent house and to hire few more labourers for help.

She wants to save some money for her family's better future and for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy new upgraded music instruments and bamboo for installing her tent house.

loans.name: Betman

texts.es:
Betman es un hombre de 36 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar dese muy joven, Betman no pudo estudiar para convertirse en Policía, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar un riquísimo Seco de Res para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Betman se dedica a la agricultura, el tiene un pequeño cultivo de yuca, en donde realiza diversas labores de campo, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su experiencia  y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Betman se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos del mantenimiento, abono y cosecha de su cultivo, de esta manera Betman podrá lograr que su cultivo se desarrolle adecuadamente y logre una buena venta, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ampliar sus cosechas y la variedad de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Betman is 36 years old, single, and lives in the city of Pucallpa. He is kind, hardworking and enthusiastic, with a strong desire to get ahead. Regrettably, although he would have liked very much to study to become a police officer, he was not able to because of a lack of resources and needing to work from a young age.

In his free time Betman likes to cook a delicious Seco de Res [a cilantro beef stew] to share with his family. 

On his own initiative and with a lot of effort and determination, Betman works in agriculture. He has a small crop of cassava for which he must do a number of jobs in the field. Betman works every day for approximately 10 hours, and he thinks he does well because he is experienced and treats others with kindness.

Betman is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to their support he will be able to maintain, fertilize and harvest his crop. In this way, he can ensure that he obtains a good harvest and good sales. Betman says he will continue to work and strive for his greatest dream, which is to increase the size and variety of his harvests.

loans.use: to maintain, fertilize, and harvest his cassava crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies.

loans.name: Lot's Group

texts.en:
A 30-year-old single lady from Kampong Cham province of Cambodia, Lot is a local farmer who manages a one-and-a-half-hectare area for cassava growing and another two hectares for rice growing. She has been involved in the business for 10 years. Including this cycle, Lot is a third time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

She has utilized her past loan in a gradual manner to support her business, and it also helped her to provide decent food for her children. Now, she will use her new loan amount to buy fertilizer, rice seed and insecticide for her farmland. She hopes to gain great growth of her business and to uplift her living status.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed and insecticide for her farmland.

loans.name: Ye's Group

texts.en:
A 39-year-old married father of three kids (two schoolchildren and one a farmer), Ye is a resident from Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. He manages four hectares of cassava growing and a half hectare of rice growing, from which he is able to earn up to 41,600 KHR per day. This is the third microloan for Ye’s group, consisting of two members, including him. He has paid back his past loan completely and it has supported his business in timely fashion as well as improving his living at a good pace. 

Now, he and his co-borrower are seeking 4,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, Ye will use his loan portion to lease an additional plot of farmland for growing more cassava, and to pay for weeding and for buying pesticide. He hopes to gain triple yields and earn more income for his family’s sake.

loans.use: To lease an additional plot of farmland.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a 43-year-old married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 3 years to 19 years. He describes himself to be an honest and God-fearing man. He operates a retail business where he sells pigs. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located at a viable business area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase pigs to sell. His business goal is to expand his business within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy pigs to sell.

loans.name: Ganbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Ganbayar is 23 years old, and lives with his siblings and parents in a house in Uvs province of Mongolia. His parents run a small business of their own. His sibling studies at university and the youngest one goes to a local kindergarten. 

He has graduated college and is working as a driver in a transportation company. Now he is starting his own business at home of wooden furniture manufacturing, since he has been helping his cousins and uncles to run their business from the time he was little and has gained a lot of experience in wooden furniture manufacturing. 

He is now requesting 2,000,000 Tugriks (MNT) to purchase starting inventory for his new wooden furniture manufacturing business. He is a hardworking and diligent man.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory for his new wooden furniture manufacturing business

loans.name: Benta

texts.en:
Benta is a 51-year-old married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be a hardworking and determined woman in her business. She operates a beauty salon where she provides hair services. Her business is located in a conducive business environment. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

She will use the 80,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to buy beauty products. Her business goal is to run three more beauty salon within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy beauty salon equipment

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a furniture making business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing 29,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy supplies for her furniture making business.

Emma has been in this business for 32 years. Emma earns more income from a general store.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her furniture making business.

loans.name: Anar

texts.ru: Анар 54 года, замужем, воспитывает 5 взрослых детей. Анар имеет высшее образование, она преподаватель немецкого языка. В течении 28 лет проработала преподавателем, имеет награду "отличник образования". В качестве дополнительного источника дохода Анар работает бухгалтером  в одном из муниципальных предприятий. В качестве основного источника дохода для семьи, в 1995 году Анар начала заниматься животноводством. Начатое с суммы 15,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство Анар на сегодняшний день приносит около 12,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Анар обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку  15 овец и 1 бычка. Доходы Анар планирует вложить в увеличение своего хозяйства. Анар планирует построить дом и женить сына.
texts.en: Anar is 54 years old, married, and has raised 5 now-grown children. She has a post-secondary education and is a teacher of German. For 28 years, she worked as a teacher and was awarded the title of "Excellent Educator." As a means of supplementary income, she works as a bookkeeper for a municipal organisation. In 1995, Anar got into animal husbandry as the main source of earnings for the family. She started this business with a sum of only 15,000 Kyrgyzstan Som (KGS), and today it brings in around 12,000 Som per month. For the purpose of further developing her business, Anar has approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 120,000 Som to purchase 15 sheep and 1 bull. She plans to use the income generated by this loan to expand her farm. In the future, she wants to build a house and host a wedding for her son.

loans.use: To purchase 15 sheep and 1 bull

loans.name: Srean

texts.en:
Srean is a 30-year-old mother of four schoolchildren living in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. From one hectare of cassava and one-and-a-half hectares of rice growing, she is able to earn up to 30,600 KHR per day. 

A first time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Srean is seeking 2,000,000 KHR in order to buy potash, pesticide and rice seed, and to pay a plowing fee. She hopes to earn more income from her current business so that she can buy an additional plot of farmland for expanding her cropping business.

loans.use: To buy potash, pesticide, rice seed, and to pay a plowing fee.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 29 years old and married to a farmer. They were gifted with four children and they live happily in a rural community. She and her husband help each other in planting vegetables to ensure a high production. 

They aim to expand their vegetable plantation in order to increase their production. Due to insufficient capital, Rita is asking for an additional PHP 10,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides needed in vegetable production. She hopes that they will be having a plentiful harvest.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides needed in vegetable production.

loans.name: Inesa

texts.en:
Inesa is 23 years old. She lives with her parents and grandmother in Batumi District. Inesa requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected every time, because of low income and the family's poor living conditions.

Inesa's father serves local people as a taxi driver and gets a monthly income. Inesa's grandmother is provided with a retirement pension. It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

Inesa requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of low income. 

With the received credit Inesa will trade with used clothing. She plans to purchase used clothing from the wholesalers and then resell it with a price markup. Inesa has a commercial space, where she plans to open her shop for used clothing. She will work there as a saleslady and will serve her clients. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family and Inesa will be able to increase the income of her family.

loans.use: to start a used clothing store

loans.name: Deivy

texts.es: Deivy, tiene la edad  de 24 años, está soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de herramientas  y equipo para la construcción. Además de poder comprar unas herramientas de una mejor calidad y que le puedan brindar un buen rendimiento en el momento de desarrollar los trabajos. Con estas herramientas espera realizar los trabajos en menos tiempo y mejorar su calidad de trabajo y tener más ofertas de construcción y espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en la actividad y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Deivy is 24 years old, he is single and lives with his parents and siblings who are his main priority. With this loan, he plans on buying construction equipment and tools. As well as being able to buy a few better quality tools and to make him more efficient in his work. With these tools, he hopes to carry out his work in less time and improve the quality of his work as well as have more construction requests. Deivy also hopes that he will earn a bit of profits, in doing so improve his family's living conditions as well as invest a bit more in his trade and achieve a few goals. This is Deivy's first loan from FUDECOSUR. He has never had any other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR offered the loan with easier access and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Lisbeth

texts.es: Lisbeth de 33 años de edad,  habita en el municipio de Baranoa, donde se dedica a la venta de artículos para el hogar, ropa y ofrece servicios de comunicaciones por internet, desde hace 4 años, cuando inició vendiendo productos mediante guías especializadas o catálogos, con las cuales promocionaba los artículos. Sus ventas las realiza de contado todos los días, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, a clientes ubicados alrededor de su negocio. Su meta mas adelante es incrementar los créditos gradualmente, para inyectarle capital de trabajo a su negocio y hacerlo crecer paulatinamente. Su sueño es ver convertido a sus hijos en personas exitosas, invirtiendo en una educación de calidad. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará ropa, perfumería y portarretratos, que tiene encargados por sus clientes y planea responder  oportunamente con esta inversión.
texts.en: Thirty-three year old Lisbeth lives in the municipality of Baranoa.  There she makes a living selling household items and clothes and internet communication services.  Lisbeth started this four years ago, when she began selling items from specialised guides or catalogues, which she used to promote products.  She sold her products for cash every day, from 8am until 8pm, to customers in the local area.  Lisbeth's future goal is to increase her loans gradually so she can inject some working capital in the business and little by little expand it.  Her dream is to see her children grow up to be successful and to invest in a good education for them.  She is currently applying for a Kiva loan that she will use to buy clothes, perfumes and picture frames for her customers.  She intends on taking full advantage of this investment.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfumes and photo frames.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge Alberto de 48 años de edad, soltero, padre de un hijo, originario del departamento de Chinandega, ubicado en el occidente de Nicaragua, hace 19 años inicio su negocio debido a que antes el había sido enfermero y tenía que realizar turnos por la noche y el desvelo estaba afectando su salud, por lo consiguiente decido poner un negocio Salón  de belleza, ya que el es un hombre muy creativo, carismático con las gente  y estético, el cual lo ha ubicado en su casa de habitación, el vende servicio de manicura, pedicura, corte de cabello, blower, planchado, tenaceado, ondulaciones, alisados entre otros servicios relacionados con la belleza, también es docente donde enseña cómo se hacen los servicios de belleza. En un futuro con las ganancias de su negocio el sueña comprar su casa ya que el no tiene donde vivir y el alquila un lugar para vivir. Jorge Alberto solicita este crédito para comprar productos y artículos de belleza y así mejorar la calidad de su trabajo ya que su demanda ha venido creciendo poco a poco y ahora es mayor. Agradece a los inversionistas Kiva que gracias a ellos ha mejorado su sala de belleza.
texts.en:
Jorge Alberto, 48, is the single father of one son. He was born in Chinandega department in western Nicaragua. He started his business 19 years ago after becoming sick and having to work the night shift, which made his health worse. He opened a beauty salon in his house because he is creative, charming, and stylish. He offers manicures, pedicures, hair cuts, blow drying, ironing, braiding, waving, straightening, and other services. He also offers classes in beauty services. 

He hopes to use his profits to buy a house, as he now rents his home. Jorge Alberto is applying for a loan to buy beauty supplies and products to improve his services, as demand is slowly increasing.  He thanks the Kiva lenders whose support has helped him improve his salon.

loans.use: to buy beauty salon supplies: hair irons, dryers, cosmetics, nail polish, lipsticks, blushers, and more.

loans.name: Casimira

texts.es:
Casimira es originaria de Ciudad Darío una histórica y linda ciudad, su estado civil estado civil es soltera y tiene dos hijos. 

Ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer de mucho esfuerzo y carismática con su compañero de labores.
Casimira es trabajadora de una empresa de servicio de acueducto y alcantarillado, su función es en el área de limpieza, manifiesta que se siente bien ser parte de dicha empresa ya que son mas de ochos años de servicio brindado.

Solicita un crédito  para mejorar el sistema eléctrico de su casa ya que se encuentra en mal estado y necesita comprar algunos accesorios y pagar la mano de obra de la reparación del sistema eléctrico.

Manifiesta sentirse agradecida ya que con los préstamos que le han brindado ceprodel y kiva ha mejorado su vivienda y tiene mejor comodidad en su casa.
texts.en:
Casimira is originally from the city Darío, a historic and lovely city, she is single and she has two children. 

She is known to be a dedicated person and charismatic with her colleagues. 

Casimira works for an aqueduct and sewage company. She works in cleaning and she says that she is happy to be part of the company where she has been working for more than 8 years. 

She is asking for a loan to improve the electricity in her home because it is in need of repair and she needs to purchase some hardware and to pay for the installation labor. 

She says she is grateful for the loans through ceprodel and Kiva because they allow her to improve her home and to be more comfortable in her house.

loans.use: improve the electricity in her home, purchase hardware and pay for labor.

loans.name: River Nzioa Group

texts.en:
River Nzoia is a group of 16 farmers in Webuye District, represented by Joseph. The group has 14 women and 2 men. Joseph is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming supplies will be delivered to him on credit, consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of millet, sorghum and sweet potatoes. Joseph joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains of 2010, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Joseph joined One Acre Fund so that he could access the best prices and because One Acre Fund delivers its supplies early.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Joseph was only able to harvest 6.5 bags of maize per 1 acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, he was able to harvest 30 bags per acre! He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and invest in livestock. Joseph's group members will each receive loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive supplies for 8 acres of maize and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet sorghum and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and supplies such as paint and enamel

loans.name: Arnoldo

texts.es:
Arnoldo es originario de la linda ciudad de Darío, origen del gran poeta Rubén Darío.
Su estado civil es casado tiene dos hijos, se caracteriza por ser hombre muy responsable comprometido con el bienestar de su familia.

Arnoldo se desempeña como operador de equipo de una empresa de servicio de acueducto y alcantarillado desde hace más de diez años, su función específica es darle mantenimiento y manipular equipo que sirven para transportar el agua a los domicilio.

solicita un financiamiento que lo va destinar para complementar la compra de un lote de terreno el cual tiene planeado regalárselo a unos de sus hijos.

Arnoldo agradece el apoyo que le puedan brindar ceprodel y kiva.
texts.en:
Arnoldo is originally from the lovely city Darío, birthplace of the great poet Rubén Darío.
He is married and has two children. He is known to be a responsible man who is dedicated to the well being of his family. 

Arnoldo is an equipment operator at an aqueduct and sewage company where he has worked for more than 10 years. His job is primarily maintenance and working with the equipment that is used to transport water to homes. 

He is asking for a loan that he will use to purchase a plot of land that he plans to give to one of his two children. 

Arnoldo is grateful for the support he has received from Ceprodel and Kiva.

loans.use: purchase a plot of land.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Se acerca la temporada en la cual se celebra el día de las madres y los pedidos de los clientes de Maria, no se han hecho esperar. Ella está muy satisfecha pero el volumen de solicitudes, pero son  superiores a su capacidad de respuesta, por eso está ahorrando y aplica  un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará ropa y calzado para complacer a su clientela y así aumentar sus ventas. Con su anterior credikiva le fue muy bien, porque aumentaron sus inventarios de mercancías y logró acceder a nuevos clientes, todo esto ayuda al mejoramiento de su calidad de vida. Maria envía el siguiente mensaje “Gracias a la gente de Kiva por haberme permitido ampliar mi negocio.“
texts.en: The season for celebrating Mother's Day is approaching and Maria's customers have already been putting in requests. She is very satisfied to have such a high volume of requests, but they are greater than her capacity to fulfill them. And so, she is saving money and applying for a new loan with Kiva that she will use to purchase more clothing and shoes in order to meet her customer's demands and be able to increase sales. With her previous loan, everything went well because she was able to expand her merchandise and she was also able to attract new customers and all of this together has helped her to improve her quality of life. Maria sends the following message: "Thank you to the people at Kiva who have helped me to expand my business. "

loans.use: purchase clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Bernabé

texts.es:
Bernabé es originario de la comarca Chaguitillo Sebaco, su estado civil es casado tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Este señor se caracteriza por ser una persona responsable, honrada y trabajador.

Actualmente se desempeña como operador de pozo de agua de una empresa de servicio acueducto, su centro de trabajo está largo de su casa de habitación y tiene que hacer uso del medio de transporte de una bicicleta el cual es un poco cansado.

Bernabé solicita un crédito a kiva para comprar una motocicleta marca génesis de 125 cc, el cual le será de mucha importancia ya que se podrá movilizar más rápido para su centro de trabajo y también para otras actividades le servirá.

Manifiesta sentirse alegre y agradecido con kiva ya que con los financiamientos que ha recibido le han sido de gran impacto en su entorno familiar ya que ha realizado mejoras en su vivienda y esto le permite tener mejor comodidad y ahora podrá ser posible la compra de su medio de transporte.
texts.en:
Bernabé was born in the district of Chaguitillo Sebaco. He is married and has two school-age children. He is responsible, honest, and hardworking. He's a water well operator for a water supply and sewage company. His workplace is far from his house, and riding his bike to work is tiring.

Bernabé is applying to Kiva for a loan to buy a Génesis 125cc motorcycle, which is important because he will be able to get to work and do other things much faster. He is pleased and grateful to Kiva for the funding he has received. It has had a tremendous impact on his family's surroundings because he has been able to renovate and make his house more comfortable. Now he will be able to buy a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy a Génesis 125cc motorcycle.

loans.name: Daudi

texts.en:
Daudi is a 32-year-old-man from Migori, married to Rose, and they have three children between the ages of one year and six years old.

He is a mechanic and he has rendered his services for the last three years, earning a monthly income of about KES 15,000. This is his first loan from KADET LTD - a loan of KES 20,000, which he intends to use in purchasing a welding machine that he will use in the business. 

The anticipated profits will be used to expand the business and repay the loan. His dream is to create jobs for youths and lead a good life.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine for his workshop.

loans.name: Anilyn

texts.en:
This is Anilyn, 39, a resident of Cabrera, Philippines. She is married to Gilberto, a vendor, and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Anilyn operates the buy-and-sell business of her family. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell for a little profit. Her products are men and women’s clothes and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy RTW products and merchandise items like men's and women’s wear to expand her product inventory.

Anilyn hopes to have another stall. She dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of merchandise needed in her business, like men and women's clothing.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is married with four children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother). 

Amina has a business of a retail shop and has been in this business for seven years.  She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cooking oil, soap, rice and bread.  She generates additional income through poultry farming. 

She works from her home and sells to all categories of people, but on retail. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. 

Amina aspires to own a fully stocked retail shop and also to educate her children up to university.  She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, soap, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Nicolasa Emperatriz

texts.es: Nicolasa,  De 66 años, casada, madre de dos hijos, hace 8 años decidió iniciar una panadería con el apoyo de su esposo en su casa donde elaboran un  pan riquísimo que es muy popular entre sus vecinos y tiene muchos clientes y venden pan simple como: el llamado pan francés, enquesado, galletas entre otros. Dulce: empanada, picos, bonetes, tortas entre otros. Ya a su avanzada edad ella sueña con arreglar su pequeña casa con sus ganancias, y tener un hogar digno donde vivir. con los financiamientos que se le ha otorgado ha logrado crecer mas de lo que pensaba , al igual que ha incrementado su demanda sus cliente son fijos y eventuales debido a su excelente y riquísimo pan que ella elabora con muchos esfuerzos, amor, y entusiasmo para que su producción de pan sea conocido y comido en todo momento. Nicolasa solicita este crédito para compra de materia prima como: harina, azúcar, queso, manteca, levadura, sal, leña entre otros y darle mantenimiento al motor de pasteadora.
texts.en:
