Nicolasa, 66, is married and has two children. 8 years ago she decided to set up a bakery in her home with the support of her husband. 

They make delicious bread, which is very popular with her neighbours and she has plenty of clients. They sell basic bread like the so-called "French" bread, cheesy bread and biscuits etc. as well as sweet breads like empanada, nibbles and cakes, among others. As she is older, she dreams of being able to repair her little house with her earnings and to have a suitable home. 

With the money that she has borrowed she has succeeded in growing her business more than she expected, the demand from her regular and occasional customers has increased thanks to the excellent and delicious bread that she makes with a great amount of effort, love and enthusiasm for bread making. 

Nicolasa is requesting this loan to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, cheese, butter, yeast, salt and firewood among others and to repair the motor on her cake maker.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like: flour, firewood, sugar, cheese, butter, salt, ham and biscuits among other things.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman with three children ranging from seven months to eleven years old. She describes herself as a polite and humble woman. Previously she took out a loan of Kes 50,000 which she managed to repay successfully. She plans to buy more meat for expanding her business with this new loan of Kes 50,000. 

She has been operating a butcher shop for the last eight years. In addition, she runs a rental houses business which she adds to her income. She looks forward to being the best meat distributor in her home area.

loans.use: to purchase meat.

loans.name: Meri

texts.en:
Meri is 30 years old. She lives in Shalauri village, Telavi district with her parents, brother, aunt and retired grandmother. Meri is trading in adornments. She buys at wholesale prices from the market and sells with a price markup among her villagers. 

The family has a milk cow and a calf. Meri’s father milks the cow to make dairy products and sells them locally at the markets. Her brother is trading with vegetables to earn a small monthly income. Her mother is working in the kindergarten as a cook. In addition, Meri’s aunt has a social pension from a government institution, as she is an invalid. 

Meri requested a loan for purchasing a stock of adornments. After she has a bigger stock, she will be able to offer better choices to her clients. This will increase her income and give Meri the opportunity to help her family and provide better living conditions for them.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of adornment.

loans.name: Kaldykyz

texts.ru: Калдыкыз 46 лет, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Калдыкыз в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении многих лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 40,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Калдыкыз в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы и 3 лошади и ежегодно обрабатывает 2,88 га земли, продажа молока и полеводство приносит около 12,000 сом в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Калдыкыз обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 4 нетелей по 20,000 KGS, на 10,000 KGS закупить ГСМ, на 10,000 KGS закупить семена фасоли в дальнейшего увеличения доходов от продажи молока и молочных продуктов и доходов от полеводства. Доходы от кредита Калдыкыз будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Kaldykyz is 46 years old, married, and has 3 children. As the main breadwinner of the family, for many years she has been working in animal husbandry, having started this business with a sum of 40,000 Kyrgyzstan Som. Thanks to her hard work, today her farm includes 2 cows and 3 horses, and she works a 2.88 hectare plot of land every year. The sale of milk and agricultural produce brings in earnings of around 12,000 Som per month. For the purpose of further developing her business, Kaldykyz has approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 Som to buy 4 heifers for 20,000 Som each, 10,000 Som worth of fuel, and 10,000 Som worth of bean seeds so that she can increase her income from selling milk, dairy products, and agricultural produce. She will use the income generated by this loan to invest into the development of her business.

loans.use: To purchase 4 heifers and to prepare for spring work

loans.name: Romel Santiago

texts.es:
Romel Santiago es originario del municipio de El Sauce, casado, originario de una familia muy humilde, trabajadora que se han dedicado la mayor parte de su vida al comercio.

 Su negocio lo inició hace cinco años con una pequeña venta de jabón y golosinas, pero gracias a los distintos créditos que le ha financiado Kiva a través de Ceprodel hoy tiene una pulpería bien surtida de productos de abarrotería y logró adquirir una moto taxi con la cual brinda el servicio de taxi a los pobladores de dicho municipio y sus visitantes.

Cabe señalar que trabaja en conjunto con su esposa cuando él sale a hacer viajes en la moto ella queda atiendo el negocio.

Su negocio es muy concurrido por los pobladores del barrio El Pedernal por la variedad de productos que ofrece y por la amabilidad del cliente.

Actualmente está solicitando un crédito para surtir dicho negocio, ya que se acerca la temporada de semana santa con el cual piensa comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, harina, papel higiénico, frijoles y jabón.

Agradece a kiva y Ceprodel por el apoyo que le han brindado todo este tiempo ya que se ha superado económicamente gracias a estos préstamos y espera que le sigan apoyando para el futuro.
texts.en:
Romel Santiago is originally from the municipality of El Sauce, is married and originally from a very humble and hard-working family who have spent the majority of their lives in commerce.

He started his business five years ago with the sale of small amounts of soap and candy, but thanks to the various loans that Kiva has financed for him through Ceprodel, today he has a well-stocked grocery store and he was able to acquire a motorcycle taxi with which he offers taxi services to the residents of his municipality and its visitors.

It should be noted that he works together with his wife. When he leaves to offer rides in the moto taxi she stays and attends to the store. His business is very busy with the residents of the El Pedernal neighborhood because of the variety of products it offers and its customer friendliness.

He is currently requesting a loan to stock said business with rice, sugar, oil, flour, toilet paper, beans and soap, since Semana Santa (Easter week) is coming up.  He is thankful to Kiva and Ceprodel for the support they have provided him all this time since he has succeeded economically thanks to these loans and he hopes that they continue supporting him in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, flour, toilet paper, beans and soap

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and pay for labour and ploughing

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Married to a social welfare worker and the mother of six children, Esi has been selling kenkey (a traditional corn-based dish that is wrapped in banana leaves) in Akonoma, near Cape Coast, for 10 years. Esi, who received no formal education, is responsible for helping her husband pay their general bills and their children's school fees.

Esi's loan will be used to purchase more corn, thus allowing her to prepare more kenkey. She hopes to use the new profits arising from her business to expand her enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase more corn, thus allowing her to prepare more kenkey.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is a very hardworking person who explains that, thanks to her effort, she has been able to get ahead. The previous Kiva loan has been a big help to her and she is very grateful for it.

Today, she comes again. Zainabu is requesting the loan to construct more rental houses, to buy construction materials such as bricks, shovels, cement and other materials.

She is again grateful for the opportunity she is receiving because it will help her a lot.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as bricks, shovels, cement and other materials.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Fatuma's Group

texts.en: Fatuma is a thirty-five-year-old mother of seven. She and her husband are farmers and also own chickens. She faces challenges in her farming due to the frequent droughts and also having no transport to take her crops to the market. She hopes to use the income from her KOMAZA trees to send all of her children to school, and also to build a better house for her family.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 40 years old and married to Joyce who also contributes to the family income. He has been running his business for about 11 years with an income of approximately KES 4,500. 

This is his first loan from KADET LTD and he wants to use it to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits to sell. He hopes to expand his business and be a wholesaler.

loans.use: to add more stock of vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Peris' Group

texts.en: Peris is a 27-year-old mother of four. She and her husband have a farm where they grow maize, peas, and also keep chickens. She faces the challenge of not having a large enough plot of land to grow enough crops to feed her family. She hopes to use the income from her trees, funded by KOMAZA, to send her children to school. She also would like to buy some land to increase the size of her farm.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be a determined and ambitious woman. She operates a beauty salon where she provides hair services. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located within an urban business environment. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of paying employees. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy beauty products. Her business goal is to run a bigger beauty salon within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM after managing to pay a previous loan of KES 20,000 successfully.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 31 years old, married and has five children to support. She has been running her grocery business for about three years with an income of KES 25,000 a month.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD and wants to use it to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell. She hopes to expand her business and give her children a quality education.

loans.use: to add to her stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: Alfred has done great with his previous loans from KADET LTD. He is requesting his third loan to help him fulfill a contract he has won for painting the offices at the town center. He hopes to improve his business and be known in town as the best painter.

loans.use: to purchase paint and new equipment for welding and painting

loans.name: Anarkan

texts.ru: Анаркан 60 лет, замужем, Анаркан  имеет 5 взрослых детей, которые активно помогают по хозяйству. По характеру человек очень хороший, спокойный, целеустремленный. Благодаря стараниям и трудолюбию Анаркан её бизнес очень хорошо развивается. Она занимается откормом с последующей реализацией скота, и полеводством. Начав этот бизнес в 1995 году с 3,500 KGS сейчас у неё имеется очень развитое хозяйство. Ежемесячный доход Анаркан составляет 5,000 KGS Сом. Она обратилась в "Бай Тушум и Партнеры" за кредитом в размере 20,000 KGS сом. На полученные средства она собирается закупить овец. Анаркан поделилась с нами что в будущем планирует отремонтировать дом и улучшить жилищные условия семьи.
texts.en: Anarkan is 60 years old, married, and has 5 grown children who actively help her on her farm. She is a very kind, calm, and determined person by nature. Thanks to her efforts and hard work, her business is developing very well. She fattens and sells cows for a living, and also grows crops. Having started this business in 1995 with a sum of only 3,500 Kyrgyzstan Som, she now has a very developed farm that brings in a monthly income of 5,000 Som. Anarkan has now approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 20,000 Som that she will use to buy sheep. She has indicated that in the future she plans to carry out home repairs and improve the housing conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Milagros Madeleine

texts.es:
Milagros es una mujer de 20 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para ayuda r a su familia, Milagros no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar vóley con sus amigas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz Verde para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Milagros trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de golosinas, ella ocupa un pequeño espacio en su vivienda, la cual es  cercana a un centro educativo de su ciudad y trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas, Milagros cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Milagros se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad de  mercadería, como gaseosas, galletas, dulces, algunos útiles escolares y otros, de esta manera Milagros tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido y podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder convertirse en una gran comerciante de golosinas que realice ventas al por mayor.
texts.en:
Milagros is a 20-year-old single woman living in the city of Cañete, in the district of Imperial with her parents and siblings. She is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to overcome. Unfortunately, because of the lack of resources and for the necessity to work to help her family, Milagros hasn't been able to study Business Administration. In her free time she likes to play volleyball with her friends and on some occasions she cooks a delicious Arroz Verde (green rice) to share with her family.

By her own initiative, with much persistence and dedication, Milagros works in her small business selling sweets. She occupies a small space in her house, which is close to a school in her city and works everyday for about 10 hours. Milagros believes that she is doing well because of the good prices and for the friendly service that she provides her customers. 

Milagros is very grateful to Kiva lenders. Thanks to the help provided she will be able to purchase a larger quantity of merchandise such as soft drinks, cookies, sweets, some school supplies, etc... This way Milagros will have her business well stocked and she will be able to assist more customers. She will be able to continue working and striving to achieve her big dream of becoming a big sweets shop-keeper who sells wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Nestor  Eduardo

texts.es: Néstor tiene 37 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de pasteles y al alquiler de bienes inmuebles, desde el año 2001, cuando por la necesidad de incrementar sus ingresos decidió trabajar de manera independiente. Durante 12 horas sin cesar,  trabaja Néstor con el fin de lograr sus metas de ingresos, muchas veces los productos alimenticios  que vende, no alcanzan a satisfacer la demanda de su clientela y este negocio se constituyen en un ingreso inmediato y por eso en su historia ha acudido a 7 créditos con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual  ha mejorado su inventario, incrementado sus ventas y poco a poco construirá un nuevo apartamento. Hoy está aplicando a un credikiva, pues se acercan temporadas de alta demanda y requiere comprar en mayor volumen cerdo, pollo, verduras, arroz aceite entre otros con el fin de  aumentar la producción de pasteles y generar un aumento en sus ventas que le proporcionen un mejor ingreso y esto es justamente la razón de éxito de su inversión.
texts.en:
Néstor, 37, has sold pies and has rented out properties since 2001, when he became independent and decided to increase his income. Néstor works continuously for twelve hours, with the intention to reach his goals. This business represents an important part of his income, but many times he cannot satisfy the demand. This is why he has come to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo seven times for loans to increase his stock and his sales, and to build, step by step, his new apartment.

Néstor is requesting a credikiva now that the high season is approaching and he needs to buy pork, chicken, vegetables, rice and oil, among other things, in bulk. This has the intention to increase his production of pies and his sales, aiming at higher profits that will justify his investment.

loans.use: to buy pork, chicken, vegetables, rice and oil in bulk.

loans.name: Ximena Luz

texts.es: Ximena tiene 29 años de edad y habita en la ciudad de Cartagena con sus dos hijos pequeños. Ella tiene un negocio de vender comida desde hace 3 años, cuando quedó sin empleo y debió generara de manera autónoma, sus propios ingresos para responder a los gastos de su hogar. Su negocio ha tenido un crecimiento gradual y hoy además de vender sopas y sancochos,  también ha agregado desayunos, que le generan un ingreso adicional, y le aporta un mayor bienestar a sus hijos. Sus ventas las realiza usualmente de contado,  aunque tiene algunos créditos a empleados de empresas cercanas que le compran diariamente y le pagan quincenalmente o semanalmente. En la actualidad requiere ser mas  competitiva, disminuir sus costos y su  desafío actual es tener el capital de trabajo,  para comprar en mayores volúmenes y generar una mayor producción. Esto es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento  que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará víveres y hará adecuaciones locativas para mejorar sus instalaciones y producir en un ambiente superior. Su meta de prosperidad es obtener un crecimiento ascendente y finalmente comprar su propia casa,  generando en el futuro un mayor bienestar a sus hijos, que son el motor de su vida.
texts.en:
Ximena, 29, lives in the city of Cartagena with her two young children. She has a food sales business, which she set up 3 years ago when she was unemployed she needed a way to generate her own income to pay for her household expenses. Her business has grown slowly and today, as well as selling soups and lunches, she has added breakfasts, which generate additional income and gives her children a better quality of life. 

Her sales are usually for cash, although sometimes she sells on credit to employees of nearby businesses who buy daily and pay fortnightly or weekly.

At the moment, she needs to become more competitive and reduce her costs, her current challenge is to raise working capital so she can buy wholesale volumes and improve production. This is the reason that she is applying for a Kivaloan, her first financing from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, so she can buy supplies and make minor improvements to create an improved atmosphere. Her goal is to continue growth and eventually to buy her own home and provide a better quality of life for her children, who are her motivation.

loans.use: to buy supplies and make minor improvements.

loans.name: Gladis Marina

texts.es:
Doña gladis es una mujer feliz, luchadora que a pesar de sus 51 años de edad ella no deja de soñar en grande y de vivir la vida cada minuto que pasa. Ella tiene un grado de educación primario completo es soltera y tiene 3 hijos los cuales le ayudan con las actividades del cultivo de maíz como ser: limpieza, poda, desgrane, lavado, etc.    Ella aprendió esta actividad desde temprana edad inculcada por su madre a quien ella admira considerarla un ejemplo para su familia. Ella ademas de dedicarse al cultivo de maíz también tiene otras actividades como ser la venta de refresco, pan, pollo los fines de semana. Su producto es comercializado y vendido en los alrededores de su hogar con algunos vecinos, personas que lo comercializa en pequeña escala en el mercado local y otros que a su vez aprovecha una parte para la elaboración y venta de tortillas de maíz. Esta actividad le ha dado fruto por mucho tiempo y son el único medio de ingreso que ellos tienen para el sustento como familia. Con ella vive una nuera la cual le ayuda con las actividades del hogar como ser limpieza, cocina, etc. El terreno que ella tiene lo adquirió mediante el tío hace algún tiempo para que ella pudiera trabajar de manera propia. 
  
Doña gladis solicita ayuda para poder comprar fertilizantes, abono, plaguicidas, para su cultivo ya que este próximo mes piensa sacar una parte de su cosecha la cual quiere aprovechar en su totalidad manteniendola sana y limpia de cualquier plaga.

Sus sueños a futuro es tener una amplia plantación de maíz la cual pueda seguirles dando bendiciones, sustento familiar y pueda ser trabajada de generación en generación por sus hijos ya que su anhelo es poder algún día iniciar una pequeña empresa de tortillas en bolsa.
texts.en:
Gladis is a happy, hardworking woman who, despite her 51 years, still has big dreams and lives life to the fullest. She finished elementary school, is single, and has three children, who help her with the corn growing chores: clearing, pruning, shelling, and cleaning. She learned her trade at an early age from her mother, whom she admires and considers a good example for her family.  

In addition to growing corn, Gladis also sells beverages, bread, and chicken on weekends. She sells her merchandise outside her home to neighbors, small merchants from the local market, and others who make corn tortillas. Her business has been successful for a long time and is the only income source she has to support her family. Her daughter-in-law lives with her and helps her with household chores like cleaning and cooking. With her uncle's help, Gladis was able to acquire land so that she could work for herself. 

Gladis is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, manure, and pesticides for next month's corn planting. She is thinking of harvesting part of her crops and wants to keep it healthy and free of pests. She dreams of having more land for planting corn so that she can keep providing for her family. This would also mean that the land could be worked by generations of her descendents, since she wishes to start a small business selling bags of tortillas some day.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, and pesticides for her corn plantings.

loans.name: Maria Romana

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 35 años de edad casada, luchadora, fuerte y con muchos deseos de superarse que de su matrimonio tiene 6 hijos los cuales 4 viven bajo el mismo techo de ella y estudian por la mañana y ayudan a sus padres en el piñal por la tarde al salir de sus actividades escolares. Ella tiene 5 años de educación primaria por los cuales agradece el esfuerzo impuesto por sus padres de apoyarla para que ella tuviese un conocimiento básico de estudio. Fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron desde muy pequeña el cultivo de piña y hoy en día junto a su esposo sigue practicando esta actividad la cual es medio de sustento para su familia. Ella también se dedica al comercio de la misma ya que lo vende en el mercado local, en los alrededores de la zona y con familiares, vecinos e intermediarios que conocen de su producto por su calidad, transparencia y calidad. El terreno que trabaja es propio ya que fue una herencia de parte de sus padres el cual esta ubicado a 15 kilómetros de distancia de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan en vehículo diariamente el cual es propio.

Hoy en día ella solicita ayuda para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para sus cultivos de pina los cuales ayudaran a mantenerlo sano y limpio de plagas y otros que dañen el cultivo.     

Su sueño es mantener siempre su tierra limpia y sana para que sus siembras y cultivos sean siempre productivos ya que por medio de ello podrá apoyarlos en sus estudios y sean estudiados con carreras de provecho a nivel universitario y sean sus hijos los que hereden ese patrimonio que están formando construyendo hoy en día.
texts.en:
Maria is a married 35-year-old woman, persistent and strong, with a strong desire to improve herself. From her marriage, she has six children, four of which live under the same roof with her. They study in the morning and help their parents in the pineapple fields in the afternoon, once they leave their school activities. She studied in primary school for five years, for which she is thankful for the effort required by her parents to support her so that she would have some basic knowledge. It was her parents who taught her from very young to cultivate pineapple and now, along with her husband, she performs this activity, which is the livelihood of her family. She also sells the same product in the local market, the vicinity, and to family members, neighbors, and intermediaries who know her product for its quality, transparency, and quality. The land that she works is her own since she inherited it from her parents. It is located 15 kilometers from her home to which they go in their own vehicle daily.

Currently, she is applying for help for the purchase of manure and fertilizers for her pineapple crops, which will help her to keep them healthy and clean of infestations and other things that damage the crops.

Her dream is to always keep her land clean and healthy so that her sown fields and crops are always productive, since it is through them she will be able to support her children in their studies and, once graduated, with their useful university studies. It is her children that will inherit what they are creating and building today.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer for her pineapple crops.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Nelly is 46 years old. She lives in Montserrado County, which contains Liberia's largest town Freeport and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married and has five children between the ages of 22 and 30. Some of her children attend school, and some live on their own. She has been selling dry bush meat for the past 25 years. She started this business with money given to her by her husband, and she learned the business from her mother. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dry meat for her business. In the future she wants to expand her business and build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more dry meat for her business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 35-year-old businesswoman who lives in Yei. She is married and has four children between the ages of 4 and 11.  All of them go to school.

Mary runs a business selling fish, and has been in this business for five years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking out a loan of 2000 SSP to purchase fish.  In addition to this business, she has no other source of income. 

Mary's major challenges include high prices in the market and low income in her business.

Mary says she is happy about the loans given by Finance Sudan   through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Fatu is 31 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which is has the largest free port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia.

She is single and has two children, 10 and 12 years old. Both of them are in school and live at home. She has been selling lappa (traditional West African cloth used in women's clothing) for the past four years. She started this business with money given to her by her boyfriend and she learned this business from her friend. 

Her favorite part about her business is the buying. She is requesting a loan to purchase more lappa for her business. In future she wants to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more lappa for her business.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 42 years old and married with seven children.

Lucia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, noodles, coffee, etc..

Lucia has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Lucia aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, noodles, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Kakhaber

texts.en:
Kakhaber is 26 years old. He lives in Akhaltsikhe district with his 26-year-old wife, Dali. Kakhaber requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up but without any success. His loan requests were rejected  because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 
The only source of the income for the family is from trading. Kakhaber has a mini-bus. He goes to the capital city for purchasing factory dairy products at wholesale price. He brings the products to his district to distribute in the local shops with a price markup and earns a small monthly income. 
Kakhaber requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor. They do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit,Kakhaber will purchase a car from abroad at a low cost, bring it to Georgia and resell it at a good price. This will give him a good profit which Kakhaber wants to reinvest to start a car business. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase a car from Germany at a low cost for resale

loans.name: Kafedha's Group

texts.en: Kafedha is a 36-year-old mother of seven. Her husband is also a farmer. She faces challenges in her farming business due to frequent droughts, a lack of capital and a farm too small to grow enough food for her family. She joined KOMAZA to change the environment around her farm and to help stop soil erosion. She hopes to use the income from her trees, funded through KOMAZA, to acquire more land for her farm. In her own words 'Miti Ni Mali' - trees are a resource.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Jhonatan David

texts.es:
Jonathan tiene 23 años de edad estado civil soltero tiene 1 hijos vive con su hijo vive en el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

La V.R.C Mushuc Pakari está conformada por los socios se dedica a la agricultura a 40 minutos de la oficina.

Jonathan se dedica a la venta de queso, Se dedica a la siembra de papas, habas, Además se dedica a la crianza de animales como son vacas cerdos. Utilizara el dinero del crédito para comprar urea, insecticidas, fertilizantes. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podra mejorar la agricultura. Las compras las realiza en el cantón Guaranda. El sueño es tener terreno propio. Los desafíos a los que se enfrentan en la vida es el mal clima en la agricultura. En el tiempo libre le guta pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Jhonatan is 23 years old, single, has one son whom he lives with in Canton Guaranda, in the province of Bolívar.

V.R.C Mushuc Pakari is made up of members who work in farming, 40 minutes from the office.

Jhonatan sells cheese, grows potatoes and beans as well as raises animals such as cows and pigs. He will use the money from the loan to purchase urea, insecticide and fertilizer.
 
The loan will help him to improve farming. He makes his purchases in Canton Guaranda. His dream is to have his own field. The challenge he faces in life is the bad weather in agriculture. He likes to spend his free time with his family.

loans.use: to purchase urea, insecticide and fertilizer.

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es: Desde los lunes hasta los sábados, Luis Carlos de 29 años de edad, desde hace 8 años,  se dedica a la venta de plátanos y hortalizas, actividad que aprendió desde muy niño con su padre, el que ha estado vinculado a este negocio. En la actualidad Luis Carlos vive en el municipio de Soledad con su cónyuge y su pequeño hijo, y sus ingresos dependen de su negocio. Los principales clientes  de Luis, son los tenderos y vendedores ambulantes, que ha constituido en sus compradores fijos y que le pagan de contado o a un crédito corto, mientras sus compras las realiza directamente a los campesinos. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará hortalizas y plátanos en un mayor volumen para vender de esa misma manera y con esto justamente  logrará poco a poco, convertirse en mayorista de hortalizas y plátanos, tal como es su sueño.
texts.en:
For the last 8 years, from Monday to Saturday, 29 year old Luis Carlos has sold bananas and vegetables. He learnt the trade as a child from his father, who set up the business. 

At the moment, Luis Carlos lives in the town of Soledad with his partner and young son and they depend on the business for income. Luis' main customers are grocers and travelling salespeople, who he has established as regular customers and who pay in cash or on short term credit. He buys his stock directly from the farmers.

He is applying for this Kivaloan, his first from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, so that he can buy greater volumes of vegetables and bananas to sell them in the same way and with this he will slowly become a wholesale vegetable and banana seller, which is his dream.

loans.use: to buy wholesale vegetables and bananas.

loans.name: Aida Marina

texts.es:
Aida es una mujer de 52 años, alcanzó a terminar los estudios de la escuela primaria y luego se dedicó a ayudar en su hogar, se casó siendo muy joven con Vicente un hombre agricultor de 50 años con quien tuvo 5 hijos, de los cuales solo uno depende de sus padres. Ahora Aida vive con su esposo y su hijo en la Parroquia Valle Hermoso del cantón Santo Domingo en Ecuador. Valle Hermoso es una parroquia rural en donde hay aproximadamente diez mil habitantes, es el escenario para los amantes de los deportes extremos, pues sus cascadas y ríos son los recursos naturales más adecuados para esto. Es un sitio con clima cálido y sus habitantes tienen un espíritu emprendedor impresionante. Los visitantes del lugar vienen de todas las provincias tanto como turistas o comerciantes debido a que Santo Domingo es el puerto de intercambio comercial de las Regiones Costa y Sierra del país y ha tenido un crecimiento sustentable muy notorio en los últimos años. 
Aida se dedica a la crianza de cerdos desde hace 8 años, la actividad consiste en buscar alimento para los cerdos, alimentarlos, asearlos y controlar su estado de salud periódicamente para la posterior venta de los mismos. Aida espera crecer económicamente para que el estilo de vida en su hogar mejore y así lograr que su último hijo termine exitosamente sus estudios. Ella requiere un préstamo con el cual pueda comprar un par de cerdos madres para criarlas y unirlas con los machos que tiene actualmente para que así nazcan cerdos bebés para criarlos o también venderlos en la feria de animales. El obstáculo que impidió que Aida tomara esta decisión anteriormente, fue la dificultad en encontrar financiamiento en otras instituciones financieras. Ahora con la ayuda de Fundación Alternativa podrá financiar este paso de crecimiento en su negocio, pues además de recibir el dinero de forma ágil y segura; también le capacitarán para que sea una mejor administradora de sus recursos. Aida agradece a Kiva por permitir que varias personas alrededor del mundo cooperen en el cumplimiento de este sueño.
texts.en:
Alda is a woman of 52. She finished primary school, and then she helped out in her home. When she was very young, she married Vincent, a farmer who is now 50 and with whom she had five children, of whom only one depends on his parents. Now Aida lives with her husband and their son in the Valle Hermoso parish of the Santo Domingo canton in Ecuador. Valle Hermoso is a rural parish where there are approximately ten thousand residents. It is the setting for lovers of extreme sports, since its waterfalls and rivers are the natural resources most suitable for this. It is a location with a warm climate, and its inhabitants have an impressive entrepreneurial spirit. Visitors to this place come from all the provinces, tourists as well as business people, thanks to the fact that Santo Domingo is a point of commercial exchange between the coastal and mountain regions of the country, and it has had a very renowned sustainable growth in recent years.

Aida has worked raising pigs for 8 years. The work consists of looking for food for the pigs, feeding them, keeping them clean, and periodically checking on their state of health, to later sell them. Aida hopes to grow economically so that the style of living in her home can improve and thus she can accomplish having her youngest son successfully complete his studies. She needs a loan with which she can buy a pair of mother pigs to raise and breed with the male pigs that she now has so that they can give birth to baby pigs to raise or also to sell at the animal fair. The obstacle that prevented Aida from taking this decision earlier was the difficulty in finding financing at other financial institutions. Now, with the help of Fundación Alternativa, she will be able to finance this step of growth in her business, since in addition to receiving the loan in a rapid and secure manner, they will also train her so that she can be a better administrator of her resources. Aida is grateful to Kiva for allowing various people around the world to cooperate in the accomplishment of this dream.

loans.use: to buy two mother pigs to increase production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install electricity in his home

loans.name: Exaltación De La Cruz

texts.es:
Exaltación tiene 66 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene dos hijos.  Ella vive en una comunidad muy emprendedora que trabajan en la elaboración de jarcia. Desde los 10 años de edad, comenzó a trabajar en la elaboración de hamacas, bolsos y matates de mezcal. Lastimosamente se creció sin padres; pero eso no le impidió continuar desarrollándose y se caso con su esposo procrearon dos hijos, desde hace 10 años a instalado una tienda de productos básicos y elabora hamacas de seda y poliseda. 

Para comprar los insumos, viaja en compañía de su esposo para que le ayude a cargar la mercadería, debido a que camina unos ochocientos metros para llegar a la parada de autobuses y el autobús tarda unos veinticinco minutos en llegar a su destino. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar vigas, cuartones, varas, horcones y pago de mano de obra; para mejorar su vivienda ya que esta construida de bahareque y necesita repararla antes de que llegue el invierno. 

Ella manifiesta que siempre trabajara para incorporar más productos  a su tienda y continuar elaborando las hamacas.
texts.en:
Exaltación, 66, is married and has two children. She lives in a community where many people make rigging for a living. When she was 10, she began making hammocks, bags, and grinding stones. Though she grew up without parents, it didn't keep her from developing skills. She married and had two children. Ten years ago, she set up a grocery store and also makes silk and poly-silk hammocks. To purchase supplies, she and her husband walk 800 meters to the bus stop and then travel 25 minutes to reach their destination.

She is applying to Fundación Campo for a loan to buy beams, boards, rods, and slats and to pay laborers to improve and repair the adobe house she is building before winter arrives. She says she is always working to have more items and hammocks in her store.

loans.use: to buy beams, boards, rods, and slats and to pay laborers to improve and repair the adobe house she is building before winter arrives.

loans.name: Rosa Estela

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 44 años de edad, esta casada y tiene tres hijos.  Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pupusas desde muy pequeña su madre fue quien le enseño y también administra su propia tienda de productos básicos. 

Los insumos para elaborar las pupusas las adquiere tres veces por semana y los productos para la tienda todos los sábados y viaja hasta la ciudad. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar más productos para la tienda y mobiliario para el negocio de la pupusería. Su propósito es, mejorar en gran medida sus ingresos al invertir en su dos fuentes de ingreso. Su sueño es brindarles el estudio universitario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa, 44, is married and has three children. She has made and sold pupusas [thick corn tortillas] since she was a small girl, when her mother taught her. Rosa runs her own grocery store.

Rosa buys ingredients for her pupusas three times a week, and the supplies for her store every Saturday. For this, she must travel to the city.

Rosa is requesting a loan to Fundación Campo to buy more products for her store and some furniture for her pupusería [an establishment that sells pupusas]. Her goal is to improve her income greatly by investing in two different activities. Her dream is to be able to give her children access to higher education.

loans.use: to buy more products for her store and some furniture for her "pupusería".

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is 34 years old and married to David, who contributes to the family income. They have two children to support. She has been running a grocery business for the last four years with an income of KES 14,800

This is her third loan from KADET LTD and she wants to use it to buy more vegetables for sale. She hopes to buy a lorry for transporting the vegetables as a distributor.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase items to sell like soft drinks, spices, cooking oil, cream, coffee, etc. for her general store business.

Lourdes has been in this business for 22 years. Lourdes earns additional income from food vending.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell like soft drinks, spices, cooking oil, cream, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Kahaso's Group

texts.en: Kahaso is a 42-year-old mother of nine. Her husband is also a farmer. They face the challenge of not having transportion to get their crops to the market to sell them. She would like to use the income from the trees funded by KOMAZA to buy more land and expand her farm, and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Bekbolsun

texts.ru: Бекболсун 44-летний фермер с горного села Кыргызстана. В течении многих лет Бекболсун занимается животноводством. Благодаря доходам от своего бизнеса, Бекболсун смог дать хорошее образование своим детям. На сегодняшний день Бекболсун обрабатывает 1,5 га земли. Ежегодный доход от полеводства составляет 100,000 kGS. Бекболсун обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) для подготовки к весенне-полевым работам. Планируемую прибыль Бекболсун намерен использовать для ремонта дома.
texts.en: Bekbolsun is a 44-year-old farmer from a mountain village in Kyrgyzstan. For many years, he has been working in the field of animal husbandry. Thanks to his earnings from his business, he has been able to give his children a good education. He now works a 1.5 hectare plot of land which brings in an annual income of 100,000 Kyrgyzstan Som (KGS.) Bekbolsun has approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 20,000 Som to help him prepare for spring planting. He plans to use the income generated by this loan to carry out home repairs.

loans.use: To prepare for spring field work

loans.name: Hector

texts.es: Hector de 46 años de edad habita en el municipio de Sabanalarga,  tierra donde sus oriundos dicen “La Inteligencia Es Peste.” En este lugar se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras como naranja, patilla, cilantro cebolla tomate y ahuyama. Su necesidad de incrementar su oferta, es lo que hace que acuda a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para solicitar un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a esta organización, con el cual comprará frutas tropicales como ciruela, mango, corozo, naranjas, patillas y ahuyama, así mismo adicionará pescado seco, pues se acercan la semana santa y sus clientes elaboran las mas deliciosas comidas a base de pescado y también dulces de frutas tropicales, que muy seguramente comprarán a Héctor, haciendo de su credikiva una inversión  exitosa.  Su meta mas adelante es iniciar otro punto de venta para en un futuro tener mas ingresos ahorrar y  mejorar su vivienda, que es un sueño que quiere compartir con su familia conformada por su cónyuge y sus 5 hijos en las edades de 1 a 23 años a quienes quiere proveer cada vez mas bienestar.
texts.en: Hector, who is 46 years old, lives in the town of Sabanalarga, a land whose citizens say, "Intelligence is widespread." In this place, he works selling fruits and vegetables such as oranges, watermelons, cilantro, onions, tomatoes, and squash. He needs to increase his offerings, which is what made him turn to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to apply for a Kiva loan, the first financing that he has received from this organization. He will use it to buy tropical fruits such as plums, mangoes, palm fruits, oranges, watermelons, and squash. At the same time, he will add dried fish, since holy week is approaching, and his customers prepare the most delicious dishes based on fish, as well as sweets made from tropical fruits, which they will certainly buy from Hector, making his Kiva loan a successful investment. His goal for the future is to set up another sales location so that in the future he will have more income to save and improve his home, which is a dream that he wants to share with his family, which consists of his spouse and five children, ages from 1 to 23, for whom he wants to provide increasingly more comfort.

loans.use: to buy tropical fruits such as plums, mangoes, palm fruits, oranges, watermelons, and squash

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es:
El señor óscar Antonio vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja como colector de impuesto de un centro de compra de la capital se caracteriza por ser una persona responsable, en su trabajo y con su familia.

 Don óscar solicita un crédito a ceprodel para gastos  de universidad de sus hijos ya que su prioridad es preparar profesionalmente a sus hijos.

 Oscar se siente agradecido con kiva ceprodel por con los créditos otorgados porque ha mejorado su vivienda  para mayor comodidad  de  su familia
texts.en:
Oscar Antonio lives in the city of Managua and works as a tax collector in a shopping centre in the capital. He is a responsible person at work and at home.

Oscar is requesting a loan from Ceprodel to pay for his children's university expenses as his priority is to provide them with a professional background.

Oscar is grateful to Kiva and Ceprodel for the loans he has received as the improved his quality of life and made his family more comfortable.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Madelina

texts.es:
Madelina es originaria del Municipio de San Pedro del Norte, casada, responsable, honesta, trabajadora, se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria, madre de dos hijas ambas en secundaria. 

Actualmente esta culminando su carrera de Licenciatura en Español por lo que se acerco a Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito para el pago de Módulos y tramite del titulo.
texts.en:
Madelina is from the town of San Pedro del Norte, she is married, responsible, honest, hardworking and works as a primary school teacher. She is the mother of two daughters who are both in high school.

She is currently coming to the end of her degree in Spanish, so she has approached CEPRODEL to request a loan to pay for the modules and processing of the degree.

loans.use: to pay for higher education fees.

loans.name: Juana De La Concepcion

texts.es: Juana de la Concepción, de 62 años, originaria del departamento de Chinandega  soltera, madre de dos hijos, la cual su hija menor es una niña con discapacidad y estudia en una escuela para niños con capacidades diferentes, hace 20 años inicio una pulpería con ahorros de muchos años de sacrificio,  donde vende: productos de uso diario en el hogar: productos congelados, de higiene. Ropa: interior, juvenil, niños.  Con sus hijos ella ha podido salir adelante gracias a que su negocio ha crecido a través de los años. Juana de la Concepción se levanta desde muy temprano y habré su pequeña pulpería desde las 6:00 am y cierra hasta las 10:00 pm para asi lograr vender mas y satisfacer a sus clientes. Juana solicita este crédito para aumentar la oferta de su productos,( más calidad y variedad)  agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas Kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Juana de la Concepción, 62, originally from the region of Chinandega, is the single mother of two children. Her younger daughter is a disabled girl and she is studying in a school for children with disabilities. 

Twenty years ago, she started a grocery store with savings resulting from many years of sacrifice. In her store she sells daily home use products, frozen products, hygiene products, undergarments, and children's and youth's clothing. She has been able to get ahead with her children thanks to the fact that her business has grown over the years. 

Juana de la Concepción gets up very early and opens her small grocery store at 6:00 a.m. and closes it at 10:00 p.m. so that she can sell more and satisfy her customers. Juana is requesting this loan in order to increase her supply of products (higher quality and more variety). 

She is thankful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to people with few resources and from poor countries such as Nicaragua to have a means to have dignified work.

loans.use: to buy products for personal hygiene, clothing, cosmetics, dairy products, basic grains, and more

loans.name: Roza

texts.ru: Роза 36 лет, замужем, имеет 5 детей. Роза в течении многих лет занимается полеводством, в период после сбора урожая Роза с старшими детьми и мужем уезжают в Бишкек на зароботки в весений период она с мужем обрабатывают 4,0 га земли где сажают фасоль и картофель. Благодаря упорному труду Роза в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется очень развитое хозяйство. Ежегодный доход от продажи полеводства хозяйка получает прибыль 150,000 KGS. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Роза обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку подготовку к весенне полевым работам. В ближайшее время она планирует построить сарай для скота.
texts.en: Roza is 36 years old, married, and has 5 children. For many years, she has been earning a living by growing crops. After the yearly harvest is complete, Roza, her husband, and their older children go to Bishkek to make money, and in the spring, the couple work a 4-hectare plot of land where they grow beans and potatoes. Thanks to Roza's hard work, her farm is well-developed and generates an annual income of 150,000 Kyrgyzstan Som (KGS) from the sale of produce. For the purpose of further developing her business, Roza has approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 60,000 Som so she can prepare for spring planting. In the near future, she plans to build a cattle barn.

loans.use: To prepare for spring field work

loans.name: Mahabat

texts.ru: Махабат 33 года, замужем , воспитывает 4 детей, младшей дочке 1 годик. Махабат в качестве основного дохода занимается животноводством и полеводством. Махабат имеет 0,5 га собственной земли и арендуют дополнительно землю где ежегодно сажают фасоль и картофель. Благодаря упорному труду Махабат и её семьи в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 3 дойная корова, 1 лошадь. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет 6,000 сом KGS от продажи молока и молочной продукции и около 120,000 KGS ежегодно от продажи фасоли. Доход от полеводства позволяет приобрести овец и быков в конце сезона. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Махабат обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 голов бычков и 10 голов МРС. Доходы от кредита Махабат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины в целях откорма и увеличение дохода от продажи молока , чтобы накопить средства на обучение детей.
texts.en: Mahabat is 33 years old, married, and has 4 children, the youngest of whom is a 1-year-old girl. As the main source of income for the family, Mahabat raises cattle and grows crops. She has a 0.5 hectare plot of land and rents more, where each year she plants beans and potatoes. Thanks to her hard work and the efforts of her family, today her farm includes 3 dairy cows and 1 horse. A monthly income of 6,000 Som is generated by the sale of milk and dairy products, and the sale of beans brings in around 120,000 Som annually. The money earned from the sale of produce allows her to purchase sheep and bulls at the end of the season. For the purpose of further developing her business, Mahabat has approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 70,000 Som to buy 2 bulls and 10 sheep. She plans to use the profit generated by this loan to increase her herd of livestock for fattening, as well as her earnings from the sale of milk, so that she can save up to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase 2 bulls and 10 sheep

loans.name: Cristobal Daniel

texts.es: Cristóbal  de 51 años de edad casado, padre de un niño de 9 años que cursa la primaria, Cristóbal Daniel  se  caracteriza por ser responsable, trabajador, con ganas de superación personal. Originario de unos de los puertos del departamento de Chinandega, hace 30 años que inicia su negocio, el cual  Siempre ha luchado en la vida desde muy joven pero por falta de recursos económicos no pudo lograr sus sueños como es realizar una carrera universitaria. Por lo que  trabaja día a día para brindarle a su hijo una mejor  educación que el no tuvo  hasta que logre coronar una carrera universitaria. Gracia a su capacidad de emprendedor él tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general, la cual consisten en vender ropa de niños, adultos, pantalones, camisas, vestidos, juegos de toallas, ropa interior, cosméticos, prendas de oro, adornos para el hogar él viaja a la capital a realizar sus compras. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con la compra de mercadería y satisfacer la necesidad de sus clientes, y en un futuro no lejano poder aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Cristóbal, 51, is married and is father to a 9-year-old boy who is in primary school. Cristóbal is characterized as a responsible, hard-working person with the drive for self-improvement.

He is originally from one of the ports of the region of Chinandega. He started his business 30 years ago. He has always been a fighter in life, since he was very young, but due to a lack of financial resources he was unable to achieve his dreams, such as getting a university degree. This is why he works day by day to offer his son a better education than he had, until he reaches the top: a university degree. 

Thanks to his entrepreneurial abilities, he sells general merchandise for a living, which consists of selling adult and children's clothing, pants, shirts, dresses, towels sets, undergarments, cosmetics, gold garments, and home adornments. He travels to the capitol to make his purchases. 

The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock his business with the merchandise purchased, thus satisfying his customer's demands and in the near future increasing his income.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, clothing, personal items and more

loans.name: Kalbubu

texts.ru: Калбубу 47 лет, замужем.Дети Калбубу взрослые, лишь младшая дочка которая проживает с ними учится в школе. Калбубу на протяжении 18 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Калбубу в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 1 теленок, 1 бычок и 3,0 га обрабатываемой земли. Ежемесячная прибыль с продажи молочных продуктов составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Калбубу обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Калбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en: Kalbubu is 47 years old and married. Her children are now grown, except for her youngest daughter who lives at home and goes to school. For 18 years, Kalbubu has been raising cattle and growing crops. Thanks to her hard work, her farm now includes 2 cows, 1 calf, 1 bull, and 3.0 hectares of arable land, and brings in a monthly income of 15,000 Kyrgyzstan Som (KGS) from the sale of dairy products. For the purpose of further expanding her business, Kalbubu has approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 Som to purchase cattle. She plans to use the income generated by this loan to increase her herd in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fuel

loans.name: Pastora

texts.es: Pastora es una mujer de 50 años, desde niña fue trabajadora, sin poder continuar con sus estudios, terminó la escuela primaria. Se casó muy joven, matrimonio del cual tuvo 5 hijos que ahora ya no dependen de ella, pues todos son mayores de edad e independientes. Al pasar el tiempo su matrimonio se deterioró y no hubo más salida que el divorcio, situación que causó un bajón muy grande en la vida de Pastora porque tenía que resignarse a pasar el resto de su vida sola. Sin embargo, esta mujer comenzó desde cero y con el apoyo de sus hijos decidió salir adelante trabajando, y disfrutando su vida. Ahora vive en la Parroquia Valle Hermoso del cantón Santo Domingo en Ecuador. Valle Hermoso es una parroquia rural en donde hay aproximadamente diez mil habitantes, es el escenario para los amantes de los deportes extremos, pues sus cascadas y ríos son los recursos naturales más adecuados para esto. Es un sitio con clima cálido y sus habitantes tienen un espíritu emprendedor impresionante como es el caso de Pastora que desde hace 2 años se dedicó a la crianza de ganado vacuno para la posterior venta. Esta mujer atiende todos los días a las vacas aseándolas y alimentándolas para que no presenten enfermedades y puedan ser vendidas a buen precio. La falta de capital ha sido su mayor obstáculo para que su negocio gire alrededor solo de un par de vacas. Ahora gracias a Fundación Alternativa y la intervención de Kiva podrá obtener un préstamo financiado por varias personas alrededor del mundo que creen en ella y con quienes Pastora está muy gradecida, pues cuenta que con este préstamo comprará más vacas para así tener un crecimiento con su negocio y poder ofertar más seguido en el mercado de animales.
texts.en: Pastora is 50 years old.  She has been working since she was a girl as she could not continue her education after primary school.  She married young and had five children, all of whom are now independent adults.  Over time, Pastora's marriage deteriorated and there was little else to do but divorce.  This was a very low point in Pastora's life as she had to resign herself to spending the rest of her life alone.  However, having started at zero, her children supported her and she decided to try to move ahead in life and enjoy herself.  She now lives in the Valle Hermoso parish in the Santo Domingo district of Ecuador.  Valle Hermoso is a rural parish with around 10,000 inhabitants.  It is here that extreme sports fans come to enjoy the waterfalls and rivers that are the perfect natural resource for them.  The climate is warm and the inhabitants have an impressive enterprising spirit, just like Pastora, who has been making a living raising cattle that she later sells on for the last two years.  Pastora tends to her cattle every day, washing and feeding them so that they do not become ill and can be sold for a good price.  A lack of capital has been her biggest problem, as she only normally has around two cows.  Now, thanks to Fundación Alternativa and Kiva, she will be able to take out a loan financed by various people around the world who believe in her.  Pastora is very grateful to these people as, with this loan, she will be able to buy more cows and so see some growth in her business and she will be able to sell at the market more regularly.

loans.use: to buy cows to raise and later sell.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Katupyry está en su ciclo número 3º del programa de comité, son 13 mujeres de las cuales 2 están por debajo de la línea de pobreza, ya que ellas tienen un ingreso muy bajo.
Una de estas mujeres trabajadoras es Valeria, quien cuenta que se dedica a vender comestibles de todo tipo. Comenta que se ha hecho muy conocida y que sus clientes siempre le hacen pedidos de todo lo que ella cocina. El sueño de Valeria es poder tener un día un gran puesto de comidas para seguir deleitando a sus clientes con sus ricas comidas.
Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de carnes, condimentos, verduras, y demás para seguir con sus comidas y dando ricas delicias a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group Kuña Katupyry is in its third loan cycle of the committee program. The group is made up of 13 women, two of which are below the poverty line since they have very low income levels.

One of these hard-working women is Valeria, who says she makes a living selling all types of foodstuffs. She says she has become very well-known and her customers always order everything she cooks. Valeria's dream is to one day be able to have a large food booth to continue delighting her customers with her delicious food.

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of meat, condiments, vegetables and more to continue making her food and giving tasty delights to her customers.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, vegetables and more

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a single lady who operates a business of buying and selling inner clothes such as  bras and panties. She proposes to use her KES 35,000 loan to buy more inner clothes to sell and hopes that in future, she will be able to buy a plot and educate her children. Rose sees herself as a wholesaler in five year's time and plans to use the anticipated profits to help with the daily needs of her family. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan was for KES 20,000, which she repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy inner clothes to sell

loans.name: Benjie

texts.en:
Benjie is a 31-year-old married man and a father of four young children from Talibon, Bohol. He runs a sari-sari or variety store selling various goods and items to the people in his area. 

Benjie is asking for a loan to buy additional groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, candies, biscuits, soap and toiletries. With this, he will be able to better cater to his customers and sell more products to buyers in his store.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, candies, biscuits, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 53 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Leonila is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her livestock.

Leonila has been raising livestock for six years and also earns additional income from selling clothes.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed for her livestock

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es:
La señora Mirna tiene 31  años, es comerciante y su esposo es docente, el matrimonio tiene dos hijos menores un niño  de 8 años y una niña de 3 días de nacimiento.
Se inicio en el mercado de ventas gracias a la ayuda de su madre, quien desde hace varios años tiene puesto de ventas de calzados en el mercado, gracias a ese apoyo Mirna cuenta con un puesto propio, donde lo que más vende son lencerías y bijouterie.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en su negocio, ya que renovara su stock de lencerías. Está por demás agradecida por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, ya que le permitirá ir creciendo y mejorando su estilo de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mirna is a 31 year old merchant. Her husband is a teacher and together they have 2 young children, a son who is 8 and a daughter who is 3 days old. 

She started selling at the market thanks to her mother who has had a stand for several years where she sells footwear.  With her mother’s help Mirna now has her own stand where she sells lingerie and jewelry. 

She is requesting a loan so she can invest in her business and renew her stock of lingerie. She is grateful for this opportunity as it will allow her to continue growing and improving her lifestyle and that of her family.

loans.use: restock her lingerie business.

loans.name: Karolyn

texts.en:
Karolyn is 28 years old and still single. Karolyn works in a retail business where she sells grocery items. She sells biscuits, canned goods, and spices. Karolyn wants to help her parents financially for their daily household expenditures.

Through her income from the business, Karolyn can help her parents in a simple way. She wants to expand the items she is selling to her costumers in her village. She wants to sell items that are seldom sold in her village, but they are regularly used by the people in her village. Karolyn is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy soap, shampoo, toothpaste, and dish-washing liquid. She hopes to earn a higher income from her business and be able to extend her support to her parents.

loans.use: To buy soap, shampoo, toothpaste, and dish-washing liquid

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of four children who lives in Talibon, Bohol. She has been working in a rice-farming business together with her husband for several years now. Editha is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve her farm and eventually her harvest; thus, augmenting her yield and profit. In the future, Editha hopes to make her business a success and sustainable.  Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm

loans.name: Agnes  Nyambura

texts.en:
Agnes has been doing well with her business and has applied for another loan to boost and expand her business. She has started doing bead work besides selling clothes.

She has requested a loan of KES.65,000.  She wants to use the loan to buy more beads for bead work and expand the business. She hopes to buy a machine for grinding peanuts and a plot of land to develop.

loans.use: to buy more second hand clothes and beads for her beadwork.

loans.name: Edwardo

texts.en:
Edwardo is 58 years old and is single. He is engaged in a beauty salon business where he offers hair cutting, hair coloring and catering services. Edwardo has been in this business for 30 years. He learned this type of business when he worked as a beautician in one of the beauty salons in their market.
Edwardo needs additional capital to extend his services to his customers. He is asking for a loan of P25,000 to buy highlights, hair dye and other hair treatments to use in his business. He hopes to extend the services he offers to his customers to gain higher income and help his relatives financially.

loans.use: to buy highlights, hair dye and other hair treatments to use in his business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of six children from Talibon, Bohol. Jessica has engaged in a hog-raising business for more than five years now. This is the source of her income. Her husband works as a carpenter.

Jessica is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and to buy feed for the pigs. With this, she will be able to improve her business thus augmenting her income and yield. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for the pigs

loans.name: Madres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Madres luchadoras es un grupo integrado por 14 mujeres de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, que se han unido para trabajar juntas. Hoy ya están en su ciclo 8, y quieren llegar al máximo nivel del programa para seguir ayudando a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Margarita, quien durante los ciclos ha mostrado grandes ganas de superarse y crecer para poder ayudar a su familia. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de productos de limpieza. Cuenta que se ha hecho de muy buena clientela ya que siempre hace muy buenos productos y sus clientes están muy contentos con ella.
Esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de microfranquicia de limpieza que ofrece la fundación paraguaya a las integrantes de comités, para que con ello pueda seguir haciendo sus productos y seguir generando ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
"Madres Luchadoras" is a group made up of 14 members from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso.  They have joined forces to work together and they are now on their eight loan cycle.  They want to reach the highest level of the programme so as to continue helping their families.

One of the group's members is Margarita who, at every cycle, has shown a great desire to overcome obstacles and grow so that she can help her family.

Margarita makes a living selling cleaning products.  She tells us that she has a good customer base as she always makes good cleaning products and her customers are always happy with her.

She is applying for this loan to pay for the microfranchising kit for cleaning products that "Fundación Paraguaya" offers to committee members.  With the kit Margarita will be able to continue making her products and generating an income to help her family.

loans.use: to pay for a microfranchising kit to make cleaning products to sell.

loans.name: Changawa's Group

texts.en: Changawa is a sixty-nine-year-old father of eighteen children. He and his wife are both farmers. He faces a number of challenges in his farming: frequent droughts, lack of transportation to sell his crops at the market, and a lack of land to feed his family. With the income from his KOMAZA trees, he hopes to buy some additional land to expand his farm and to educate his family.

loans.use: To pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training, and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Mdigo's Group

texts.en: Mdigo is a forty-four year old father of six. He runs a small shop from his home, and his wife farms their land. His business faces the challenge of unreliable customers who frequently ask for credit on their purchases, and his farm suffers from frequent area droughts. He hopes to use his income from his KOMAZA trees to expand his business. He would like to own a large wholesale shop in town someday!

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Maitha's Group

texts.en:
Maitha is a thirty-year-old father of four children. He owns a small kiosk and his wife farms their land. He faces the challenge of not having enough capital to stock his store, and that many of his customers request goods on credit. 

He is excited to work with KOMAZA because in his own words, "I am happy during the weeding and when the trees are a bit grown up and tall they will make good air and good environments." He plans on using the income from his KOMAZA trees to pay for school fees and to expand his small kiosk.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
Niño de Jesus está en el sexto ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras, ellas son de la ciudad de San Lorenzo. Son mujeres jefas de familia que quieren ayudar a sus familias por medio de su trabajo en equipo, es por eso que decidieron unirse y así luchar juntas.
Ana es parte de este grupo, ella se define a si misma como una persona muy creativa y que siempre supo hacer de todo por salir adelante. Ella cuenta que se dedica a hacer todo tipo de manualidades que vende y con ese ingreso aporta a la casa y trata de cubrir todo lo que pueda surgir día a día. Cuenta que le gusta mucho lo que hace ya que tiene mucha habilidad.
Ana solicita de este crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, telas, lienzo, lo que le ayudará a seguir haciendo sus manualidades y con esto seguir luchando por su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank Niño de Jesus is in its sixth loan cycle in the enterprising women’s program. They are from the city of San Lorenzo. They are all heads of their households who want to help their families through team work. For this reason they decided to band together and work together. 

Ana is a member of this group. She sees herself as a very creative person who always knows what she needs to do to get ahead. She says that she does all kinds of handicrafts that she sells and with this income she supports her household and tries to cover all the day to day expenses. She says that she really likes what she does because she is very skilled.

Ana is requesting this loan to buy thread, needles, fabric, and canvas so she can continue making her crafts and providing for her family.

loans.use: purchase thread, needles, fabric and canvas to make her crafts.

loans.name: Harmon

texts.en: Harmon is a 28-year-old married man. He has two children with ages ranging from four months to two years. He describes himself to be a polite man. He operates a van to provide transportation services. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located within a busy area, and his primary customers are residents from a peri-urban area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be having inadequate funds to improve his business. He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to pay for the renovation of his van. His business goal is to own two more vans within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM after successfully repaying a previous loan of Kes 50,000.

loans.use: To pay for the renovation of his vehicle

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is forty-nine years old. He is married to Martha and is a father of six children. He runs a kiosk and he is also a dairy farmer. He has been in this business for eleven years now and he gets monthly income of twenty nine thousand shillings.

This will be Joseph's seventh loan with KADET Ltd. He plans to use the entire loan to buy dairy cow. In future he wants to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is a merchant who makes a living buying and selling fish. She has been dedicated to this activity for more than one year, so she already has some good experience. She is known as a person with a strong desire to move up in life and help her family. 

She is requesting the loan to purchase fish, which she will use to have more fish in stock since demand is high and she wants to be able to satisfy her customers. Mwanahamisi is grateful for the help she is receiving from Kiva partner Yehu Microfinance Trust because it will be a big help.

loans.use: to purchase fish so she will have more fish in stock.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. Elenita runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. 

Elenita is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, noodles, bread and chips, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to cater for more customers in her store. In the future, Elenita hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, noodles, bread and chips, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Kunduz

texts.ru: Кундуз 29 лет, воспитывает четверых детей. В поисках источника финансирования для своей семьи, 10 лет назад Кундуз начала свой бизнес в откорме и перепродаже скота, стартовав с покупки одной дойной коровы. Молоко и молочные продукты, такие как айран (кисломолочный продукт), сметана, творог Кундуз продает на местном базаре. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве имеется 40коровы, 2 лошади и 30 овец.Такая деятельность позволяет Кундуз зарабатывать около 15,000 сом (KGS)в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кундуз обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы Кундуз планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, в будущем мечтает дать достойное образование своим детям.
texts.en: Kunduz is 29 years old and is raising four children.  In search of income for her family, 10 years ago Kunduz started her business raising and reselling livestock, starting with the purchase of one milk cow.  Kunduz sells milk and dairy products such as ayran (a yogurt beverage), sour cream and farmer's cheese at the local market.  Today, her holdings include 40 cows, 2 horses and 30 sheep.  This business allows Kunduz to earn around 15,000 som (KGS) per month.  In order to further grow her business, Kunduz turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of livestock.  Kunduz plans to invest her earning into further increasing her livestock count.  In the future she hopes to provide her children with a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Myriam

texts.es:
La Sra. Myriam es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, está en pareja con él con el Sr. Reinaldo, con quien tiene hijos, ya todos mayores e independientes que hoy están cursando la universidad.
Myrian tiene un taller de costuras en su casa y a la vez, ella y su esposo  en una empresa de confecciones de ropas. Gracias al trabajo que están haciendo educan a sus hijos, y compran todas las necesidades de su hogar.
